Passive Ability.Name: Super Luck
Passive Ability.Description: This Pokémon's critical-hit rate is increased by an additional 15%.

Absol.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, damaging opposing Pokémon and decreasing their Defense by 15% for 2s when it hits. If this boosted attack hits only a single target, it deals bonus damage.

Move 1.Name: Feint
Move 1.Description: The user dashes in an arc forward, damaging opposing Pokémon and increasing the user's basic attack speed by 60% for 0.5s when this move hits. This move ignores the Defense and shield effects of opposing Pokémon hit. Each use alternates between a rightward and leftward arc.

Upgrade 1.Name: Night Slash
Upgrade 1.Description: Dash in an outward arc, dealing damage to enemies. If this first attack hits, a second attack can also be performed. The second attack has the user dash straight ahead, dealing damage to enemies and increasing the user's critical-hit rate. The lower the enemies HP, the more the user's critical-hit rate is increased. The first use is a rightward arc forward from the perspective of the orange team (right-side team, which has the map flipped horizontally when in battle).
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Restores the user's HP for 50% of damage dealt with the second dash hit.

Upgrade 2.Name: Pursuit
Upgrade 2.Description: Dash to the designated location and quickly charge an enemy with the next basic attack. (Basic attack range is doubled while this effect is active). If the basic attack lands from behind, its damage is increased and this move's cooldown is reduced. When the user has an empowered attack readied, nearby opposing Pokémon have their backs highlighted.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the user's movement speed by 35% for 2s after using this move and before using the empowered attack.

Move 2.Name: Slash
Move 2.Description: The user slashes in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon hit. This move's critical-hit rate is increased by 15%.

Upgrade 1.Name: Psycho Cut
Upgrade 1.Description: Attack with blades formed by psychic power that decrease the movement speed of enemies for a short time when this move hits. Also increases basic attack damage dealt to the affected enemy for up to 3 attacks after this move hits. The critical-hit rate of the psychic slash and consumed marks is increased by 15%. The marks can be cleansed.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the user's movement speed by 20% when an opposing Pokémon is marked by this move.

Upgrade 2.Name: Sucker Punch
Upgrade 2.Description: Look for an opening to attack an enemy, decreasing the movement speed of the user and the target enemy for the duration. After a short time, charge forward to attack the enemy. However, if the user receives damage or gets attacked before it charges, attack immediately and shove the enemy.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the user's basic attack speed by 40% for 3s after using this move.

Unite Move.Name: Midnight Slash
Unite Move.Description: The user briefly becomes unstoppable before becoming untargetable and invulnerable for 1.15s while unleashing a flurry of 5 slashes in front of themself in the designated area, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect. The user then becomes unstoppable again and unleashes a final slash in front of them with 3 blades of energy, shoving opposing Pokémon and dealing damage, up to 4 times at close range and down to 1 time at maximum range.
Unite Move.Buffs: 80% Movement Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Stance Change
Passive Ability.Description: Aegislash can switch between Sword Stance and Shield Stance. Using a blade move switches stance to Sword Stance; which increases Attack, movement speed by 5%, and Attack Speed by 15%. Using a shield move switches stance to Shield Stance; which increases Defense and Sp. Defense and reduces Attack Speed by 20%. After switching stances, movement speed and basic attack speed are further increased by 15% for 3.5s.

Aegislash.Attack: When in Sword Forme: slashes at opposing Pokémon, damaging those hit. When in Shield Forme: rams at opposing Pokémon, damaging those hit. Becomes a boosted attack if the boost count is at 1 or more, consuming 1 boost count; the boosted attack changes based on the current Forme. The boost count caps at 4, and boosted attacks remain readied until used. As a boosted attack in Sword Forme: pierces through the target, damaging opposing Pokémon hit. As a boosted attack in Shield Forme: slams into the target, damaging opposing Pokémon hit and stunning them for 0.1s; restores HP, and reduces the cooldown of Sacred Sword or Shadow Claw by 1s when it hits.

Move 1.Name: Shadow Sneak
Move 1.Description: Casts a shadow toward the designated location, damaging opposing Pokémon hit. After hitting an opposing Pokémon or traveling maximum distance; warps to the shadow’s location, damaging opposing Pokémon at the location. Increases the boost count by 1 if the warp hits an opposing Pokémon.

Upgrade 1.Name: Sacred Sword
Upgrade 1.Description: Aegislash thrusts its blade into the ground, creating a triangular zone. This zone erupts with a hidden power, dealing damage to enemies in the area and throws them. Also increases boost count by 1 for each enemy hit (capped at 2 for wilds, 4 for players). At the same time as the eruption, Aegislash slashes forward, dealing additional damage to enemies hit. For a short time after this slash hits, damage dealt by Aegislash partially ignores the Defense of all enemies. Increases the boost count by 1 for each target hit by the triangular zone erupting (up to 2 from hitting wild Pokémon).
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases Attack by 50 for 3s after the triangular zone hits.

Upgrade 2.Name: Shadow Claw
Upgrade 2.Description: Aegislash slashes with its blade twice in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies hit. Follow up with a final rising slash that deals damage to enemies hit and throw them. Boost count increases by 1 when at least one of the three slashes hits. Increases the boost count by 1 if this move hits.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases critical-hit rate by 20% for 1s after the final slash.

Move 2.Name: Iron Defense
Move 2.Description: Envelops the user in a powerful protective force for up to 3s, blocking the next attack. Increases the boost count by 1 when this move blocks an attack.

Upgrade 1.Name: Wide Guard
Upgrade 1.Description: Focus in place for a short time to create a great shield on Aegislash. When this shield appears, boost count increases by 1, granting a shield to Aegislash and shoves enemies in front. While this shield is active, enemy player attacks increase boost count by 1 for each different enemy player (capping at 4). When this move ends, shove enemies in front of Aegislash once again. Increases the boost count by 1 unconditionally when granting the shield effect. Increases the boost count by 1 more for each instance of damage received by the shield effect (up to 2 times). Increases boost count by 1 more if an opposing Pokémon is shoved at the end or unconditionally when the shield effect is depleted before it can end normally.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Reduces this move's cooldown by 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Iron Head
Upgrade 2.Description: Dash in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies hit. Also increases boost count by 1, and protects Aegislash with a special shield for a short time afterward. This shield doesn’t protect from hindrances, but it can nullify damage. When the shield blocks an attack, it disappears and boost count is increased by 1. Increases the boost count by 1 unconditionally after barreling forward. Increases the boost count by 1 more if the shield blocks an attack.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases Attack by 10% for 3s when the special shield blocks an attack.

Unite Move.Name: Coup de Grace
Unite Move.Description: Becomes unstoppable and unleashes a ground-splitting slash in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon in the line area of effect, dealing additional missing HP damage to those hit.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Flash Fire
Passive Ability.Description: When this Pokémon takes Sp. Atk-based damage from opposing Pokémon, the damage this Pokémon takes is reduced by 20% for 3s, and their next auto attack deals additional damage. This Ability goes on a 10s cooldown after it ends.

Armarouge.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage.

Move 1.Name: Incinerate
Move 1.Description: Has the user attack the designated opposing Pokémon with a flame, setting them ablaze and dealing damage over time for 4s. When a Pokémon on the opposing team that's ablaze picks up a Berry, the Berry's effects are halved.

Upgrade 1.Name: Fire Spin
Upgrade 1.Description: Has the user generate a fierce vortex of fire around themself, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon hit. Each time Armarouge deals damage while Fire Spin is active, gain a shield. This shield can stack up to six times. Gain 20% movement speed while the vortex is active. The vortex lasts 3s, and its duration is increased by 1s if the user hits opposing Pokémon with an auto attack. This extended duration can stack up to 3 times, to a total vortex duration of 6s. Moving towards an enemy will additionally increase movement speed by 10%.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Upon using Fire Spin+, gain 3 stacks of shields.

Upgrade 2.Name: Armor Cannon
Upgrade 2.Description: Has the user combine their shoulder armor and start charging power. When charged past a minimum duration, the user then fires a blazing ball of flame. The user releases a shock wave in front of themself when firing, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon in close range. The fired ball of flame explodes when it hits an opposing Pokémon or after it travels a set distance, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon and leaving them unable to act for 0.45s. The user's Defense and Sp. Def are decreased by 5% while this move is on cooldown.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the range of this move and auto attacks.

Move 2.Name: Will-o-Wisp
Move 2.Description: Has the user shoot a flame in the designated direction, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon hit, leaving them burned and decreasing their movement speed by 20% for 2s. After using this move, the user's next auto attack becomes a boosted attack.

Upgrade 1.Name: Flame Charge
Upgrade 1.Description: Has the user cloak themself in flame and charge in the designated direction, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon the user hits and shoving them for 0.45s. When this move hits an opposing Pokémon, the user is granted a shield for 3s and this move's cooldown is reduced by 20%. For 3s after using this move, the cannon gauge becomes full and will not decrease after boosted attacks are used.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Reduces the damage the user receives by 20% for 3s after this move hits an opposing Pokémon.

Upgrade 2.Name: Psyshock
Upgrade 2.Description: Has the user materialize odd psychic waves to attack in three areas of effect in front of themself, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon hit while ignoring 35% of their Sp. Def. The third attack throws opposing Pokémon hit for 0.7s. Multiple of the areas of effect can hit the same opposing Pokémon but the second damage instance will be reduced by 25% and the third by 50%. For 3s after using this move, the cannon gauge becomes full and will not decrease after boosted attacks are used.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases this move's area of effect.

Unite Move.Name: Psykaboom
Unite Move.Description: Has the user jump up, becoming unstoppable for 1.85s, and charge psychic power for 1s, then create an area that leaves opposing Pokémon unable to act. While the user is charging psychic power, the Unite Move can be used again to adjust the position of the area. The user then fires a ball of flame towards the center of the area, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon and throwing them away from the center of the area.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Huge Power
Passive Ability.Description: When this Pokémon hits only a single enemy with an auto attack, a move, or their Unite Move, the hit is always a critical hit. However, when hitting two or more enemies at once with an auto attack, a move, or its Unite Move, the hits are never critical hits. Critical hits deal 170% rather than 200%.

Azumarill.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage to enemies within a cone area of effect in front of this Pokémon.

Move 1.Name: Tackle
Move 1.Description: Charge forward; dealing damage to any enemy hit and leave them unable to act for 0.5s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Play Rough
Upgrade 1.Description: Increases movement speed for a short time and changes the next basic attack. When Azumarill performs their next basic attack, lunge at one enemy in range and deliver repeated blows; dealing damage to that target and leave it unable to act for a short time. Using Play Rough will overwrite any active Aqua Tail attack change. Play Rough attacks count as auto attacks for the purpose of items, lifesteal and other benefits.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Further increases movement speed to 35% when this move is used, and also reduces this move’s cooldown by 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Water Pulse
Upgrade 2.Description: Shoot a pulsing blast of water in front of Azumarill. When the blast of water hits an enemy, decrease that Pokémon’s movement speed and deal damage to all enemies in an area of effect around the initial target hit. The blast of water then automatically bounces to another target if one is available. Including the first target, the blast of water can bounce between up to 3 targets consecutively, and each hit behaves in the same way as the first. While the blast of water is traveling, Azumarill can perform a short rolling dash in a designated direction.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increase the maximum number of targets that the blast of water can bounce between by 2.

Move 2.Name: Bubble
Move 2.Description: Spray bubbles in a cone dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect and decreasing their movement speed by 30% for 2s. This move can be used while moving.

Upgrade 1.Name: Whirlpool
Upgrade 1.Description: For a short time, four small whirlpools appear that swirl around Azumarill as they move. If a whirlpool hits an enemy, the whirlpool deals damage and restores Azumarill's HP. If a whirlpool hits an enemy player, an increased amount of HP is restored. Moving clockwise against your target will grant more hits against that target, and counter-clockwise will reduce the number of hits.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Reduces this move’s cooldown by 2s and increases the amount of HP restored.

Upgrade 2.Name: Aqua Tail
Upgrade 2.Description: Increases the speed and area of effect of Azumarill's next 3 basic attacks. If these basic attacks hit from a distance, they also deal increased damage, restore Azumarill's HP, and can ignore the Defense stat and shield effects of enemies hit. Aqua Tail attacks count as auto attacks for the purpose of items, lifesteal and other benefits.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Aqua Tail attacks that hit from a distance reduce the cooldown of all moves by 0.8s.

Unite Move.Name: Belly Bash
Unite Move.Description: Azumarill targets an enemy player and then pounds their belly three times; losing 5% remaining HP with each pound in exchange for a 6.5% max HP shield that stacks with each pound and lasts 6s. Azumarill gains 60 Attack for 5s and can move while pounding their belly. Azumarill then charges at the target damaging and throwing all Pokémon hit while charging and Pokémon within the area effect around the target. Azumarill is unstoppable during this move.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Torrent
Passive Ability.Description: Increases Attack and Sp. Attack by 20% while at half HP or less.

Blastoise.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing 3 instances of damage, slowing enemies hit by 50% for 1s, and reducing Blastoise’s move cooldowns by 1s.

Move 1.Name: Water Gun
Move 1.Description: Blastoise shoots a jet of water in a straight line; damaging, knocking back, and stunning enemies hit for 0.5s. Enemies hit are also slowed by 30% for 1s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Hydro Pump
Upgrade 1.Description: Has the user attack by blasing out a huge volume of water, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon and shoving them when it hits.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increased damage.

Upgrade 2.Name: Water Spout
Upgrade 2.Description: Spouts water toward the designated location, decreasing the movement speed of opposing Pokémon in the area of effect for a short time.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increased damage.

Move 2.Name: Skull Bash
Move 2.Description: Blastoise dashes forward damaging and stunning all enemies hit for 0.5s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Surf
Upgrade 1.Description: Has the user charge forward on a wave, shoving enemies and leaving them unable to act. The user becomes immune to hindrances while using this move and can jump in a designated direction once this move ends.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Blastoise gains a small shield for 4s when hitting an enemy with Surf.

Upgrade 2.Name: Rapid Spin
Upgrade 2.Description: Has the user spin rapidly, changing the mechanics of its basic attacks as well as its Hydro Pump and Water Spout moves.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Blastoise gains a massive amount of Def and SpDef for the duration of the spin.

Unite Move.Name: Hydro Typhoon
Unite Move.Description: Blastoise gains a shield for 4s and sweeps powerful water jets in a large circle around itself dealing massive damage and throwing enemies hit into the air for 1.5s. Blastoise is unstoppable during this move.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 40% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Blaze
Passive Ability.Description: When this Pokémon hits an enemy with an auto attack or move, that enemy will receive a fire fragment. Hitting an enemy that has a fire fragment 5 times with a basic attack or move will deal additional damage and restore the user's HP. When this Pokémon's HP is at half or lower, more HP is restored.

Blaziken.Attack: Deals damage to nearby enemies. While in Kick Style, basic attacks have a higher area-of-effect and reach. While in Punch Style, attack speed is increased by 40%. For the purpose of auto attacks, Torchic is treated as punch style while Combusken is treated as kick style. Once Blaziken has access to their Unite move, they can swap between styles.

Move 1.Name: Aerial Ace
Move 1.Description: Dash in a designated direction, dealing damage to enemies that come in contact with the dash. If this move hits an enemy, this move may be used again once within 4 seconds before being put on cooldown.

Upgrade 1.Name: Fire Punch
Upgrade 1.Description: Unleash 2 flaming punches in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies hit. The designated direction can be changed during this move. When the user hits an enemy with this move, for a short time, this move can be used once more.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases damage dealt.

Upgrade 2.Name: Overheat
Upgrade 2.Description: Become Unstoppable, reduce incoming damage by 25%, and charge power in place in a designated direction. If used again, unleash a flaming kick in the designed direction, dealing damage to enemies hit. The longer the duration the charge is held for, the more damage this move deals. If the user charges a certain amount of power (when the gauge reaches the line indicator), this move also shoves enemies hit.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases damage dealt.

Move 2.Name: Ember
Move 2.Description: Release a small ball of fire in the designated direction, dealing damage in a small area around the first enemy hit and decreases their movement speed by 50% for 1s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Focus Blast
Upgrade 1.Description: Fire a ball of focused energy in the designated direction. The ball of focused energy explodes upon hitting an enemy or after traveling a set distance, dealing damage to enemies  in the explosion's area-of-effect and decreasing their movement speed by 35% for 2s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the movement speed decrease to 60%.

Upgrade 2.Name: Blaze Kick
Upgrade 2.Description: Jump backwards then kick while leaping towards a designated location, becoming Unstoppable during the jump and kick animation. Deal damage to enemies hit by the kick and shove them. The shoved enemies will have their movement speed decreased by 25% for 2s. If the shoved enemies come in contact with a wall, they will be stunned instead for 1s. Blaze Kick cannot go over walls.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the movement speed decrease to 50%. Increases the stun duration to 1.5s if hitting a wall.

Unite Move.Name: Spinning Flame Fist
Unite Move.Description: Perform a flaming punch around itself, dealing damage to nearby enemies hit and increase the user's movement speed by 20% for 4s. After using this move, the user switches to Punch Style and all Punch Style cooldowns are reset.
Unite Move.Buffs: 12% Max HP Shield; Has an internal cooldown of 30s to activate Energy Amplifier; Has an internal cooldown of 60s to activate Buddy Barrier;

Passive Ability.Name: Natural Cure
Passive Ability.Description: Automatically cleanses this Pokémon every 6s, even if there are no effects to cleanse.

Blissey.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack after 6s, dealing increased damage. This boosted attack remains readied until used.

Move 1.Name: Pound
Move 1.Description: The user pounds in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and decreasing their movement speed by 40% for 2s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Egg Bomb
Upgrade 1.Description: Hurls an egg at the designated location. The egg then explodes, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect and throwing them. If the user learns both Soft-Boiled and Egg Bomb, the uses kept in reserve for Egg Bomb is added to Soft-Boiled's reserve pool; this reserve pool is shared between both moves. The base cooldown for both moves becomes 5s. The cooldown between using the same move remains at 2s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Decreases the movement speed of opposing Pokémon hit by 40% for 2s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Helping Hand
Upgrade 2.Description: For a short time, greatly increases the user's and nearby allies movement speed and basic attack speed. While this move's effects last, all of the user's basic attacks become boosted attacks.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the auto attack damage of all teammates buffed by this move by 15% for 4s.

Move 2.Name: Heal Pulse
Move 2.Description: The user restores the HP of themself and a designated teammate every 0.5s over 2s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Soft-Boiled
Upgrade 1.Description: Throws an egg to an ally, restoring its HP as well as the user's HP. A maximum of 3 uses can be kept in reserve for this move and cannot be used more than once every 2s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Gains 1 additional use kept in reserve.

Upgrade 2.Name: Safeguard
Upgrade 2.Description: Blissey grants both the targeted ally and themself a shield, purging hindrances and making both immune to hindrances as long as the shield lasts.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Strengthens the value of the shield effect.

Unite Move.Name: Bliss Assistance
Unite Move.Description: The user becomes unstoppable and dashes to the designated ally Pokémon to give it an egg, granting that ally a shield and increasing their Attack and Sp. Atk by 20% for 6s. The user also intercepts 50% of the post-mitigation damage received by that ally as unmitigated damage for 6s. While dashing, opposing Pokémon hit are damaged and thrown into the air for 0.8s. When reaching the target ally, nearby opposing Pokémon are damaged again.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Beast Boost
Passive Ability.Description: When Buzzwole knocks out an enemy player, movement speed is increased by 100% and basic attack speed increased by 50% for 3s. When Buzzwole assists in knocking out an enemy player, movement speed is increased by 50% and basic attack speed increased by 25% for 3s. Each time Buzzwole hits an enemy with basic attacks, Mega Punch, Lunge, or Smack Down - muscle gauge increases. Conversely, when Buzzwole has been out of combat for 10s, muscle gauge depletes by 1 increment every 5s. Up to 6 muscle gauge increments can be stored.

Buzzwole.Attack: Each time a basic attack hits an enemy, increase muscle gauge by 1 increment. Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, throwing two consecutive punches while restoring Buzzwole's HP and increasing muscle gauge by 1 increment for each hit.

Move 1.Name: Mega Punch
Move 1.Description: Jump in the designated direction before slamming the ground with a powerful punch. The shock from the punch deals damage to enemies in the area. Muscle gauge increases by 1 increment for each target hit.

Upgrade 1.Name: Lunge
Upgrade 1.Description: Lunge in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies, decreasing their Attack by 30% for 2.5s and slowing them by 30% for 1s. If this move deals damage, muscle gauge increases by 1 increment for each enemy hit. After this move is used, Buzzwole's basic attack speed is increased by 30% for 2s. Holds 2 uses in reserve and cannot be used more than once every 1s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Whenever this move hits enemy players, Buzzwole's Attack increases by 10% for 2s for each player hit (up to a max of 5 stacks).

Upgrade 2.Name: Smack Down
Upgrade 2.Description: Deliver an uppercut punch in the designated direction, dealing damage and throwing the first Pokémon hit into the air. While the target is airborne, Buzzwole can activate this move again to perform a follow-up attack that smacks the target to the ground, dealing damage to all enemies in an area centered on the airborne enemy. When this move deals damage, muscle gauge increases by 1 increment for each enemy hit.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Widens the area-of-effect in which damage is dealt when the grappled enemy slams the ground. Additionally, muscle gauge will now increase by 2 increments for each enemy player hit from the slam.

Move 2.Name: Fell Stinger
Move 2.Description: Consumes the entire muscle gauge and has the user deal damage to an enemy in the designated direction, briefly shoving and stunning them for .2s. The damage dealt by this move increases for each muscle gauge increment consumed at a rate of 12.5% per increment. If this move knocks out an enemy, the user recovers 10% of maximum HP.

Upgrade 1.Name: Leech Life
Upgrade 1.Description: Grab and restrain an enemy in the designated direction, becoming unstoppable and dealing damage-over-time while restoring Buzzwole's HP. When this move is used, consume the user's entire muscle gauge. The number of hits and the amount of damage dealt per hit increases for each muscle gauge increment consumed. Number of hits starts at 4 and increases by 1 per 2 increments of muscle gauge consumed. Initial damage increases by 1.5% per muscle gauge increment. This move ends if Buzzwole becomes unable to act for any reason or if the restrained enemy escapes by using an Eject Button or through some other means. Against Unstoppable Targets: Only 1 instance of damage and healing will occur, equal to 5 hits.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Also causes each instance of damage dealt by this move to be stronger than the last by 5% additively.

Upgrade 2.Name: Superpower
Upgrade 2.Description: Consumes the entire muscle gauge and has the user run in the designated direction and grab an enemy. The user then slams the target down on the ground at full strength, dealing damage to all enemies in the area. If Buzzwole is successful in grabbing a target, Buzzwole receives a shield that lasts for 2s. Buzzwole is unstoppable during this move. The damage dealt by this move is increased at a rate of 12.5% per muscle gauge increment.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Reduces the cooldown of this move by 3s when the user's muscle gauge reaches maximum.

Unite Move.Name: Ultra Swole Slam
Unite Move.Description: Buzzwole flies at high speed, dealing damage to enemies in the area-of-effect. Afterward, the user targets the enemy with the lowest percentage of HP remaining among those hit and charges down at them from the sky, dealing area damage once again and additional damage to the targeted enemy based on their missing HP. Buzzwole is Unstoppable during this move.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Weak Armor
Passive Ability.Description: When the user takes Attack-based damage, Ceruledge's movement speed is increased by 10% for 3s. This effect can stack up to 2 times. If Ceruledge deals damage to enemies with basic attacks or moves, the enemy hit receives a wound. Life energy leaks out of these wounds for 3s, causing damage on hit and then every 0.5s. This effect can stack up to 6 times, each stack after the first adding 50% of the first stack's damage and refreshing the duration of the damage over time. If the effect stacks 6 times on an enemy, that Pokémon takes 15% increased damage from Ceruledge.

Ceruledge.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage.

Move 1.Name: Lava Plume
Move 1.Description: Torch the area around the user with an inferno of scarlet flames, dealing damage to enemies hit. The user's next basic attack deals 15% increased damage.

Upgrade 1.Name: Bitter Blade
Upgrade 1.Description: Ceruledge focuses bitter feelings towards the world of the living into a slashing attack. The user recovers HP equals to 40% of the damage dealt with this move. Damage dealt to wild Pokémon only heals for half of the normal amount. Any HP recovered that exceeds the user's max HP is converted into a shield.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the amount of HP recovered to 55% of damage dealt.

Upgrade 2.Name: Psycho Cut
Upgrade 2.Description: Ceruledge launches a blade formed by psychic power in the designated direction, dealing damage and slowing enemies hit by 30% for 3s, and reducing their Defense for 4s. If Ceruledge hits enemies with a basic attack, this move's cooldown is reduced by 0.5s.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the Defense reduction of enemies hit by this move.

Move 2.Name: Take Down
Move 2.Description: Has the user charge recklessly in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies hit. The user's basic attack speed is increased by 20% for 3s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Phantom Force
Upgrade 1.Description: Dash and disappear into darkness, where Ceruledge hides for 1s. While hiding, Ceruledge cannot move. When this move is used again or after 1s has passed, the user appears in the designated direction while slashing around themself, dealing damage that ignores Defense and shields of enemies and applies a 60% slow to them. If this move hits an enemy, this move's cooldown is reduced by 40% of the max cooldown.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Reduces this move's cooldown by 2s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Flame Charge
Upgrade 2.Description: Ceruledge cloaks themself in flame and charges in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies hit. Ceruledge's basic attack speed is increased by 30% for 3s after using this move. A maximum of 2 uses can be kept in reserve for this move. There is a 1 second cooldown between each use, which is reduced with cooldown reduction.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Ceruledge's basic attack speed is instead increased for 5s after using this move.

Unite Move.Name: Revenant Rend
Unite Move.Description: Ceruledge charges both of their arm blades gaining unstoppable for 0.5s before slashing through to the designated location faster than the eye can track. Ceruledge leaves enemies hit unable to act for 0.7s and applies a mark to them. After 0.7s, Ceruledge slices marked enemies with three slashing blows. The mark can be cleansed, preventing the damage.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Infiltrator
Passive Ability.Description: When this Pokémon deals damage, receive a stacking buff that makes Special damage dealt by this Pokémon ignore 2.5% of Special Defense per stack. This buff lasts 4s, can stack up to 8 times, and the duration refreshes when gaining a new stack.

Chandelure.Attack: Gains a Boosted Attack every 5s, dealing increased damage, slowing enemies by 30% for 2s and burning enemies hit for 2.5s.

Move 1.Name: Ember
Move 1.Description: Shoot out a small flame, dealing damage to Pokémon it hits, slowing them by 30% for 2s and leaving them burned for 2.5s. After the first cast, this move may be used again within 5s before going on full cooldown. Burns tick every 0.5s for 5 damage ticks.

Upgrade 1.Name: Flamethrower
Upgrade 1.Description: Shoot an intense blast of fire in the designated direction, dealing damage to Pokémon and leaving them burned for 2.5s. The end of the blast explodes, dealing increased damage. If the explosion hits a Pokémon, this move's cooldown is reduced by 65% of its current cooldown. Burns tick every 0.5s for 5 damage ticks.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: If the explosion hits a Pokémon, Chandelure deals 20% increased damage for 3s. This effect also applies to the triggering explosion itself.

Upgrade 2.Name: Overheat
Upgrade 2.Description: Throws consecutive flames in an arc into designated areas up to 3 times by holding the move input down. Pokémon in the area are hit and are left burned. The area may be aimed and changed during the use of this move. When one of the flames hits a Pokémon, the user gains one heat energy. If this move is used again, an exploding flame is shot out, dealing damage to Pokémon based on the heat energy and leaves them burned. The exploding flame hitting with 0, 1 or 2 heat energy reduces the cooldown of this move by 75%, 50% or 30% respectively. After the follow-up attack, the user cannot use basic attacks for a short time. Burns tick every 0.5s for 5 damage ticks.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: This move's cooldown is reduced by 1s.

Move 2.Name: Night Shade
Move 2.Description: Makes Pokémon in the area of effect see a frightening mirage, dealing damage to them and marking them. When Chandelure deals damage again to the marked Pokémon, the marked Pokémon are stunned for 1s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Poltergeist
Upgrade 1.Description: Create a zone of mysterious power and mirages of floating furniture.  Pokémon that come in contact with a mirage take damage.  Pokémon that come in contact with a mirage or the edge of the zone are slowed by 65% decaying to a 40% slow over 1s. Then the 40% slow lingers for an additional second.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the slow to 80% for 1s decaying to 50% for 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Imprison
Upgrade 2.Description: Creates a zone in front of itself lasting 4s. The first enemy caught in the zone will be immobilized for 0.7s. Furthermore, all enemy Pokémon in the zone or enter the zone become imprisoned and cannot use Moves.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Changes the Imprison to briefly immobilize all Pokémon caught in the zone on creation.

Unite Move.Name: Ignite Midnight
Unite Move.Description: Reduce the vision of enemies around itself by 30% for 3s. If this Unite Move is used again, Chandelure continuously fires a beam of fire in a designated direction, dealing damage to Pokémon it hits. The beam may be redirected while firing and its final blast deals increased damage. Ignite Midnight can be cancelled early.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 40% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Blaze
Passive Ability.Description: While at 50% max HP or below, this Pokémon's critical-hit rate is increased by 20%.

Charizard.Attack: Breathes fire at opposing Pokémon, dealing damage 4 times per basic attack. Charizard may move while attacking but is slowed by 5% while breathing fire. Charizard deals additional damage to opposing Pokémon that have been burned by the user's moves. This additional damage cannot land critical hits; additional damage benefits from regular lifesteal. Basic attacks gain increased range upon evolving into Charmeleon and into Charizard. Against wild Pokémon: total damage is capped at 250 per hit. CHARIZARD'S BASIC ATTACKS ARE A SET ANIMATION LENGTH. ATTACK SPEED HAS NO EFFECT ON THIS POKÉMON. DO NOT USE RAPID FIRE SCARF ON CHARIZARD.

Move 1.Name: Flame Burst
Move 1.Description: The user attacks with a flame in the designated direction which bursts on the first opposing Pokémon hit or after traveling max distance, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and burning them for 4s (dealing damage 5 times). When this move hits, the user's movement speed is increased by 20% for 3s. The Attack of opposing Pokémon burned by this move is decreased by 5%.

Upgrade 1.Name: Flamethrower
Upgrade 1.Description: Attack with an intense blast of fire. When this move hits, it leaves enemies burned and increases the user's movement speed for a short time. The Attack of opposing Pokémon burned by this move is decreased by 5%.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the damage of this move and its burns.

Upgrade 2.Name: Fire Punch
Upgrade 2.Description: Punch with a fiery fist, dealing damage and shoving enemies when it hits. Also leaves the enemies it shoves burned. The Attack of the target burned by this move is decreased by 5%.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Reduces this move's cooldown by 0.4s per target hit every time the user's basic attack hits an opposing Pokémon. (1.6s total for an entire basic attack animation on a single target).

Move 2.Name: Fire Spin
Move 2.Description: The user shoots fire in the designated direction which bursts into a vortex of fire on the first opposing Pokémon hit or after traveling max distance, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect. The vortex of fire remains for 5s, dealing damage over time to opposing Pokémon in the area of effect every 0.5s (up to 10 times) and decreasing their movement speed by 25% for 1s when hit.

Upgrade 1.Name: Fire Blast
Upgrade 1.Description: Blasts intense, all-consuming fire, dealing damage over time to enemies while the flames continue to burn on the ground and decreasing the movement speed of enemies for a short time.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the damage of this move and the damage over time.

Upgrade 2.Name: Flare Blitz
Upgrade 2.Description: Charge forward cloaked in fire, granting the user a shield and throwing enemies hit.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Decreases the movement speed of the target by 40% for 3s when this move hits.

Unite Move.Name: Seismic Slam
Unite Move.Description: The user briefly becomes unstoppable and grabs the designated Pokémon from the opposing team. The target is bound, and the user and the target become invincible as the user flies up then slams them onto the ground, damaging the target and nearby opposing Pokémon, dealing an additional 8% max HP damage to each opposing Pokémon hit. The user gains hindrance resistance the moment they slam into the ground and fly up into the air for 7.5s. While flying in the air, the user is able to use basic attacks and move freely over obstacles. Unite Move basic attacks burn opposing Pokémon for 1s (dealing damage 2 times). The user restores HP for 80% of the damage dealt with Unite Move basic attacks (excluding burns or additional damage). Damage dealt by burns from Unite Move basic attacks also benefit from regular lifesteal.
Unite Move.Buffs: 50% Movement Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Blaze
Passive Ability.Description: When at 50% max HP or below, increases critical-hit rate by 10% and auto attack speed by 20% for 5s (30s CD). When hitting an opposing Pokémon with an auto attack or move, places a cinder on the target for 5s; applies 2 cinders with boosted attacks and moves. When placing a 5th cinder on a target, consumes the cinders, dealing additional damage to the target.

Cinderace.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack or after using a move, dealing increased damage. Boosted attacks remain readied until used. Against wild Pokémon: basic attack damage is capped at 1000; boosted attack damage is capped at 1300.

Move 1.Name: Ember
Move 1.Description: Shoots a small flame at the designated opposing Pokémon, damaging the target and burning them for 3s (dealing damage 3 times). The Attack and Sp. Atk of the burned target are decreased by 5% for 2s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Pyro Ball
Upgrade 1.Description: Kick a ball of flame in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies and leaving them burned for a short time when this move hits. The Attack and Sp. Atk of burned opposing Pokémon are decreased by 5% for 2s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Reduces the cooldown of Flame Charge or Feint by 3.5s when this move hits.

Upgrade 2.Name: Blaze Kick
Upgrade 2.Description: Perform a fiery flying kick. This move is always a critical hit, and it shoves enemies and leaves them burned for a short time. In addition, become immune to hindrances while using this move. The Attack and Sp. Atk of the burned target are decreased by 5% for 2s.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases basic attack speed by 65% for 3s when this move hits.

Move 2.Name: Low Sweep
Move 2.Description: Dashes forward with a low sweep, damaging opposing Pokémon in their path.

Upgrade 1.Name: Flame Charge
Upgrade 1.Description: Charge forward cloaked in flame, dealing damage to any enemy hit.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: The next boosted attack after this move ends decreases the movement speed of the opposing Pokémon hit by 30% for 2s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Feint
Upgrade 2.Description: Increases movement speed for a short time and become invincible.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: The next 3 auto attacks after dodging restore HP for 30% of damage dealt.

Unite Move.Name: Blazing Bicycle Kick
Unite Move.Description: Becomes unstoppable and kicks up a giant ball of flame, then kicks it toward the location of the designated opposing Pokémon. The ball releases a fierce shock wave upon impact, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect, dealing additional missing HP damage to those hit; and increasing movement speed by 10% for 5s when this Unite Move hits.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 35% Attack Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Magic Guard
Passive Ability.Description: This Pokémon receives a shield when restoring an ally Pokémon's HP. The strength of this shield is proportional to 50% of the amount of HP restored.

Clefable.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage.

Move 1.Name: Heal Pulse
Move 1.Description: Immediately restores HP to itself and nearby allies.

Upgrade 1.Name: Moonlight
Upgrade 1.Description: Clefable continually restores HP to themself and nearby allies for a short time. Clefable's movement speed is increased while this move is active.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Widens this move’s area-of-effect and increases the duration of its effects by 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Draining Kiss
Upgrade 2.Description: Clefable attacks nearby enemies with an energy-draining kiss. Each enemy hit by the kiss receives damage and releases an air kiss. These air kisses will travel to a nearby ally with the lowest HP and restore their HP. If no allies are nearby, the air kisses will return to the user and restore Clefable's HP instead.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Widens this move’s area-of-effect and increases the amount of HP restored to 160% of the damage dealt.

Move 2.Name: Disarming Voice
Move 2.Description: Let out a charming cry, dealing damage to nearby enemies and decreasing their movement speed by 40% for 2s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Gravity
Upgrade 1.Description: Has the user create a gravity zone centered on itself that persists for a set amount of time. Inside the gravity zone, Clefable's auto attacks change and deal increased damage. Enemies in the zone have their movement speed decreased which becomes stronger whenever a set amount of time passes. These enemies are also unable to use dash moves. If an enemy attempts to enter the zone with a dash move, the dash move is stopped and that enemy is left unable to act for a short time.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Widens this move’s area-of-effect and increases the duration of its effects to 4s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Follow Me
Upgrade 2.Description: Clefable moves to the designated location while waving its finger receiving a 3s shield. Attention of enemies hit and enemies near the designated location are drawn. These drawn enemies are forced to approach the user and attack Clefable with their auto attacks for 2s.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases Clefable's Defense by 150 for 3s and Sp. Def by 100 for 3s when this move is used.

Unite Move.Name: Wonder Wish
Unite Move.Description: Clefable waggles their finger, restoring HP to allies in the area-of-effect. The lower an ally's HP is, the more HP this move restores to that ally. Afterward, Clefable gets a random move that can be performed by using the Unite Move again within 10s.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Triage
Passive Ability.Description: Increases movement speed by 25% when near ally Pokémon at 50% max HP or below. Stores up to 8 flowers; consumes all flowers when using Synthesis, Floral Healing, or Sweet Kiss while attached, boosting their effects. Gains 1 flower every 1.5s. Gains 4 flowers when entering tall grass while detached (5s CD). Attaches to a designated ally Pokémon when using Synthesis, Floral Healing, or Sweet Kiss while detached, granting a Triage shield effect to the ally based on Comfey's max HP. While attached: becomes untargetable, restores 1% max HP every 1s; takes Aeos energy gained in excess of the maximum the ally can hold, and scores the same amount of Aeos energy into a goal as the ally if not using a move while the ally channels the score. Detaches from the ally in the designated direction when the button to return to base is used (or a separate detach button on mobile). When detaching: removes the Triage shield effect from the ally; becomes invincible for 0.5s, and readies a boosted attack.

Comfey.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage and gaining 2 flowers when it hits.

Move 1.Name: Synthesis
Move 1.Description: If detached attaches to the designated ally Pokémon and grants them a Triage shield effect. If attached to an ally Pokémon: restores the HP of the ally. Restores additional HP with for each flower that is consumed (up to 8 flowers).

Upgrade 1.Name: Floral Healing
Upgrade 1.Description: If detached: attaches to the designated ally Pokémon and grants them a Triage shield effect. If attached to an ally Pokémon: restores the HP of the ally; restores additional HP for each flower that is consumed (up to 8 flowers). Converts any HP restored in excess of the ally Pokémon’s max HP into an overheal shield effect for 5s when this move is used (up to 4 times, refreshing duration with additional uses); adds additional value to the overheal shield effect for each additional flower that is consumed.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: While attached: increases the movement speed of the ally Pokémon by 30% for 2s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Sweet Kiss
Upgrade 2.Description: If detached: attaches to the designated ally Pokémon and grants them a Triage shield effect; adds additional shield value to the Triage shield effect with Sweet Kiss. If attached to an ally Pokémon: charges power for up to 2.5s, reaching maximum charge after 1.5s; then infatuates opposing Pokémon in the area of effect when released for a minimum of 0.6s. Increases the range of this move with charging. Infatuated Pokémon are unable to act and approach the user against their will. Infatuates opposing Pokémon hit for an additional 0.1s for each flower that is consumed (up to an additional 0.8s with 8 flowers; maximum 1.4s). (Note: it is impossible to use Sweet Kiss with fewer than 2 flowers due to the rate of gaining flowers and the cooldown reduction cap.)
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: While attached: increases the movement speed of the ally Pokémon by 40% for 2s while charging power.

Move 2.Name: Vine Whip
Move 2.Description: Strikes out with whiplike vines in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon in the line area of effect and decreasing their movement speed by 40% for 2s when it hits. While attached to an ally: increases this move's range.

Upgrade 1.Name: Magical Leaf
Upgrade 1.Description: Launches 3 curious, scattering leaves every 1s for 5s (up to 18 leaves) at random opposing Pokémon in the area of effect (even when in tall grass or in stealth), prioritizing Pokémon from the opposing team; damaging opposing Pokémon and applying a mark to them for 4s when hit by a leaf. When a marked target is damaged by 6 leaves, stuns them for 0.5s. While attached to an ally: increases this move's range of targeting.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the number of leaves launched to 4 leaves every 1s (maximum 24 leaves).

Upgrade 2.Name: Grass Knot
Upgrade 2.Description: Unleashes vines in the designated direction, damaging up to two opposing Pokémon hit and immobilizing them. If this move hits two opposing Pokémon within 75% of the full range; pulls the second target to the first target's location and deals additional damage to both. While attached to an ally: increases this move's range.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases this move’s area of effect.

Unite Move.Name: Flowery Fields Forever
Unite Move.Description: Briefly becomes unstoppable and creates a large area of tall grass around their location for 6s. Pokémon in this tall grass cannot be seen, just as with other tall grass on the map. Restores the HP of teammates in this Unite Move's tall grass every 0.5s.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Gulp Missile
Passive Ability.Description: This Pokémon can catch some form of prey in their mouth when entering Whirlpool, Surf, or Dive. When receiving damage, counterattacks by spitting the prey in their mouth at an opposing Pokémon, damaging them and bouncing to 1 other opposing Pokémon nearby. When above 50% max HP, catches Arrokuda as prey, which also decrease opposing Pokémon's Defense by 20% and Sp. Def by 5% for 3s. When below 50% max HP, instead catches Pikachu as prey, which decrease opposing Pokémon's movement speed by 50% and attack speed by 10% for 1s.

Cramorant.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every fourth attack, catching some form of prey. This boosted attack spits prey at an opposing Pokémon, damaging them and bouncing to 1 other opposing Pokémon nearby.

Move 1.Name: Whirlpool
Move 1.Description: The user creates a whirlpool at a designated location, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect over 1.8s (up to 10 times). The area of effect shrinks in size over the duration; opposing Pokémon standing at the outer edge of the whirlpool are hit only up to 3 times. The movement speed of opposing Pokémon in the area of effect is decreased by 50% for 0.2s when hit. The user can enter the whirlpool to catch prey for Gulp Missile (up to 2 times).

Upgrade 1.Name: Surf
Upgrade 1.Description: Attacks with a wave that deals damage to enemies. Once the wave has traveled its full distance, it returns the way it came, dealing damage to enemies once again and pulling them back with the wave. The user can also catch Arrokuda or other prey by entering the wave. The user catches prey with the first wave, and can enter the returning wave to catch more prey for Gulp Missile.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: The first wave decreases the movement speed of opposing Pokémon hit by 40% for 3s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Dive
Upgrade 2.Description: Changes the designated area into a puddle and has the user dive to that area, dealing damage to enemies and shoving them when they're hit. The user also catches Arrokuda or other wild Pokémon as they emerge from the puddle. A maximum of 3 uses can be kept in reserve for this move. The user catches prey for Gulp Missile as they emerge from the puddle.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the damage of the dive.

Move 2.Name: Feather Dance
Move 2.Description: The user throws a circle of feathers at the designated area, decreasing the Attack of opposing Pokémon in the area of effect by 30% and their movement speed by 20% for 4s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Hurricane
Upgrade 1.Description: Creates a fierce wind, dealing damage to enemies that get caught in it and throws them.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the user's movement speed by 20% for 3s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Air Slash
Upgrade 2.Description: Shoot out many blades of air while moving backward to create distance. Deals damage to enemies in the area of effect and reduces this move's cooldown when it hits.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Restores the user's HP for each blade of air that hits an opposing Pokémon.

Unite Move.Name: Gatling Gulp Missile
Unite Move.Description: The user becomes unstoppable for up to 6.5s and catches a series of prey to spit at the nearest Pokémon from the opposing team or wild Pokémon up to 10 times. The user cannot move or use moves while using Gatling Gulp Missile. The user can use this Unite Move again to cancel it early. The prey caught for each Gatling Gulp Missile attack depends on the user's current HP.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Max HP Shield granted at the start of the Move, 30% Movement Speed granted at the end of the turret

Passive Ability.Name: Sturdy
Passive Ability.Description: For every 7% missing HP, this Pokémon's Defense and Sp. Def are increased (up to 10 times; maximum at 70% missing HP or more).

Crustle.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and decreasing their movement speed by 40% for 2s.

Move 1.Name: Rock Slide
Move 1.Description: The user drops large rocks at the designated location, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and stunning them for 1s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Rock Tomb
Upgrade 1.Description: Splits open the ground toward the designated area, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect and creating a barricade of rock. Activating this move again removes the barricade. The user can use this move again to destroy the wall of rock early.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Strengthens the movement speed decrease from this move to 80%.

Upgrade 2.Name: Shell Smash
Upgrade 2.Description: Convert a set percentage of Defense and Sp. Defense into Attack and Sp. Attack and increase movement speed for a short time. All modifiers (except emblem color bonuses) work with 0 base Defense and Sp. Def for the duration of this buff.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Strengthens the conversion rate from lost Defense and Sp. Def to bonus Attack and Sp. Atk to 50%.

Move 2.Name: Fury Cutter
Move 2.Description: The user slashes once with their claw while dashing slightly in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon hit. Targets hit by Fury Cutter receive a mark for 9s that stacks with subsequent Fury Cutter hits (up to 3 times). Subsequent hits of this move on marked targets have 20% increased damage (maximum 40% increased damage on the third and subsequent hits from this move). Additional stacking damage from this move is always rounded up.

Upgrade 1.Name: Stealth Rock
Upgrade 1.Description: Throws many small rocks. When a rock hits an enemy or when the rocks have flown their full distance, a zone of many levitating rocks is created dealing slowly-increasing damage over time to enemies in the area of effect. Additional stacking damage from subsequent hits for each trap is always rounded up.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: The trap of levitating rocks remains for 1s longer; this move can hit up to 10 times (maximum 135% increased damage on the tenth hit). Also decreases the movement speed of opposing Pokémon hit by 35% for 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: X-Scissor
Upgrade 2.Description: Dash forward with crossed claws, dealing damage to enemies multiple times and shoving them. Leaves enemies unable to act if they hit an object when shoved.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Reduces this move's cooldown by 1s.

Unite Move.Name: Rubble Rouser
Unite Move.Description: The user becomes unstoppable as they summon a whirlwind of rocks around them, gaining a shield, damaging nearby enemies and stunning them for 1s. For 10s after, the whirlwind of rocks damage nearby opposing Pokémon every 1s. If the user receives damage during Rubble Rouser, the user deals additional revenge damage to nearby opposing Pokémon (2s CD).
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 40% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Bad Dreams
Passive Ability.Description: When an enemy is forcibly put to sleep near Darkrai, Darkrai deals damage to the target and gains a boosted attack. When Darkrai uses this boosted, every enemy that has been marked with bad dreams in the last 2.7s is attacked simultaneously.  Sleeping enemies near Darkrai take damage over time, and Darkrai deals 10% more damage to them while they remain asleep. Damage from this Ability doesn't wake up sleeping enemies.

Darkrai.Attack: Basic attacks made against sleeping enemies will become boosted attacks with greatly increased range. Boosted attacks deal damage to enemies with an attack from a void and restore Darkrai's HP. Darkrai does not require vision to perform a boosted attack against a sleeping target.

Move 1.Name: Hypnosis
Move 1.Description: Send a hypnotic suggestion in the designated direction, dealing damage to the first enemy it hits. After 1s, the enemy will fall asleep for 2s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Dark Void
Upgrade 1.Description: Fire a ball of darkness at an enemy. Additional balls of darkness will be thrown at each enemy within in the area of effect. Enemies hit will be dealt damage and marked. The mark lasts 5s. When Darkrai deals damage to marked enemy, the marks are removed and the Enemy falls asleep for 2s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Applies a 40% slow for 3s when applying a mark to an enemy.

Upgrade 2.Name: Shadow Claw
Upgrade 2.Description: Slash in a designated direction with sharp claws made from shadows, dealing damage in a line, applying a 40% slow for 3s and marking enemies hit. When the user deals damage twice to marked enemies, that marked enemy falls asleep for 2s and has their mark removed. When this move hits, this move can be used again. The second use of this move hits a designated target with huge claws, dealing damage. If there are any opposing Pokémon suffering from Bad Dreams, the second use of this move will deal increased damage.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the damage dealt by this move.

Move 2.Name: Calm Mind
Move 2.Description: The user focuses their mind, increasing their Special Attack and Special Defense by 30% for 3s and Movement Speed by 50% for 3s, decaying by 10% every 0.5 seconds to a minimum of 10%.

Upgrade 1.Name: Nasty Plot
Upgrade 1.Description: Dash a short distance, gaining a Nasty Plot counter for 7s and refreshing the duration of all current counters. Upon using a basic attack, consume all nasty plot counters to deal damage to one of the targets hit. Upon using a boosted attack, turn the boosted and all nasty plot counters into a series of projectiles, hitting every target of Darkrai's boosted. A maximum of two counters may be held. Nasty Plot has no cooldown between dashes.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Gain one charge of this move in reserve when an enemy falls asleep.

Upgrade 2.Name: Dark Pulse
Upgrade 2.Description: Hide in a shadow and create additional shadows around the hiding spot. Darkrai may freely move between the shadows. When this move is used again and held, the move ends and Darkrai appears from the shadow it dealt damage from. When this move is used again but is not held or after 4s elapses, Darkrai appears from the shadow they are currently hiding in, deals damage to enemies hit, then returns to the original shadow. Dark Pulse may then be used one more time if the move was only tapped. Darkrai will leave the shadow after 4s, dealing damage to all enemies in the shadow that Darkrai appears from. While hiding, Shadow Claw may be used to attack from the shadow that is being hidden in. Shadow Claws used this way will not apply the Shadow Claw mark to targets hit and deals reduced damage.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Dealing damage with this move causes Darkrai to gain a shield for 2.5 seconds.

Unite Move.Name: Worst Nightmare
Unite Move.Description: The user becomes unstoppable and casts a sleeping spell on the designated Pokémon from the opposing team. If the target is successfully put to sleep, the user's moves' cooldowns are reset, the target is marked to receive 3% max HP damage over time every 0.5s over 10s (up to 21 times; maximum 63% max HP damage as Sp. Atk-based damage), and the user sends that target into a nightmare realm centered on their initial location for up to 8s. The user follows the target into the nightmare realm. While inside the nightmare realm, Darkrai and the target are unaffected by goal zones, jump pads, and Berries. Other Pokémon outside of the nightmare realm cannot target Darkrai or their target while they're inside.
Unite Move.Buffs: 80% Movement Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Long Reach
Passive Ability.Description: Deals 20% increased damage to distant enemies.

Decidueye.Attack: Increases the speed of auto attacks by 3% for 2.5s after one hits. This effect can stack up to 4 times, and with every third activation of this effect, auto attacks become boosted attacks for a short time. These boosted attacks fire more quills, but the damage dealt by each quill is decreased.

Move 1.Name: Leafage
Move 1.Description: Pelts leaves in the designated direction, dealing damage in a cone to enemies hit (only hits once). For a short time after using this move, Decidueye’s Attack is increased by 10% (this also affects Leafage) and auto attack speed is increased by 25% for 3s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Razor Leaf
Upgrade 1.Description: Summons whirling razor leaves. For a short time after using this move, Decidueye’s Attack and basic attack speed are increased, and basic attacks can target multiple enemies for a short time.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the basic attack damage the higher the enemies remaining HP is.

Upgrade 2.Name: Spirit Shackle
Upgrade 2.Description: Charges power before firing quills in the designated direction. Damage dealt increases the longer power is charged, but movement speed is decreased while charging. If this move hits after power is charged to the maximum, it can stitch enemies to the ground. The affected Pokémon receives damage upon moving a set distance from that location, and their movement speed is decreased for a short time.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Deals 15% increased damage to enemies with less than 50% remaining HP.

Move 2.Name: Astonish
Move 2.Description: Deals damage to enemies and decreases their movement speed by 80% for a short time.

Upgrade 1.Name: Leaf Storm
Upgrade 1.Description: Creates a tempest of sharp leaves, dealing damage to enemies it hits and decreases their movement speed for a short time. At point-blank range, it also shoves enemies hit.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Movement speed decrease now lasts 3.5s but still decaying up to four times at 10% per 0.5s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Shadow Sneak
Upgrade 2.Description: Creates a shadow that takes hold of one enemy in the area of effect, dealing damage and decreasing their movement speed and Defense for a short time. Also increases Decidueye’s movement speed for a short time.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Defense reduction of enemies is increased to 80%.

Unite Move.Name: Nock Nock
Unite Move.Description: Fires quills in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies but does not pierce through them. The move ends by unleashing a large quill that deals damage to all enemies it hits (30% more damage if the target is below 50% HP) but Nock Nock can be cancelled early. While using this move, Decidueye becomes unstoppable but is unable to move.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Max HP Shield granted at the start of the Move, 30% Movement Speed granted at the end of the turret

Passive Ability.Name: Blaze
Passive Ability.Description: When using a move when below 50% max HP, that move deals additional damage with a fireball to enemies (15s CD).

Delphox.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage when it hits.

Move 1.Name: Ember
Move 1.Description: Shoot a small flame in front of itself, dealing damage to enemies hit.

Upgrade 1.Name: Fire Blast
Upgrade 1.Description: Launch an intense, all-consuming fire in a forward direction; dealing damage to enemies hit. As the fire travels, it leaves behind a zone of flames in which a delayed explosion will occur, dealing damage to enemies in the area-of-effect.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Damage increased.

Upgrade 2.Name: Mystical Fire
Upgrade 2.Description: Unleash a special, hot ball of fire in a forward direction. If it hits an enemy, the fire will explode; dealing damage to enemies in the area-of-effect.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Also reduces cooldowns of all moves if this move hits by 1s. If it hits an enemy player, cooldowns are reduced even further (1.5s).

Move 2.Name: Will-o-Wisp
Move 2.Description: Conjure up sinister flames and launch them toward the designated area. These flames then explode, dealing damage to enemies hit by the explosion and decreasing their movement speed by 30% for 2s. An enemy will only be counted as being hit by one flame and one explosion, even if all 3 flames visually hit.

Upgrade 1.Name: Fire Spin
Upgrade 1.Description: Create a vortex of fire in the designated area. The vortex automatically moves toward the nearest enemy, dealing damage-over-time to all enemies caught in the area for a short time and decreasing their movement speed by 30% for 5s. After 4.5s passes or an enemy is caught in the center of the vortex; the flames increase in intensity. This increases the rate at which the flames deal damage and also leaves the enemies unable to act for 1s. This trapped damage ticks four times total. The Fire Spin will otherwise deal damage as it travels. Move placement on top of enemies will apply a "searching" tick and then apply "trapped" damage. A maximum of 9 ticks is possible.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Applies a debuff on trap activation that increases all damage dealt by Delphox by 15% for 3s. Debuff is only cleansable after the first tick of trap damage and does not re-apply the debuff.

Upgrade 2.Name: Flame Charge
Upgrade 2.Description: Charge forward in the designated direction. If there are any enemies in range when the charge ends, summon three flames to attack. The flames deal damage and decrease enemy movement speed for a short time. This move can be used while also using Fire Blast or Mystical Fire.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases Delphox's movement speed by 30% for 1.5s when this move is used.

Unite Move.Name: Fanciful Fireworks
Unite Move.Description: Deals damage-over-time to enemies in the designated area for 8s. Enemies that are hit have 50% decreased movement speed and 50% reduced HP recovery effects for 1.75s. Recovery effects are weakened within the zone and cannot be cleansed while in the zone. Leaving the zone will have the weakened HP recovery effects linger for 1.75s and may be cleansed after leaving the zone. 8s duration (ticks at 0.5s intervals).
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Run Away
Passive Ability.Description: This Pokémon receives 10% increased movement speed when within a radius of enemy Pokémon. While moving, the sprint gauge charges from 0 to 10 (2% increased movement speed per increment). At full, Dodrio runs at 20% increased movement speed. If movement speed is decreased below a threshold, the sprint gauge will rapidly deplete. When Doduo scores a goal, it evenly divides its collected Aeos energy into two portions and deposits them into the goal one at a time. As Dodrio, this is split into three portions to deposit in the goal one at a time. Only goals made by a full emptying of the Aeos Ball will count towards stacking items.

Dodrio.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack. Attacking with a full sprint gauge turns the attack into a charge in the facing direction. If the sprint gauged attack hits an enemy, all cooldowns are reduced by 1s.

Move 1.Name: Peck
Move 1.Description: Jabs forward with Doduo's beaks. When using the move, Doduo stops moving and loses sprint gauge due to dropping below the sprint gauge gaining threshold. When the sprint gauge is full, Doduo charges forward to jab the in the facing direction and fully consumes the sprint gauge.

Upgrade 1.Name: Tri Attack
Upgrade 1.Description: Dodrio attacks with their beaks in a cone in front of themself, dealing damage to enemies and applying one of the following random effects to enemies hit: decrease Attack and deal damage-over-time for a set amount of time, deacrease auto attack speed, or decrease movement speed. When the sprint gauge is full, Dodrio instead shoots out 3 projectiles in a designated direction. If a projectile hits an enemy, the project deals damage and applies one of the aforementioned effects based on its color. After this move is used, Dodrio's next auto attack deals additional damage and restores HP. Holds 2 uses in reserve and cannot be used more than once every 1s. Burn: 8% Attack decrease for 2s, 12% Attack decrease if Sprint empowered. Paralyze: 8% Attack Speed decrease and 10% Movement speeed decrease for 2s, 12% Attack Speed decrease and 15% Movement speed decrease if Sprint empowered. Freeze: 20% Movement speed decrease for 2s, 40% if Sprint empowered.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: The next auto attack gains additional healing by 3% of max HP. When using full sprint gauge attack the charge time for this move is additionally reduced by 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Drill Peck
Upgrade 2.Description: Dodrio moves forward while striking with their sharp beaks multiple times, dealing damage to enemies hit. When the sprint gauge is full, Dodrio instead dashes forward while striking with their sharp beaks multiple times, dealing damage to enemies hit and shoving them. Using this move fully consumes the sprint gauge.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Reduces base cd by 2s and restores a portion of Dodrio's HP equal to 30% of damage dealt by the flat damage (percent damage excluded).

Move 2.Name: Quick Attack
Move 2.Description: Dash forward, increasing the user's movement speed by 30% for 2s and dealing damage to enemies hit. This move's cooldown is reduced by 1.5s if it hits an enemy.

Upgrade 1.Name: Agility
Upgrade 1.Description: Become immune to hindrances for a short time and fully charge the sprint gauge. Afterward, movement speed is increased for a short time, and the sprint gauge charges faster.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Fully charges the sprint gauge on use.

Upgrade 2.Name: Jump Kick
Upgrade 2.Description: Dodrio leaps forward while kicking. If this move makes contact with an enemy or obstacle, Dodrio leaps over it and stomps the ground when landing, dealing damage to enemies in the area-of-effect and decreases their movement speed for a short time and the sprint gauge charges. If this move makes contact with an enemy, this move's cooldown is reduced.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Enemies in the area of the landing are also stunned for 1s.

Unite Move.Name: Triple Trample
Unite Move.Description: Dodrio runs to a designated location. If Dodrio makes contact with an enemy while running, they are dealt damage and thrown into the air for 1s. When Dodrio arrives at the designated location, Dodrio gains 25% increased Attack and loses 5% Sp. Attack for 3s, is granted a 10% Max HP shield for 3s, and the sprint gauge charges faster for 6s. Damage dealt at the designated location is affected by the Attack bonus. Dodrio is unstoppable during this move.
Unite Move.Buffs: 80% Movement Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Clear Body
Passive Ability.Description: Reduces the duration of debuffs inflicted on this Pokémon.

Dragapult.Attack: Becomes boosted attacks when the boosted attack gauge is full, dealing increased damage in an area of effect centered on the opposing Pokémon they hit. Each time the user deals damage to opposing Pokémon, the boosted attack gauge increases by 1, becoming full when the user deals damage 8 times. After not dealing damage for 3s, the boosted attack gauge decreases by 2 every 0.5s.

Move 1.Name: Astonish
Move 1.Description: Lets out a sound blast in a forward direction. The shout explodes when it hits an enemy or after traveling a set distance, dealing damage in an area and decreasing enemy movement speed by 30% for 2s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Dragon Breath
Upgrade 1.Description: Exhales a mighty gust in the designated direction, dealing damage to Pokémon in the area of effect and decreasing their movement speed. The gust also leaves the ground burning for a set amount of time. Pokémon in this area of effect take damage over tim and have their movement speed decreased for a short time. If this move is used while the uesr is flying with Dragon Dance, the mighty gust is exhaled along Dragon Dance's flight path, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and the decreasing their movement speed for a short time.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Deals increased damage and increases the slow to 45% for 2s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Shadow Ball
Upgrade 2.Description: Hurls a shadowy blob in the designated direction, dealing damage to Pokémon it touches and applying a mark to them. When marked Pokémon are hit by Dragapult, they receive additional damage. The fourth time the marked Pokémon is hit, the mark is removed, but the damage dealt by the attack is further increased and the user recovers HP. After using this move, the user moves a short distance in a designated direction.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the damage of this move and the additional damage from marks.

Move 2.Name: Quick Attack
Move 2.Description: Dashes in the designated direction, increasing basic attack speed by 40% for 2s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Dragon Dance
Upgrade 1.Description: Flies in a circular pattern in the designated direction. While flying, it continuously deals damage to nearby enemies with basic attacks that deal less damage but have increased attack speed. If this move is used again while the user is flying, the user stops flying and moves a short distance in the designated direction. If the user knocks out an enemy, this move's cooldown is reset. If the user assists in a knock out, this move's cooldown is reduced by half. When this move is used, Dragon's Breath's cooldown is reset When this move is used, Dragon Breath's cooldown is reset.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: While the user is flying, auto attacks restore the user's HP for an additional 25% of damage dealt.

Upgrade 2.Name: Phantom Force
Upgrade 2.Description: For a short time, increases the user's movement speed and enters stealth. While the user is in stealth, the boosted basic attakck gauge increases. When stealth ends, Dragapult's basic attack speed is increased for a short time. After this move is learned, if the user knocks out an enemy, this move's cooldown is reset and Dragapult's Attack is increased by 6 until the end of battle. This Attack increase can stack up to 8 times. When this move is learned, if the user knocks out a Pokémon from the opposing team, this move's cooldown is reset and the user's Attack is increased by 8 until the end of the battle (up to 10 times; maximum 80 bonus Attack).
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Reduces this move's cooldown by 0.5s per opposing Pokémon hit by the user's auto attacks.

Unite Move.Name: Dreep and Destroy
Unite Move.Description: The user launches two Dreepy at up to 2 different opposing Pokémon in range, damaging them and dealing additional missing HP damage to each target. If there is only one target in range, the second Dreepy deals 30% of the full damage to the target. A maximum of 2 uses can be kept in reserve for this Unite Move; there is a 2s cooldown between uses for this move.
Unite Move.Buffs: 10% Max HP Shield, 10% Movement Speed for 3s; Has an internal cooldown of 30s to activate Energy Amplifier; Has an internal cooldown of 60s to activate Buddy Barrier;

Passive Ability.Name: Multiscale
Passive Ability.Description: When damaged by an enemy player, gain a buff that reduces damage taken by 30% for 2.5 seconds. This ability has a 15 second cooldown.

Dragonite.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, blasting water in front of Dratini, dealing increased damage, reducing the cooldown of Dratini's moves by 1s, and recover 5% max HP when this hits.

Move 1.Name: Twister
Move 1.Description: Creates a twister and releases it in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies hit and decreases their movement speed by 50% for 1s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Dragon Dance
Upgrade 1.Description: Dash in a designated direction, in one of three cycling patterns. After using this move, grant a buff increasing attack speed, movement speed, Attack by 8% (capping at 24%), as well as increasing the stage of Hyper Beam. This buff stacks up to 3 times, and the duration is reset to full on reuse. All stacks are removed after a few seconds. Basic attacks reduce the cooldown of this ability by 1s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Further increases Dragonite's movement speed by 10% for 4.5s if there are enemies nearby when the dance ends.

Upgrade 2.Name: Extreme Speed
Upgrade 2.Description: Dash toward the designated location stopping upon contact with an enemy, dealing damage and throwing them.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: If Dragonite's movement speed is currently decreased when this move is used, that movement speed decrease is negated before the move is used.

Move 2.Name: Dragon Breath
Move 2.Description: Exhale a mighty gust in the designated direction. If this move hits an enemy, Dragonite's next attack becomes a boosted attack.

Upgrade 1.Name: Hyper Beam
Upgrade 1.Description: Fires a beam of energy toward the targeted enemy after a delay, dealing damage to all enemies that it hits, as well as additional damage based on their Max HP. The move changes Stages based on the number of stacks of Dragon Dance that Dragonite has, from 0 to 3. The Max HP damage is 5%/10%/15%/20%, determined by the current Stage.  Dragonite cannot act during the duration of this move. Against Wild Pokémon: The additional damage from max HP is capped at 600/1200/1800/2400 depending on the stage.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Reduces damage taken by 50% while charging this move.

Upgrade 2.Name: Outrage
Upgrade 2.Description: Dragonite begins rampaging for 5s. This move starts with a ground stomp, dealing damage to enemies in an area around Dragonite. While rampaging, all of Dragonite's basic attacks become a melee boosted attack, alternating through the water, electric, and fire boosted attack types. When the rampage ends, Dragonite is left briefly unable to act.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Reduce the duration of hindrances inflicted on Dragonite while rampaging by 40% for 5.5s.

Unite Move.Name: Draco Impact
