Unite Move.Description: Briefly fly up in the air, becoming untargetable, before crashing down, approximately 2s after activating, with several comets on a designated area, dealing damage and throwing enemies in the area for 0.5s. The farther Dragonite flies, the more the Unite gauge is consumed (50% at min distance and 100% at max). Dragonite is unstoppable while using this move.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 35% Attack Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Heavy Metal
Passive Ability.Description: Prevents Duraludon from being thrown or shoved by the first attempt to throw or shove them. This ability goes on cooldown after it's triggered (50s cd).

Duraludon.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, shooting a long beam that deals a large amount of damage to all enemies hit.

Move 1.Name: Laser Focus
Move 1.Description: Reduces damage received by 20% for .6s. Afterward, Duraludon's auto attacks deal additional damage to enemies hit. This buff expires after 8s or after 3 auto attacks.

Upgrade 1.Name: Flash Cannon
Upgrade 1.Description: Duraludon ruptures the ground around themself and in a designated direction; dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect and decreasing their movement speed by 50% for 1s. Afterward, go into "Cannon Mode" rooting Duraludon for 6s or if a basic attack is not made for 2.5s or this move can be cancelled early. While in Cannon Mode, basic attacks have longer range, attack speed is increased by 100% but decays by 20% per second over 5 seconds, dealing increased damage and splash damage. Exiting "Cannon mode" will prematurely remove the attack speed buff. Metal Claw, Stealth Rock, Dragon Tail, and boosted attacks can be used while in this mode and boosted attacks decrease the movement speed of enemies hit by 60% for 1s and also pierce.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Enemies in the ruptured ground's area of effect are also unable to act for 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Dragon Pulse
Upgrade 2.Description: Charges power before dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect. Duraludon's movement speed is decreased while charging, but the longer power is charged, the wider the move's area of effect becomes and the more damage it deals. After learning this move, a damage marker will be attached to any enemy Duraludon damages. When Dragon Pulse hits a marked enemy, it deals additional damage to that target for each damage marker attached to it, then removes all of the damage markers. In addition, if this move knocks out an enemy, the cooldown is reduced by 50% and the next 3 basic attacks will each deal additional damage and further reduce this move's cooldown when they hit.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Also restores 8% of Duraludon's max HP if this move knocks out an enemy player.

Move 2.Name: Metal Claw
Move 2.Description: Send sharp claws forward; dealing damage to enemies hit and decreasing their movement speed by 30% for 2s. After this move is used, Duraludon's next auto attack becomes a boosted attack.

Upgrade 1.Name: Dragon Tail
Upgrade 1.Description: Duraludon shoves enemies and moves itself backward a short distance. The next basic attack becomes a boosted attack. A maximum of two uses can be kept in reserve for this move. There is a 1.1s cooldown between uses. This move can penetrate through walls.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Apply a mark for 5s that is consumed the next time Duraludon damages them, dealing additional damage.

Upgrade 2.Name: Stealth Rock
Upgrade 2.Description: Hurl a stone at the designated area, creating an invisible field of stones. The field deals damage over time to enemies in the area of effect and decreases their movement speed for a short time. If the hurled stone hits an enemy before the designated area, the area of effect will instead be centered on where the stone hit that Pokémon. Once an enemy takes damage from the field, it will become visible to enemies.  If an enemy takes damage from this move 4 times, that enemy becomes unable to move for a short time. After this move is used, Duraludon's next basic attack becomes a boosted attack. A maximum of two uses can be kept in reserve for this move. There is a 1.1s cooldown between uses. A maximum of 2 Stealth Rocks may be on the game field at one time, but 2 more can still be kept in reserve.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Stores 3 uses in reserve instead.

Unite Move.Name: Revolving Ruin
Unite Move.Description: Fire a beam of light at the ground in a sweeping circle around Duraludon. If this beam hits an enemy, it deals damage to them, grants Duraludon a shield and increases Attack by 8% for 8s. Both the shield effect and the Attack increase are strengthened for each enemy that is hit by the beam, stacking up to 5 times. Damage is dealt to any enemy in the area of effect after the beam of light is fired and enemies are shoved for 0.5s. A burning ring is also left where the beam of light touched the ground; enemies that touch this ring take additional damage every 0.5s and have their movement speed decreased by 50% for 1s. Subsequent hits after the first have the Attack stat bonus from this move applied to them.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 35% Attack Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Cotton Down
Passive Ability.Description: When at least 5% max HP damage is received in a single attack, restores this Pokémon's HP and increases their movement speed by 15% for 1.5s; deals revenge damage to nearby opposing Pokémon and decreases their movement speed by 30% for 1.5s (10s CD).

Eldegoss.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, attaching a bit of cotton fluff to opposing Pokémon for 3s and then damaging them. The user and their teammates' auto attacks against targets with cotton fluff on them deal additional damage and decrease their movement speed by 20% for 1s. Each teammate uses their own Sp. Atk to deal additional damage on targets with cotton fluff. This additional damage has an internal cooldown of 0.35s for each teammate.

Move 1.Name: Leafage
Move 1.Description: The user shoots a bundle of leaves in the designated direction which explodes on the first opposing Pokémon hit or after traveling max distance, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and decreasing their movement speed by 40% for 2s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Pollen Puff
Upgrade 1.Description: Throws a Pollen Puff, which attaches to an enemy. The Pollen Puff restores HP for allies and deals damage to enemies. The Pollen Puff explodes on its own after 1s with the same effects if it doesn't attach to any Pokémon within the first 0.5s of landing.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: If the Pollen Puff attaches to a teammate, it reduces the damage that teammate receives by 15% for 2s before it explodes. If the Pollen Puff attaches to any Pokémon, opposing Pokémon that come in contact with the target receive damage over time every 0.5s before the Pollen Puff explodes.

Upgrade 2.Name: Leaf Tornado
Upgrade 2.Description: Attack with a tornado of sharp leaves, leaving a path in its wake that increases ally movement speed for a short time.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Applies a debuff to opposing Pokémon hit by the tornado that causes auto attacks to deal no damage for 2.5s.

Move 2.Name: Synthesis
Move 2.Description: The user uses sunlight to heal themself and teammates in the area of effect.

Upgrade 1.Name: Cotton Guard
Upgrade 1.Description: Protects the user and nearby allies with cotton. The cotton absorbs damage and when the move ends, the cotton restores some HP.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the movement speed of teammates in the area of effect by 30% for 2s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Cotton Spore
Upgrade 2.Description: Gathers spores around the user, increasing the user's movement speed while this move is in effect. The spores burst after a short time, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect, throwing them, and decreasing their movement speed for a short time. Cotton Cloud Crash can be used during this move, ending the move early and making the spores burst immediately.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the user's Defense and Sp. Def by 40% for 2s.

Unite Move.Name: Cotton Cloud Crash
Unite Move.Description: The user becomes invincible as they float into the air for up to 3s, moving freely over obstacles and increasing their movement speed by 10% while in the air. If used again or after 3s, the user pounds the ground, restoring the HP of the user and teammates in the area of effect, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and shoving opposing Pokémon hit for 0.7s.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Magic Bounce
Passive Ability.Description: When Espeon would be affected by a hindrance, the hindrance is negated and Espeon becomes immune to hindrances for a short time. At the same time, this ability deals damage to the enemy that attempted to inflict the hindrance and applies a 30% slow for 1s (35s cd). Note: Hindrances include slows; multi-layered hindrance moves such as Pikachu's Volt Tackle will only have the very first launch negated.

Espeon.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage.

Move 1.Name: Swift
Move 1.Description: Eevee launches three stars at target location. Stars start in a horizontal line perpendicular to Eevee's facing. Stars continue to fly in the direction once past the target location until the maximum range is reached. When an enemy is hit by a star, subsequent stars deal 70% less damage.

Upgrade 1.Name: Psyshock
Upgrade 1.Description: Espeon materializes psychic projectiles and launches them at a designated location; dealing damage to enemies hit by the projectiles and decreasing their movement speed for each projectile hit by 15% for 3s (maximum 75%). Orbs start in a horizontal line perpendicular to Espeon's facing and continue flying in the  designated direction until the maximum range of the move. Targets hit by all five projectiles are stunned for 1.25s. When an enemy is hit by a projectile, subsequent projectiles deal 70% less damage. When Psyshock is enhanced via Future Sight reset, it launches stronger psychic projectiles at a designated location. These projectiles at their point of convergence cause an explosion, dealing damage to enemies in the area-of-effect. There is no damage increase.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increase the speed at which projectiles travel.

Upgrade 2.Name: Stored Power
Upgrade 2.Description: Unleash blasts of psychic power at random enemies within an area; dealing damage to enemies hit and decreasing their movement speed from each projectile hit by 10% for 2s (maximum 50%). Espeon stores one blast of psychic power every 2s (unaffected by cooldown reduction), or after hitting an enemy with a boosted attack (gaining 1 stored blast per enemy hit). Up to five blasts can be stored at once. After this move is used, Espeon's movement speed is increased by 70% for 1.2s. Targets hit by a psychic blast will take 70% less damage from subsequent hits. When Stored Power is enhanced via Future Sight reset, it unleashes an increased number of psychic blasts (8 total) and restores Espeon's HP by 150 per blast.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Also deals additional damage to enemies below 50% max HP.

Move 2.Name: Growl
Move 2.Description: Growl at a designated enemy; dealing damage and decreasing their movement speed by 30% for 2s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Psybeam
Upgrade 1.Description: Fires a peculiar ray in the designated direction. If the beam hits an enemy, it will then split beyond the first enemy hit and deal damage to other enemies in range. The initial enemy hit and these split rays deal more damage based on the max HP of the first enemy hit by the ray. If the first enemy hit by the ray is slowed or is stunned, those same effects will be applied to the enemies hit by the split rays. The split rays will never go towards Espeon and will refract at a maximum of a 90 degree angle. Distance from initial target to split ray hit is 75% of the max range. Stun copied duration is the maximum duration of the stun causing the initial Pokémon to be stunned. For the split ray, the damage component from the initial target's max HP damage is capped at 1000 against Wild Pokémon and capped at 2000 against Player Pokémon.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Deals additional damage to enemies that are unable to act. If Psybeam hits an unable to act initial target, the split rays will also deal the additional damage to other enemies hit and leaves them unable to act.

Upgrade 2.Name: Future Sight
Upgrade 2.Description: Espeon locks-on to an enemy, dealing damage 2 seconds later in an area centered on the locked-on target. Deal more damage based on the locked-on targets missing HP. While locked-on to an enemy, Espeon's other moves will target that enemy whenever possible. If the center of Psyshock is within the area-of-effect of Future Sight when released, Psyshock will home in on the Future Sight affected target. Each time Espeon deals damage to a Future Sight locked-on target through Psyshock, Stored Power, auto attacks, Future Sight's cooldown is reduced by 0.8 seconds. If the locked-on target is an opponent, and is knocked out by Future Sight or by Espeon, then a single powered-up use of Psyshock or Stored Power becomes available for a short time. Full Heal and other cleanses such as Blissey's Natural cure remove Future Sight. Against Wild Pokémon: The total damage is capped at 1800.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Espeon deals 10% additional damage to locked-on targets.

Unite Move.Name: Psychic Solare
Unite Move.Description: Espeon throws enemies in the area of effect into the air and suspends them using psychic power. After a delay, an explosion occurs that deals damage to all enemies in the area of effect and shoves them. Espeon is unstoppable during this move.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Battle Armor
Passive Ability.Description: The critical-hit modifier of enemies is reduced by 50% when dealing damage to Falinks. Falinks can hold 10 more Aeos Energy than other Pokémon. Falinks is a group comprised of the Brass and five Troopers. Each member of the group has a separate hitbox and counts as a different target. The Brass always takes 10% reduced damage. Troopers will take 90% less damage while attached to the Brass. For attacks or moves that can hit multiple targets, the total damage Falinks can take from a single move or attack is 110% of that move or attack's damage.

Falinks.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, or after the user uses Tackle, Megahorn, or Iron Head. Boosted attacks also apply a 50% slow for 1s to opposing Pokémon they hit. When a boosted attack hits, the cooldown of Tackle, Megahorn, or Iron Head is reduced by 2.5s

Move 1.Name: Tackle
Move 1.Description: Charge in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies hit and shoving them. The user's next basic attack becomes a boosted attack.

Upgrade 1.Name: Megahorn
Upgrade 1.Description: Charge with its horns, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon it hits and throwing them in the air for 0.25s. Immediately afterward, strike with its horns again and gain a shield for 2.5s. In No Retreat formation: Falinks becomes hindrance resistant and charges power for 1s. It then strikes forward with its horns, dealing additional damage to opposing Pokémon it hits based on their max HP and gaining a shield for 2.5s. This version of the move has a 4s cd that is separate from the column version.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the shield value.

Upgrade 2.Name: Iron Head
Upgrade 2.Description: Attacks the designated area with its steel-hard heads, dealing damage and applying 50% slow for 1.5s to opposing Pokémon it hits, as well as granting itself a shield. In No Retreat formation: The move's range is shortened but the area of effect is widened. Pokémon hit in the landing area are also knocked up and briefly stunned for 0.33s. After using this move, for the next 4 attacks, the user can attack while moving with the Brass and Troops all deal damage separately in front of them.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Iron Head and the Troopers returning deal an additional 2% max hp damage to enemies they hit, capped to 400.

Move 2.Name: Bulk Up
Move 2.Description: Increases the user's Defense, Special Defense and Attack Speed by 25%, and Attack by 30% for 3s

Upgrade 1.Name: No Retreat
Upgrade 1.Description: Switch to No Retreat formation while shoving enemies for 0.4s in front of Falinks and become unstoppable during the formation change for 0.5s. While in No Retreat formation, the user cannot change the direction they're facing, unless they use the other move. Falinks' movement speed when moving backward is slowed by 10%, but Attack is increased by 25% and damage taken from the front is reduced by 20%. If this move is used while the user is in No Retreat formation, the user will switch to Column formation. While in No Retreat formation both the Brass and Troopers take 20% less damage from the front. The Brass' total damage reduction becomes 28%; the Trooper's total damage reduction becomes 92%.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Attack increase is increased to 40% and damage reduction from the front is increased to 30%.

Upgrade 2.Name: Beat Up
Upgrade 2.Description: Has the user charge in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies hit. The user then switches to Dispatch formation, sending out two Troopers toward enemies that were hit. The dispatched Troopers will continue to attack enemies, but they will return to the Brass after they either: take a set amount of damage, become separated from the Brass by more than a set distance, or after 5s. A maximum of 2 uses can be kept in reserve for this move with a 0.5s cooldown between each use. While in Dispatch formation, the Troopers sent out no longer have any damage resistance nor share damage taken with the Brass. Dispatched Troopers share the same stats as the Brass, except for HP.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Also restores HP when this move hits.

Unite Move.Name: Dust Devil Formation
Unite Move.Description: Has the five troopers run continuously around the Brass at great speed for 5s, dealing damage and slowing enemies hit by 20% for 1s. Falinks is unstoppable during the formation change for 0.25s. While this move is being used, damage taken by the troopers is reduced. While in Dust Devil formation the Troopers take 30% less damage making the Trooper's total damage reduction 93%.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Rough Skin
Passive Ability.Description: When damaged by a nearby opposing Melee Pokémon, reflects 30% of the damage received back to that opposing Pokémon as Attack-based damage (2s CD).

Garchomp.Attack: Gains 1 stack toward boosted attacks after hitting an auto attack or move, stacking up to 5 times. At 5 stacks, all basic attacks become boosted attacks with increased attack speed and additional 30% lifesteal, dealing increased damage to opposing Pokémon, and dealing an additional 10% remaining HP damage to them. All stacks decay after 4s of not hitting an auto attack or move. Against wild Pokémon: basic attack damage is capped at 1000; boosted attack damage is capped at 1100; additional remaining HP damage is capped at 350.

Move 1.Name: Sand Attack
Move 1.Description: The user hurls sand in the designated direction, reducing the field of vision of opposing Pokémon by 50% and decreasing their movement speed by 20% for 2s; increasing the user's movement speed by 30% for 2s and auto attack speed by 30% for 3s when this move hits.

Upgrade 1.Name: Dig
Upgrade 1.Description: Burrow underground and move quickly in the designated direction, jumping out when coming in contact with an enemy or when traveling the maximum distance. This jump deals damage to enemies in the area of effect and throws them.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Strengthens the duration of the throw to 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Dragon Rush
Upgrade 2.Description: Back up to create distance before diving to attack in the designated direction, shoving enemies. The user can use Dragon Claw while creating distance at the start of this move to create a combo attack. (This move can crit) The user can use Dragon Claw during the first half of the channel to add the Dragon Claw hits as a combo attack. This combo attack scoops up opposing Pokémon, dealing damage with both Dragon Rush and Dragon Claw's first attack and stunning them. If the combo attack hits, the user then throws opposing Pokémon back down with the second Dragon Claw attack, dealing damage with a strengthened slow.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Becomes unstoppable during this move; this includes the combo attack with Dragon Claw.

Move 2.Name: Bulldoze
Move 2.Description: The user stomps down on the ground, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect.

Upgrade 1.Name: Earthquake
Upgrade 1.Description: Jump high into the air and crash forcefully to the ground, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Strengthens the movement speed decrease of opposing Pokémon near the center of the crash to 40%.

Upgrade 2.Name: Dragon Claw
Upgrade 2.Description: Attack twice in front of itself using its claws. The first attack deals damage to enemies and throws them. The second attack deals increased damage. After the move ends, basic attack speed is increased for a short time. (This move can crit) When this move is used in a combo attack with Dragon Rush, the movement speed decrease on the second attack is strengthened to 60% for 2s.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the damage of both attacks.

Unite Move.Name: Livid Outrage
Unite Move.Description: The user goes berserk, becoming unstoppable and receiving 30% reduced damage for 5s while unleashing five powerful attacks in a row. The user dashes forward and damages opposing Pokémon in a unique designated area with each attack, taking a brief moment after each attack to aim the next dash. Every attack more damage than the last. The fifth attack throws opposing Pokémon hit and decreases their movement speed by 30% for 1s. The user is left confused for 0.5s afterward.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Synchronize
Passive Ability.Description: When an opposing Pokémon decreases this Pokémon's movement speed, also decreases that opposing Pokémon's movement speed by 40% for 3s; or, when an opposing Pokémon inflicts a damage-over-time status condition on this Pokémon, also inflicts a damage-over time effect on that opposing Pokémon for 3s (8s CD).

Gardevoir.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and decreasing their Sp. Def by 10% for 2s.

Move 1.Name: Confusion
Move 1.Description: The user fires a psychic bolt in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon hit and decreasing their movement speed by 35% for 1s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Psychic
Upgrade 1.Description: After hitting an enemy or traveling its maximum distance, deals damage over time to enemies in the area of effect and decreases their movement speed and Sp. Defense by 20%, stacking up to 3 times.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Reduces this move's cooldown by 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Moonblast
Upgrade 2.Description: Has the user attack while moving back to create distance. When the move's blast hits, it deals damage to enemies in a cone and leaves the enemy closest to the user unable to act for a short time.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Grants the user a shield for 3s when launching the blast.

Move 2.Name: Teleport
Move 2.Description: The user readies a boosted attack and warps forward to the designated location. When this move is learned, passively increases the damage of Synchronize, auto attacks, and Confusion by 15% until this move is replaced.

Upgrade 1.Name: Psyshock
Upgrade 1.Description: Attacks the designated location three times. This move's cooldown is reduced each time one of these attacks hits an enemy. The user is able to attack and move freely while channeling this move.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the damage of the next attack to hit each time an attack hits an opposing Pokémon.

Upgrade 2.Name: Future Sight
Upgrade 2.Description: Sets a delayed explosion. When the explosion hits an enemy, it reduces this move's cooldown.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Resets this move's cooldown when it hits a Pokémon from the opposing team.

Unite Move.Name: Fairy Singularity
Unite Move.Description: The user warps space in the designated area, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon and pulling them toward the center 4 times. As the warped space disappears, it deals increased damage to opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and shoves them away from the center.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Levitate
Passive Ability.Description: When this Pokémon has not been in combat for 5s, their movement speed is increased by 10%.

Gengar.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, lunging at an opposing Pokémon and dealing increased damage to opposing Pokémon hit.

Move 1.Name: Will-o-Wisp
Move 1.Description: The user shoots 3 sinister flames in a cone in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon hit and burning them for 4s. The first flame deals full damage to each target hit; subsequent flames deal 50% of the full damage to the same target. The burn deals damage over time every 0.5s for 2s (dealing damage 3 times), and decreases Attack and Sp. Atk by 10% for 4s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Shadow Ball
Upgrade 1.Description: Hurl a shadowy blob at the target, decreasing the movement speed and Sp. Defense of enemies for a short time when it hits.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the damage of this move.

Upgrade 2.Name: Sludge Bomb
Upgrade 2.Description: Hurl unsanitary sludge to the designated area, leaving enemies poisoned when it hits. Against wild Pokémon: poison damage is capped at 120 per tick.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Strengthens poison duration to 6s (dealing maximum 12% max HP Sp. Atk-based damage).

Move 2.Name: Lick
Move 2.Description: The user extends their tongue in the designated direction, stopping at the first opposing Pokémon hit, damaging the target and pulling them toward the user's location. The user readies a boosted attack when this move is used.

Upgrade 1.Name: Dream Eater
Upgrade 1.Description: Puts enemies to sleep when it hits. If used again while a nearby enemy is asleep, the user appears behind the target and attacks, restoring HP and reducing the cooldown of Shadow Ball or Sludge Bomb. The user readies a boosted attack each time this move is used. If the user knocks out a Pokémon from the opposing team, the cooldown of this move is reset.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the damage dealt and HP restored by this move.

Upgrade 2.Name: Hex
Upgrade 2.Description: Disappear and move to the designated location, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect when the user reappears. If this hits an enemy that is afflicted by a status condition, it deals increased damage and its cooldown is reduced. The user readies a boosted attack when this move is used.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the damage of this move.

Unite Move.Name: Phantom Ambush
Unite Move.Description: The user becomes unstoppable as they jump forward to the designated location, then enters stealth and increases their movement speed by 30% for 7s. The user exits stealth when they use an attack. If this Unite Move is used again, the user becomes invincible as they jump out to attack, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and decreasing their movement speed by 50% for 1.5s when it hits.
Unite Move.Buffs: 80% Movement Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Snow Cloak
Passive Ability.Description: When Glaceon would be affected by a hindrance, the hindrance is negated. Glaceon then starts sneaking and becomes invincible for 0.5s. This Ability goes on cooldown after it’s triggered (70s cd) and is reset after respawning.

Glaceon.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage and giving Glaceon 2 ice crystals when the boosted attack hits. Ice crystals last 5s and the duration is refreshed upon gaining additional crystals. Glaceon can hold a maximum of 8 ice crystals at a time.

Move 1.Name: Swift
Move 1.Description: Creates 4 stars around the user. For a short time afterward, each time the user hits an enemy with a basic attack or boosted attack, one or two of the stars respectively will shoot out and deal additional damage to the target.

Upgrade 1.Name: Icicle Spear
Upgrade 1.Description: Has the user launch all of their stored ice crystals in rapid succession at the designated enemy. If no ice crystals are stored when this move is used, 2 ice crystals are instantly created and all crystals are launched. The crystals shatter when they hit the designated target, dealing damage to enemies in the area-of-effect. Launched ice crystals can hit enemies on the opposing team that are not the designated target of this move. If this occurs, the ice crystals will still shatter on impact and deal damage in an area in the same way. Ice crystals launched by this move deal increasing damage each time they hit the same enemy. After this move is used, the cooldown of Ice Shard or Freeze-Dry is reduced.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Each launched ice crystal also deals additional damage to enemies hit equal to 0.5% of their remaining HP.

Upgrade 2.Name: Icy Wind
Upgrade 2.Description: Jump a short distance in the designated direction. Glaceon's next basic attack launches all stored ice crystals at an enemy, dealing damage to them. Glaceon then regains the same number of ice crystals that were launched. If Glaceon hits the same enemy with 1 or more ice crystals, that enemies movement speed is decreased for a short time. The more ice crystals that hit that target, the stronger this movement speed-decrease effect. If Glaceon has no ice crystals when this move is used, gain 2 ice crystals.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Each launched ice crystal also deals additional damage to enemies hit equal to 1.5% of their remaining HP.

Move 2.Name: Tail Whip
Move 2.Description: Has the user wag its tail at an enemy, dealing damage and decreasing their Defense and Sp. Def by 30% for 2s, and movement speed by 20% for 1.5s. The next auto attack after using this move becomes a boosted attack.

Upgrade 1.Name: Ice Shard
Upgrade 1.Description: Increase movement speed for a short time. Afterward, Glaceon's basic attack speed increases for a short time, and basic attacks change into attacks that hurl chunks of ice. These chunks of ice deal damage to enemies hit and decrease their movement speed for a short time. Every time a chunk of ice hits, the user gains 1 ice crystal. The user gains 2 ice crystals if this move is used while launching ice crystals with Icicle Spear, or if it's used after Icy Wind has been used, but before the user has launched all ice crystals with the next basic attack.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases basic attack speed further to 100% for 2.5s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Freeze Dry
Upgrade 2.Description: Glaceon shoots out a freezing burst of air in a forward direction, increasing Sp. Atk for a short time. . This burst explodes upon hitting an enemy or after traveling a set distance; dealing damage to enemies in the area-of-effect. For each enemy hit by the explosion, Glaceon gains 1 ice crystal. The explosion also leaves behind an ice zone. Enemies that enter this ice zone will have their movement speed decreased. If they remain in the ice zone for a set amount of time, they become frozen for a short time.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: For each enemy hit by this move's explosions, Glaceon gains 1 additional ice crystal.

Unite Move.Name: Glacial Stage
Unite Move.Description: Glaceon leaps up high, creating an ice zone in front of themself that deals damage to enemies in the area-of-effect. While Glaceon is in the ice zone, their movement speed is increased by 50% for 6s, and Glaceon gains 1 ice crystals every second while in the zone. The movement speed of enemies in the ice zone is decreased by 50% for 2s.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 35% Attack Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Gooey
Passive Ability.Description: When this Pokémon is hit by an attack, there is a chance it will spread slime around itself. The slime deals damage to Pokémon, Decreases their attack speed by 50% for 2s and applies a Gooey debuff. The Gooey debuff slows Pokémon by 10% for 6s and can stack up to 4 times per Pokémon. Gooey is a debuff that is applicable to Wild Pokémon and enemy players only. When this Pokémon enters tall grass, it continually recovers HP for up to 3s, until it leaves the tall grass, uses a move, or attacks. When this Pokémon recovers HP due to Gooey, its attack gauge is progressed towards a boosted attack. This HP recovery goes on a 12s cooldown after being triggered.

Goodra.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage. Hitting a Pokémon afflicted with a Gooey effect with a basic attack reduces all of this Pokémon's move cooldowns by 1.5s. Boosted attacks spew slime and if the slime hits Pokémon from a distance, a Gooey debuff is applied to those Pokémon and slows by 50% for 0.5s. If the boosted attack is used on a Pokémon in regular attack melee range, the attack deals increased damage.

Move 1.Name: Bubble
Move 1.Description: Cover itself in a bubble, granting it a shield for 3s. When the shield’s effect duration ends or if this move is used again, the bubble shield pops, dealing damage to nearby opposing Pokémon and slowing them by 30% for 2s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Muddy Water
Upgrade 1.Description: Splashes muddy water around itself, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and applying an effect to them that decreases the amount of damage they deal by 15% for 3s. If the user deals damage to opposing Pokémon with this move, the user’s Defense and Sp. Def are increased for 2s. If Muddy Water is used within 6 seconds, the defense bonus effect is increased in intensity. The defenses bonus effect can stack up to four times.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Further increases the user’s Defense and Sp. Def when this move deals damage to opposing Pokémon.

Upgrade 2.Name: Dragon Pulse
Upgrade 2.Description: Unleashes a shock wave in the designated direction, dealing damage to Pokémon it hits up to 4 times. If the center of the shock wave hits enemy Pokémon, it deals increased damage to them and restores the user’s HP. More HP is restored when the center of the pulse deals damage to enemy Pokémon that have a Gooey slowing effect applied to them. The fourth tick of damage can be animation cancelled by inputs (attack or movement). It is undetermined if this is a bug or not.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Restores more HP if the center of the shock wave hits Pokémon, and even more on Pokémon that have a Gooey debuff applied to them.

Move 2.Name: Tackle
Move 2.Description: Charges at a Pokémon, dealing damage and throwing it. If this move hits, the user bounces back a short distance.

Upgrade 1.Name: Power Whip
Upgrade 1.Description: Lashes out with its horns in the designated direction, dealing damage to Pokémon in the area of effect and slowing them by 80% for 3s, decaying by 15% every 0.5s. If this move hits distant Pokémon, those Pokémon are pulled toward Goodra.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Also applies a Gooey effect when this move hits.

Upgrade 2.Name: Acid Spray
Upgrade 2.Description: Spits acidic fluid at target Pokémon, dealing damage to Pokémon in an area of effect centered on the target slowing them by 80% for 3s, decaying by 15% every 0.5s. If this move is used again, Goodra charges in the designated direction and deals damage to opposing Pokémon it hits. If this charge hits a Pokémon that has been marked by acidic fluid, that Pokémon is thrown for 0.75s, and damage is also dealt to nearby opposing Pokémon.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Also applies a Gooey effect to opposing Pokémon that receive damage from either the acidic fluid or the charge.

Unite Move.Name: Right as Rain
Unite Move.Description: Causes rain to fall around the user, gradually restoring the user’s HP over 6s. While this move is active, all of the user’s basic attacks become boosted attacks.
Unite Move.Buffs: 40% Max HP Shield, 50% Movement Speed

Passive Ability.Name: Cheek Pouch
Passive Ability.Description: When Greedent eats a berry, recover HP after receiving the effects of the berry (oran berry or unite move berry 1%Max HP + 3x(Lv-1) + 23; sitrus or salac berry 1%Max HP + 0x(Lv-1) + 23). At the same time, Greedent stashes an Oran berry in its tail. Being hit by a single attack or combination of attacks will cause an Oran berry to drop from Greedent's tail (4.5s cd). Berries stay on the ground for 10s. All players heal from an oran berry for 2% Max HP + 5x(Level-1) + 45, level and Max HP scaling is based on the player that ate the oran berry.

Greedent.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage when it hits and causing one Oran berry to drop from Greedent's tail.

Move 1.Name: Tackle
Move 1.Description: Leap to the designated area, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect and decreasing their movement speed by 20% for 1s. If this move is used while Covet is active, no area can be designated for Greedent to leap to. Instead, while running, damage is dealt in an area to enemies in front of Greedent. If Greedent has any Oran berries stashed, consume all of them, reducing Tackle's cooldown by 1s for each berry consumed.

Upgrade 1.Name: Bullet Seed
Upgrade 1.Description: Spit berry seeds in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect and decrease their movement speed for a short time. The more berries Greedent has stashed, the more damage this move deals.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increased damage.

Upgrade 2.Name: Belch
Upgrade 2.Description: Deals damage to enemies in the area of effect and decrease their movement speed for a short time. If Greedent has any berries stashed, consume all of them, reducing Belch's cooldown for each berry consumed.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increased damage.

Move 2.Name: Defense Curl
Move 2.Description: Grants Greedent a shield (10% max HP) for 3s. In addition, an Oran berry will drop in front of Greedent.

Upgrade 1.Name: Stuff Cheeks
Upgrade 1.Description: Greedent drops several berries, which can be eaten to recover HP. Any HP recovered that exceeds Greedent's max HP will be converted to a shield. If Greedent catches sight of a berry while using this move, movement speed is increased for a short time.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increase the number of Oran berries dropped by 1.

Upgrade 2.Name: Covet
Upgrade 2.Description: Greedent runs with all its might, becoming unstoppable and dealing damage to enemies hit and throwing them. While running, Greedent drops berries. Eating a dropped berry increases movement speed for a short time. The more berries eaten, the more movement speed is increased. In addition, Belch or Bullet Seed can also be used while running.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increased damage and increased frequency of Oran berries dropping (8 berries over 6s).

Unite Move.Name: Berry Belly Flop
Unite Move.Description: Greedent eats a special berry to recover 15% max HP and then leaps to the designated area; dealing damage and throwing enemies within the area of effect. Greedent then eats another berry, allowing an unlimited amount of Oran berries to be stored for 8s and resets cooldowns of all moves. Greedent is unstoppable during this move.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 40% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Torrent
Passive Ability.Description: While at 50% max HP or below, increases Attack by 5% and movement speed by 12%.

Greninja.Attack: Auto attacks differ depending on range, and become boosted attacks with every third attack, dealing increased damage. Auto attacks used at long range reduce the cooldown of Bubble, Water Shuriken, or Surf by 0.5s when they hit. Boosted attacks used at long range also decrease the movement speed of the opposing Pokémon hit by 25% for 0.5s. Auto attacks used in close range instead deal a bonus 5% missing HP damage to opposing Pokémon hit. Boosted attacks used in close range dash through the target, dealing a bonus 10% missing HP damage to opposing Pokémon hit instead. Against wild Pokémon: the total damage of auto attacks used in close range is capped at 500.

Move 1.Name: Bubble
Move 1.Description: Sprays 2 bubbles in the designated direction which pop when they hit an opposing Pokémon, damaging opposing Pokémon and decreasing their movement speed by 25% for 1s when each bubble hits.

Upgrade 1.Name: Water Shuriken
Upgrade 1.Description: Throw shurikens made of water in quick succession. Decreases the movement speed of enemies for a short time and restores the user's HP when it hits. Also increases the user's movement speed while using this move.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Throws 5 shurikens.

Upgrade 2.Name: Surf
Upgrade 2.Description: Ride a wave, dealing damage to enemies and restoring the user's HP. If this move knocks out an enemy, its cooldown is reset. In addition, this move deals increased damage to enemies with low HP. Against wild Pokémon: the damage of the wave is capped at 1200; bonus damage is capped at 600.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the HP restored by this move.

Move 2.Name: Substitute
Move 2.Description: Becomes invincible and dashes forward, leaving behind a Substitute doll in their place which lasts for 3s. The Substitute doll has the same HP, Defense and Sp. Def as the user; the Substitute doll receives 500% of the damage the user would take.

Upgrade 1.Name: Double Team
Upgrade 1.Description: Quickly moves the user away from the current position, creating illusory copies of it to aid in battle. The copies have the same HP, Defense and Sp. Def as Greninja when created, but receive 500% of the damage they would otherwise take. The clones attack nearby opposing Pokémon with Bubble, Water Shuriken, or Surf (whichever move the user has learned), and auto attacks; but deal 19.44% of the damage they would otherwise deal.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Reduces this move's cooldown by 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Smokescreen
Upgrade 2.Description: Creates a smokescreen and has the user roll away from its current location. Immediately afterward, the user begins sneaking and has its movement speed increased for a short time. This also makes its next basic attack a boosted attack. Opposing Pokémon in the cloud of smoke have their field of vision reduced by 60%.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases Attack by 20% for 2s when exiting stealth.

Unite Move.Name: Waterburst Shuriken
Unite Move.Description: Becomes unstoppable and leaps up to throw a giant water shuriken toward the designated circular location, damaging opposing Pokémon it hits on the way to the circular area of effect (from beyond the range of the user's close range auto attacks) and decreasing the movement speed of those hit by 50% for 2s. The user then suddenly appears on top of the water shuriken which immediately bursts, damaging opposing Pokémon in the circular area of effect again and throwing them.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 35% Attack Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Moxie
Passive Ability.Description: When knocking out a Pokémon from the opposing team or making an assist, reduces current move cooldowns by 30%.

Gyarados.Attack: Magikarp has no boosted attack. Magikarp's basic attacks are a set animation length.

Move 1.Name: Flail
Move 1.Description: Flails on the spot, damaging nearby opposing Pokémon; damage strengthens for every 33% max HP the user is missing.

Upgrade 1.Name: Dragon Breath
Upgrade 1.Description: Exhales a mighty gust in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and paralyzing them for 3s when it hits, decreasing their movement speed and basic attack speed by 30%. If this move hits, gains a buff for 5s; increasing the range and damage of auto attacks; and increasing basic attack speed by a minimum of 40%, strengthening by 15% for each additional opposing Pokémon hit (up to 2 times; maximum 70%).
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the damage dealt by this move and enhanced auto attacks.

Upgrade 2.Name: Aqua Tail
Upgrade 2.Description: For up to 4s while this move is held; moves slightly in the designated direction then swings a blade of water from their tail in the designated direction (up to 5 times), damaging opposing Pokémon hit with each blade. If at least 3 blades of water hit opposing Pokémon before this move is released or ends, a second stage of this move can be used within 5s; becomes unstoppable and charges for up to 1.5s, then attacks with a large sweep of their tail in a wider area forward, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect. If the second stage is charged for at least 0.5s, increases the range of the area of effect and damage dealt.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the damage of the first use of this move.

Move 2.Name: Splash
Move 2.Description: Jumps to the designated location forward. A maximum of 3 uses can be kept in reserve, with a 2s cooldown between uses.

Upgrade 1.Name: Waterfall
Upgrade 1.Description: Charges forward up to 3 times, damaging opposing Pokémon hit with each charge; waiting for at least 0.07s before dashing forward with the next charge. The first charge is a regular dash forward; the next movement within 2s after the last charge dashes forward with the same effect. Dragon Breath or Aqua Tail can be used within the 2s duration in between charges without interrupting this move's course. Using Dragon Current ends this move early. If two charges hit opposing Pokémon, grants a shield for 2s. If all three charges hit opposing Pokémon, the third charge throws opposing Pokémon hit for 0.45s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Reduce this move's cooldown by 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Bounce
Upgrade 2.Description: Becomes unstoppable and charges power for up to 2.4s, becoming fully charged after 0.8s; then bounces to the designated location forward, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area upon impact. While charging power, increases the range of this move, reaching maximum range when fully charged. If fully charged when released, grants a shield for 3s, and throws opposing Pokémon hit for 0.45s. If this move is canceled, it goes on a 2s cooldown.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Strengthens the value of the shield effect.

Unite Move.Name: Dragon Current
Unite Move.Description: Becomes untargetable and dives underwater for up to 4s while this Unite Move is held, increasing movement speed by 45%. When released or after 4s, forcefully leaps up and attacks, damaging opposing Pokémon hit.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Regenerator
Passive Ability.Description: If this Pokémon doesn't take damage from enemy Pokémon (Wild Pokémon do not count) for 3s, it will recover 3% max HP every 2 seconds. Damage to shields will not deactivate Regenerator. Ho-oh additionally recovers 0.3% max HP every 2 seconds.

Ho-Oh.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, shooting out a sweeping flame that deals increased damage and restores HP per enemy Pokémon hit. While firing the sweeping flame Ho-Oh's movement speed is decreased by 30%.

Move 1.Name: Safeguard
Move 1.Description: Create a protective field around the user that reduces the next incoming source of damage by 50%. When this field reduces damage from an attack, the user's movement speed is increased by 40% for 3s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Fly
Upgrade 1.Description: The user begins flying high above the map for up to 8s. The next 3 basic attacks are boosted attacks. While flying, the user is able to move freely over walls and its attack and movement speed are increased by 30%. If this move is used again, the user lands dealing damage to opposing Pokémon around the landing zone and cancelling the attack and movement speed bonuses.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the flight time by 4s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Fire Spin
Upgrade 2.Description: Generate a blazing vortex around yourself and gain a shield. While the vortex is active, Ho-Oh slows itself by 40% and cannot attack. The first time an enemy interacts with the vortex, they receive an 80% movement speed decrease decaying by 10% every 0.5s over 4s. The vortex also deals damage to enemies. If allies are within the vortex, 50% of post-mitigation damage those allies would take is redirected to Ho-Oh as true damage (without ignoring shields). If there is a shield after 4s or if this move is used again while this move's shield is intact, a heat wave is released around the user, dealing damage to enemies, and additional damage equal to the percentage of the damage the shield received. There is a 1.5s delay before the shield may be detonated from the start of the vortex. If the shield is destroyed before detonation, no damage is dealt.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: When the shield is broken, the heat wave is now automatically released.

Move 2.Name: Tailwind
Move 2.Description: Whip up a whirlwind in designated direction, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon hit. The whirlwind then remains on the field for 5s. Allies moving in the same direction as the whirlwind have thier movement speed increased by 30% as long as they are in the field and lasting for 0.5s after stepping out of the field. Opposing Pokémon moving against the whirlwind have their movement speed decreased by 30% lasting for 0.5s after stepping out of the field.

Upgrade 1.Name: Flamethrower
Upgrade 1.Description: Blow flames in a designated direction, dealing damage to enemies hit every 0.25s and slowing Ho-Oh's movement speed by 15%. This move may be held for up to 4s to blow flames for longer. This move's cooldown increases the longer flames are blown for. If enemies are hit, the user recovers HP. If enemies are hit thrice, they are burned, refreshing on additional hits of flamethrower. Burned enemies take damage over 3s at 0.5s intervals. Burned enemies also have their movement speed decreased by 15% for 1.5s, their attack decreased by 20% for 2s, and their special attack decreased by 20% for 1.5s. Enemies burned by Flamethrower will leave behind a scorched area. Enemies traversing the scorched area are slowed by 15%. Enemies that touch the area will also receive burns but this burn will not spread the scorched area.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the length of time flames may be blown to 5s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Sky Attack
Upgrade 2.Description: Ho-Oh spreads their wings and charges in a loop. While charging, deal damage to enemies hit and burn the ground along the flight path for 4.5s. The burning ground deals damage to enemies that touch it every 0.5s and slows them by 30% for 1.5s. If this move is used again or if another move is used mid-charge, then the user stops in place. During the flight, Ho-Oh receives 30% less damage.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: While the Ho-Oh is on burning ground, gradually restore HP.

Unite Move.Name: Rekindling Flame
Unite Move.Description: When a nearby ally is knocked out, a feather is left in their place until they respawn at base. When Rekindling Flame is used, Ho-oh spreads their wings and consumes all of the Aeos energy held to revive knocked-out allies where their feathers are for 60% of their maximum HP. Rekindling Flame may only be used if there are feathers nearby. The number of available revivals are based on how much Aeos energy is consumed. One ally may be always revived. Up to two allies are revivable if at least 9 energy is consumed. Up to three allies are revivable if at least 17 Aeos energy is consumed. Up to four allies are revivable if at least 25 Aeos energy is consumed.
Unite Move.Buffs: 80% Movement Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Magician
Passive Ability.Description: In battles where the map is divided into an ally team side and an opposing team side, this ability creates a hole under one of the berries on the opposing team's side (chosen at random) and warps it in front of Hoopa (40s cooldown). If there are no berries, but there is Aeos Energy on the ground, then some energy is warped in front of Hoopa instead. In the event that no berries from the opposing team's side are warped, the cooldown of this ability is reduced to 20s. Berries last 30 seconds and take 2 seconds to appear after magician's activation.

Hoopa.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing damage to enemies by unleashing a beam of light.

Move 1.Name: Astonish
Move 1.Description: Deals damage to enemies in the designated area of effect, leaving them unable to act for .75s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Phantom Force
Upgrade 1.Description: Hoopa creates a portal ring under itself and warps to a designated location, dealing damage to nearby enemies at that location and shoving them. Hoopa then shoots two sinister flames that deal damage to enemies hit and decreases their movement speed for a short time. This move can be used a second time within a set amount of time. If used a second time, Hoopa can return to the initial location they warped from. When using this move, if there is a nearby ally that is linked by Trick, that ally can also warp to the initial ring's location. The ally that warps in this way will recover HP.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Become invincible for .6s when this move is used.

Upgrade 2.Name: Shadow Ball
Upgrade 2.Description: Unleash a shadowy blob in front of Hoopa, dealing damage to enemies hit and decreases their movement speed and Sp. Def for a short time. If Hoopa then hits the same enemy with a move or boosted attack within a set amount of time, it deals additional damage and leaves the enemy unable to act for a short time. When using this move, if there is a nearby ally linked by Trick, this move will also unleash a shadowy blob at the same target from that ally's location.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: The shadowy blob will now explode before disappearing. Enemies hit by the explosion are affected as if they were hit by the shadowy blob itself.

Move 2.Name: Confusion
Move 2.Description: Unleash a telekinetic force in the designated direction, dealing damage to the first enemy hit. The telekinetic force clings to that enemy and then causes a delayed explosion. The explosion deals damage to enemies in the area of effect and decreases their movement speed for a short time.

Upgrade 1.Name: Hyperspace Hole
Upgrade 1.Description: Hoopa creates a large ring at the designated location, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect. After a set amount of time, Hoopa and any allies in the area of effect will return to their base, and their movement speed will be increased for a short time. These allies can also warp back to where the ring was created. An intact ally forward goal zone can also be designated as the location where the ring is created. Creating the ring on this forward goal zone of the top path will also create a ring on the forward goal zone of the bottom path, and vice versa. All allies, including Hoopa, can use these rings to warp between the two goal zones, and their movement speed will be increased for a short time after warping. After an ally warps, there is a set cooldown before that ally can use these rings again. If a path's forward goal zone is destroyed, the middle goal zone on the same path will take its place. This move cannot be used on base goal zones.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Also increases movement speed by 70% for allies near the ring when they are heading towards it.

Upgrade 2.Name: Trick
Upgrade 2.Description: Hoopa creates a link between itself and an ally using a ring, increasing both of their movement speeds and granting them each a shield for a short time. When Hoopa uses Shadow Ball or performs a basic attack, the ring on the linked ally also unleashes the same move or attack. Hoopa can also use this move on themself, increasing movement speed and granting a shield for a short time. Additionally, it increases the damage dealt by Shadow Ball.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Hoopa and the linked ally each heal for 10% of their own damage dealt. This effect lasts for 3s.

Unite Move.Name: Rings Unbound
Unite Move.Description: Hoopa becomes invincible for 0.6s while transforming into Hoopa Unbound, then becomes unstoppable for 0.3s as it opens a large portal ring at a designated location. Hoopa Unbound lasts for 15s, increasing max HP by 40% and changes Hoopa's regular moves to Hyperspace Fury and Psybeam. Hoopa Unbound cannot score goals or activate the Magician ability.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Sniper
Passive Ability.Description: When this Pokémon stays near a wall for 1s it becomes camouflaged, making opposing Pokémon unable to target it, and starts gaining critical counters (up to a maximum of 3). While camouflaged, Inteleon is slowed by 10%. A critical counter is gained as soon as Inteleon is camouflaged, with a new counter gained every 3s while camouflaged. Dealing or receiving damage prevents Inteleon from starting to camouflage for 3s. When a critical counter is consumed, Inteleon's next attack or move that can critically strike is guaranteed to be a critical hit. Critical hits deal 250% rather than 200% damage.

Inteleon.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage with 20% increased critical-hit rate.

Move 1.Name: Tearful Look
Move 1.Description: Decreases the Attack and Sp. Atk of the target Pokémon by 20% for 3s. Inteleon gains a critical counter and increases its movement speed by 40% for 3s (decreasing over time).

Upgrade 1.Name: Fell Stinger
Upgrade 1.Description: Inteleon fires a sharp stinger in the designated direction. The stinger stops at the first Pokémon hit or when it reaches a wall. Inteleon gains two critical counters if either a Pokémon is hit or a wall is hit. If it hits a Pokémon it deals damage. If it hits a wall, this move's cooldown is reduced by half and Inteleon is pulled to the wall and starts camouflaging.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Reduces this move's cooldown by 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Acrobatics
Upgrade 2.Description: Inteleon glides in the designated direction. If it hits a Pokémon or a wall, it can glide in a designated direction a second time. If Inteleon hits a Pokémon while gliding, Inteleon deals damage to it and decreases its movement speed by 30% for 2s. Every time Inteleon glides in a designated direction, it gains a critical counter. If Inteleon bounces off a wall or Pokémon, Liquidation's current cooldown is reduced by 2s. This move can also be used while attacking with Liquidation.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the first glide's travel distance.

Move 2.Name: Water Gun
Move 2.Description: Inteleon squirts water, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon it hits.

Upgrade 1.Name: Snipe Shot
Upgrade 1.Description: Inteleon aims for up to 6s and then fires, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon it hits while partially ignoring their Sp. Def. by 15%/20%/25% depending on distance (close, mid, far respectively). Aiming reduces the possible spread of the shot, reaching maximum precision after aiming for 1.25s. The farther away the user is from the Pokémon it hits, the more damage it does. A maximum of three uses can be kept in reserve for this move. There is a 1.5s cooldown between uses.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Reduces the cooldown for charges by 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Liquidation
Upgrade 2.Description: Inteleon starts firing water projectiles at the designated Pokémon. Inteleon fires a total of 8 projectiles in 1.7s and is slowed by 60% while firing. Water projectiles can hit targets other than the designated Pokémon and only deal damage to the first Pokémon they hit. If this move hits the same Pokémon 5 times in a short time, Inteleon will deal 20% increased damage to this Pokémon for 3s.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the number of projectiles shot during the duration to 10.

Unite Move.Name: Azure Spy Vision
Unite Move.Description: For 10.5s, Inteleon can see nearby Pokémon that are in stealth or hiding in tall grass.
Unite Move.Buffs: 20% Max HP Shield, 30% Movement Speed, 35% Attack Speed

Passive Ability.Name: Shell Armor
Passive Ability.Description: If Lapras would take a single instance of damage that would be greater than 10% of Lapras's maximum HP, this damage will be reduced by 20%.

Lapras.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, shooting water through the target and dealing increased damage to Pokémon hit by the spray. The boosted attack also heals Lapras.

Move 1.Name: Whirlpool
Move 1.Description: Create a whirlpool centered on Lapras that lasts for 3s, dealing damage over time to opposing Pokémon in the area of effect. The time between hits is shorter the farther opposing Pokémon are from the whirlpool’s center.

Upgrade 1.Name: Water Pulse
Upgrade 1.Description: Release a pulse of water centered on itself that spreads out, dealing damage to Pokémon it hits and decreasing their movement speed by 30% for 2s. For each opposing Pokémon hit by a pulse from this move, an additional pulse will be released the next time this move is used within 8 seconds, up to a total of 3 pulses. If the first pulse after activating this move hits a Pokémon, the user’s next basic attack becomes a boosted attack.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the maximum number of pulses to 4.

Upgrade 2.Name: Perish Song
Upgrade 2.Description: Sing an eerie melody that echoes around yourself, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon it hits. This move can be used up to three times consecutively within 5s of its last use. Pokémon hit all three times take additional damage equal to one Perish Song hit. If the additional damage would bring an enemy Pokémon below 10% of their max HP, that enemy Pokémon will take 40% of their maximum HP as True Damage.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: The next basic attack after using this move becomes a boosted attack.

Move 2.Name: Ice Shard
Move 2.Description: Hurl 5 chunks of ice in a forward direction, dealing damage to Pokémon they hit and leaving them frozen for 0.6s. If this move hits a Pokémon that is already frozen, it deals damage to it and shoves in the direction of the ice shards for 0.4s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Bubble Beam
Upgrade 1.Description: Create a bubble shield on Lapras for up to 4s or until the shield is broken, then spray 5 bubbles with a beam in the designated direction. Pokémon hit by the bubbles take damage and are enveloped by it, leaving them unable to act for 1s. After the bubbles fly a set distance, they slowly float for 3s. Pokémon hit by a floating bubble are enveloped by it and left unable to act for 1s, but will not be damaged.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the strength of the shield granted by this move.

Upgrade 2.Name: Ice Beam
Upgrade 2.Description: Unleash an icy-cold beam of energy in the designated direction, dealing damage to Pokémon hit and freezing the ground for 3s. Pokémon on the frozen ground take damage equal to the beam's damage every 0.4s they remain on it and have their movement speed decreased by 15% for 2s stacking up to 6 times. Pokémon become frozen for 1s if they remain on the frozen ground for 3 ticks. When Lapras is on the frozen ground, Lapras's movement speed is increased by 20%, lingering for 0.5s if Lapras leaves the frozen ground.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increase the duration Pokémon are Frozen for to 1.5s.

Unite Move.Name: Lapras Express
Unite Move.Description: Ride a wave quickly and continuously forward becoming Unstoppable for up to 15s. Lapras’s movement speed increases every second while riding but decreases if the user hits an obstacle. If this move is used again, the user stops and launches a wave that continues moving forward, dealing damage to Pokémon it hits and throwing them for 1.5s. If the user hits an enemy Pokémon while still riding, the user stops in place, dealing damage to and throwing the opposing Pokémon for 1.5s. While the user is riding the wave, one nearby ally Pokémon of the user’s choice within range may be picked up and can ride on its back. Ally Pokémon riding on the user’s back can dismount whenever they choose.
Unite Move.Buffs: 20% Max HP Shield on activation, 40% Max HP shield and 30% Movement speed after stopping.

Passive Ability.Name: Chlorophyll
Passive Ability.Description: While Leafeon is not in tall grass, the Chlorophyll gauge charges over 9s. When the gauge is full, Leafeon's movement speed is increased by 15%.

Leafeon.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing additional damage.

Move 1.Name: Swift
Move 1.Description: Launches three stars in the designated direction in a cone, dealing damage to enemies hit. The first star that hits applies a debuff that lasts 1 second that causes subsequent stars to deal 70% reduced damage.

Upgrade 1.Name: Razor Leaf
Upgrade 1.Description: Launches a fan of five sharp-edged leaves in the designated direction in a cone, dealing damage to enemies hit before sticking into the ground for 2.5s. If this move is activated again, the leaves return, dealing damage to Pokémon they hit along the way. If the reactivation time is 1s or longer, the leaves will return and deal increased damage. If the move is not reactivated, the leaves will automatically return dealing increased damage. If five leaves hit the same Pokémon (outgoing or incoming) within 0.5s, Leafeon is granted a shield lasting 1.5s. Leafeon also receives 20% increased movement speed for up to 3s while the leaves are out. Each fan, the first leaf that hits applies a debuff that lasts 1s and causes subsequent leaves within the same fan (outgoing or incoming) to deal 70% reduced damage.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increase the strength of the shield when five leaves hit.

Upgrade 2.Name: Solar Blade
Upgrade 2.Description: Start gathering light and filling a blade with the light's energy. If this move is used again after light has been gathered, Leafeon brings the blade down in the designated direction, dealing damage to Pokémon it hits. The longer the blade is filled with light energy, the more damage is dealt. If this move is used when the Chlorophyll gauge is full, the blade is brought down immediately, dealing maximum damage and the cooldown for the next use of this move is reduced by 50%. The cooldown of this move is also reduced by 50% upon the Chlorophyll gauge being filled.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: While charging, Leafeon receives 40% damage reduction.

Move 2.Name: Quick Attack
Move 2.Description: Dash in a direction, dealing damage to enemies hit.

Upgrade 1.Name: Aerial Ace
Upgrade 1.Description: Dash in a direction, dealing damage to enemies hit. The next attack is a boosted attack non-Chlorophyll empowered. A maximum of two uses may be kept in reserve for this move and cannot be used more than once every 0.5s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Reduces the cooldown for charges by 0.5s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Leaf Blade
Upgrade 2.Description: Dash and spin in a direction, slashing around itself and with a ring of sharp leaves, dealing damage three times. Enemies caught by the outside edge of the ring of sharp leaves take increased damage and are slowed by 40% for 2s. Enemies damaged by the outside edge also charge the Chlorophyll gauge by 1s per hit.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Reduces this move's cooldown by 1.2s for each hit dealing damage to more than one enemy on the outer ring

Unite Move.Name: Emerald Two-Step
Unite Move.Description: Leaps at a designated enemy, dealing damage to them and all enemies around them. These Pokémon are additionally slowed by 50% for 2s. After the initial leap, Leafeon leaps up and lands with force dealing damage to enemies in an area. Enemies hit by this area take more damage the closer they are to the center of this area. Leafeon is unstoppable during this move.
Unite Move.Buffs: 80% Movement Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Steadfast
Passive Ability.Description: When at 50% max HP or below, grants this Pokémon a shield and increases their movement speed by 20% for 5s (60s CD).

Lucario.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with increased range every third attack, damaging opposing Pokémon with a normal basic attack, then following up with a combo attack using a bone, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area a second time and throwing them for 0.5s.

Move 1.Name: Quick Attack
Move 1.Description: The user dashes forward, damaging opposing Pokémon hit.

Upgrade 1.Name: Extreme Speed
Upgrade 1.Description: Charge forward with breathtaking speed. If this move hits an enemy from point-blank range, its cooldown is reset and it restores the user's HP. However, the cooldown cannot be continually reset by using this move on the same enemy multiple times in succession. After learning this move, nearby opposing Pokémon have an Extreme Speed marker automatically applied to them. The first opposing Pokémon with a marker hit by Extreme Speed's dash will reset this move's cooldown and have their marker removed. There is a 10s cooldown before a target can have an Extreme Speed marker automatically applied to them again (apart from other moves).
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the user's Attack by 7.5% for 2s when this move is used.

Upgrade 2.Name: Power-Up Punch
Upgrade 2.Description: Charges power before unleashing a powerful attack. While the user is charging power, its movement speed is decreased but its Attack slowly increases and the damage it receives is reduced. The user then charges in the designated direction and releases this move, dealing more damage the lower the enemies remaining HP is. The next basic attack becomes a boosted attack if the move hits. This move's cooldown is reduced every time one of the user's moves hits. Against wild Pokémon: additional missing HP damage is capped at 1000.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Becomes unstoppable while charging this move.

Move 2.Name: Meteor Mash
Move 2.Description: The user punches with the force of a meteor in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon hit and shoving them.

Upgrade 1.Name: Bone Rush
Upgrade 1.Description: Performs a combo attack with a bone, dealing multiple damaging blows to enemies and shoving them. The final attack sends the bone flying. If used again while the bone is traveling, the user rushes to the location of the bone, dealing damage to nearby enemies. Landing one of the three initial strikes on opposing Pokémon applies an Extreme Speed marker to them.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Catching the bone with the second use resets the cooldown of Extreme Speed or Power-Up Punch.

Upgrade 2.Name: Close Combat
Upgrade 2.Description: Unleash a combo attack, dealing multiple blows to enemies and shoving them. The next auto attack within 5s after using this move gains increased range and causes the user to lunge at an opposing Pokémon with a kick.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the damage of this move.

Unite Move.Name: Aura Cannon
Unite Move.Description: The user becomes unstoppable and channels aura into a huge sphere, then launches the sphere in the designated direction, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon in its path. The aura sphere picks up speed as it travels; at close range, a target can be hit up to 4 times, while at max speed a target will only be hit once.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Guts
Passive Ability.Description: Increases Attack by 10% for 5s when afflicted by any debuff.

Machamp.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage when it hits. This boosted attack also decreases the movement speed of enemies by 50% for 1s.

Move 1.Name: Karate Chop
Move 1.Description: Machamp attacks in a straight line dealing damage to enemies hit.

Upgrade 1.Name: Close Combat
Upgrade 1.Description: Unleash a series of punches in the designated direction, dealing increased damage with the last punch. The user can move while using this move and becomes immune to hindrances.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Deals 25% additional damage if the target is affected by a status condition.

Upgrade 2.Name: Cross Chop
Upgrade 2.Description: Has the user deliver a double chop with forearms crossed while dashing forward. This increases the user's critical-hit rate.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Machamp’s auto attacks increases Atk by 2 per target hit, permanently stacking up to 40 times.

Move 2.Name: Bulk Up
Move 2.Description: Machop buffs themselves for 3s becoming unstoppable, increasing attack by 15%, attack speed by 40% and movement speed by 30% inititally, diminishing gradually every 1s. Machop's next attack is boosted.

Upgrade 1.Name: Dynamic Punch
Upgrade 1.Description: Jump to the designated location, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect and leaving them unable to act when it hits. After using this move, the user becomes immune to hindrances, their movement speed and basic attack speed is increased. The next basic attack also becomes a boosted attack.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Further increases movement speed by 30%, Attack bonus by 5%, and slow by 20%.

Upgrade 2.Name: Submission
Upgrade 2.Description: Increases movement speed and become immune to hindrances. When the next basic attack hits, the attack deals increased damage and slams the enemy onto the ground, leaving it unable to act. Once this move ends, the user's critical-hit rate and basic attack speed are increased for a short time.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Further increases Critical-Hit Rate by 5% and Attack Speed by 10%.

Unite Move.Name: Barrage Blow
Unite Move.Description: Machamp gains increased movement speed by 10%, Attack by 25%, Defense by 250, and Sp. Defense by 250 for 8s before unleashing an unstoppable combo attack that continuously shoves enemies in the area of effect.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 35% Attack Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Thick Fat
Passive Ability.Description: When Mamoswine deals damage, Defense and Sp. Def are increased for 5s, stacking up to 3 times. When Mamoswine uses Ice Shard, Icicle Crash or Ice Fang, the next auto attack is boosted. If any of these moves creates a freezing area of effect inside an ally goal zone, the goal-scoring speed of enemies is decreased by 30% for 5s.

Mamoswine.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing damage and freezing enemies for 0.5s when it hits. Mamoswine's auto attacks deal increased damage for a short time to enemies recently frozen with one of Mamoswine's moves.

Move 1.Name: Ice Shard
Move 1.Description: Hurls 3 chunks of ice at the designated location, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect and decreasing their movement speed by 40% for 1.5s. If an enemy is hit by all three chunks, they're left frozen for 0.5s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Icicle Crash
Upgrade 1.Description: Drops icicles on the designated location, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect and decreasing their movement speed for a short time. The final icicle shatters after a set amount of time or when hit by Mamoswine's other moves or boosted attacks, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect and leaving them frozen. If the icicle is shattered by Tackle or High Horsepower, the ground is covered in ice, which increases the movement speed of allies that run over it. The next basic attack is boosted.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: The final icicle leaves enemies hit unable to act for .2s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Ice Fang
Upgrade 2.Description: Uses cold-infused fangs to throw the opposing Pokémon closest to the user, dealing damage and leaving them frozen for a short time. The user can then designate a direction to slam the thrown Pokémon forward or backward, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect and leaving them frozen for a short time. The next basic attack is boosted.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the area of effect in which enemies are left frozen after the slam attack.

Move 2.Name: Tackle
Move 2.Description: Mamoswine rushes recklessly in the designated direction; dealing damage to enemies hit and throws them in the air for 0.5s.

Upgrade 1.Name: High Horsepower
Upgrade 1.Description: Mamoswine rushes recklessly in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies they hit and shove them. Mamoswine then stomps their feet, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect and leaves them unable to act for a short time. This stomping deals increased damage to frozen enemies.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the reckless rush's speed and the length of time enemies are left unable to act by .2s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Earthquake
Upgrade 2.Description: Mamoswine leaps up in the designated direction and lands forcefully, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect and pulling them toward Mamoswine.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Decreases movement speed of enemies by 30% for 2.5s when this move hits and increases the move's pulling power.

Unite Move.Name: Mammoth Mash
Unite Move.Description: Mamoswine jumps to the designated location then repeatedly stomps the ground four times, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect and decreases their movement speed for 0.5s with each stomp. The first stomp slows enemies by 30%, the two mini stomps slow them by 20%, and the final stomp slows them by 40% and throws them in the air for 1.5s. Mamoswine is unstoppable for the duration of the move.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 40% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Overgrow
Passive Ability.Description: When the user is at 50% max HP or less, if they would take damage they instead disappear into leaves, becoming invincible for 0.3s and invisible for 1.5s or until attacking (60s CD). This effect also increases the user's movement speed by 15%, damage by 15% and heals by 15% of the damage dealt for 4s.

Meowscarada.Attack: Gains a boosted attack every 5 seconds that leaps towards the target dealing additional damage.

Move 1.Name: Leafage
Move 1.Description: Launch 4 leaves that deal damage to enemies hit and decrease their movement speed by 50% for 2.5s. When an enemy is hit by a leaf, subsequent leaves deal 20% reduced damage.

Upgrade 1.Name: Flower Trick
Upgrade 1.Description: Attach a flower bomb to an enemy that lasts up to 5s. This move can be used again to detonate the flower bomb at will. When it explodes it deals damage and additional damage equal to 18% of the target's missing HP. Against Wild Pokémon: The additional damage from missing HP is capped at 1000. If an enemy that has a flower bomb attached to them is damaged by Meowscarada, the explosion's area of effect and damage are increased. If the explosion knocks out an enemy player with this move, the move's cooldown is reset.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the range of application and explosion's area of effect. Also increases movement speed when planting the seed by 30% for 3s diminishing by 10% every 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Night Slash
Upgrade 2.Description: The users throws 3 slashing waves with their claws, dealing damage and applying a mark for 5s to enemies hit. Subsequent waves deal 50% damage of the first.
