Basic attacks by Meowscarada have 50% increased critical-hit rate on marked enemies. When Meowscarada deals damage to marked enemies with basic attacks, this move's cooldown is reduced by 0.5s and Meowscarada recovers HP. The HP recovery works in a cycle of 3 basic attacks; the first attack will heal 100% of the ratio, the second 50% and the third 10%, then the fourth will heal 100% of the ratio again.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the critical-hit rate on marked enemies to a 65% increase and restores additional HP from hitting marked targets.

Move 2.Name: Hone Claws
Move 2.Description: Dash in a designated direction while sharpening claws, increasing attack speed by 80% and increasing the damage of the next three basic attacks for 3s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Double Team
Upgrade 1.Description: Dash and create an illusory copy in order to befuddle enemies. The clone has the same HP and defenses as Meowscarada but takes 30% more damage and lasts for 3.3s. If this move is used again, the user swaps places with the illusory copy, dispelling the copy and creating an explosion of petals at both the clone and Meowscarada's positions that deal damage and leave enemies hit unable to act for 0.8s. Enemies may only take damage from one petal explosion. If the clone's HP were to reach 0 before a swap, the same type of petal explosion occurs at the clone's location only. Creating the clone also increases Meowscarada's movement speed by 70% for 3s diminishing by 10% every 0.5s. Cooldown starts when first used.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the duration of the clone to 4.6s and sets the increased damage the clone receives to 20%.

Upgrade 2.Name: Trailblaze
Upgrade 2.Description: Leap to the designated location, dealing damage to enemies hit and leaving them paralyzed, decreasing their attack speed by 40% and movement speed by 40% for 2s. If Meowscarada hits enemies with this move, Meowscarada's basic attack speed is increased by 100% for 4s and movement speed is increased by 60% for 4s diminishing by 5% every 0.5s down to minimum of 35%. When used from tall grass, this move's leap range increases. If Meowscarada knocks out an enemy player or makes an assist, this move's cooldown is reset.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Grants a shield that lasts 3 seconds when used.

Unite Move.Name: Floral Flourish
Unite Move.Description: Move instantly to the designated location, creating a whirlwind around Meowscarada for 3s that continually deals damage to enemies every 0.25s, up to 13 times. During the blink, Meowsacarda is Invincible. Then, Meowscarada will slowly walk forward with the storm. While using this move, the user cannot use other attacks or change directions without the use of Eject Button, and the move can be stopped if it is used again. Hits on enemy Pokémon reduce the cooldown of Night Slash and Flower Trick by 1 second per enemy hit.
Unite Move.Buffs: 80% Movement Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Clear Body
Passive Ability.Description: Reduces the duration of hindrance effects by 10% when enemy players are nearby. The more enemy players there are, the more the hindrance effects are reduced, up to a maximum of 5 enemy players (50% max).

Metagross.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, striking with an increased area of attack. When a boosted attack hits, the cooldown of Iron Defense, Meteor Mash or Gyro Ball is reduced by 10%. If multiple targets are hit, the cooldown is instead reduced by 20%.

Move 1.Name: Iron Defense
Move 1.Description: Gain a shield lasting 5s and gain a boosted attack. That boosted attack deals additional damage.

Upgrade 1.Name: Meteor Mash
Upgrade 1.Description: The user charges power in their fist, dealing damage to enemies in an area up to 4x and slowing them by 20% for 3s while granting the user a shield for 5s. Enemies may dodge the charging damage by moving out of the area. The more enemies that this move hits, the more shield the user gains (stacking up to 8 times) and the more damage is dealt with the next basic attack. The next basic attack hits with a hard punch fired like a meteor, dealing damage to enemies in an area of effect. The level of charge depends on how many hits were made during the charging.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Restores HP when the punch hits enemies.

Upgrade 2.Name: Gyro Ball
Upgrade 2.Description: Spin rapidly, dealing damage to nearby enemies. Hitting enemies with the outer edge of the spin grants a shield to the user for 4s. The shield stacks based on the number of targets hit up to a maximum of 6 times, with wild Pokémon granting 1 stack and enemy players granting 3 stacks.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: On expiration of shield duration, converts 30% of the remaining shield to healing.

Move 2.Name: Tackle
Move 2.Description: Scan in a designated direction. If the scan hits an enemy, the user then charges toward the enemy hit, dealing damage.

Upgrade 1.Name: Zen Headbutt
Upgrade 1.Description: Fires a psychic wave in a designated direction. If the move hits an enemy, the user then charges toward the enemy hit, dealing damage and throwing them for 0.8s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: After dealing damage with Zen Headbutt, reduce incoming damage by 20% for 2s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Magnet Rise
Upgrade 2.Description: Levitates for up to 4s using electrically-generated magnetism, increasing the user's movement speed by 60% diminishing by 15% every second. If a basic attack is made while levitating, the user will fall to the ground forcefully, dealing damage to nearby enemies and knocking them up for 0.6s. This basic attack can lunge at a target crossing terrain and obstacles.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: While levitating, reduce incoming damage by 30%.

Unite Move.Name: Compute and Crush
Unite Move.Description: Quickly analyzes the position of nearby enemies, granting a shield based on the number of enemies analyzed and become unstoppable. When 2 or fewer enemies are analyzed, lunge towards the enemy with the lowest HP, leaving it unable to act for 0.8s and dealing damage to it thrice, with the third hit dealing damage based on the target's missing HP. If an enemy is knocked out by this move, the user recovers 30% of its Unite Move gauge. If there are three or more analyzed, lunge toward the enemy with the lowest HP, dealing damage to nearby enemies and creating a wall around the user. If a wall is created, Compute and Crash may be used again to take down the wall.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 30% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Move Reset
Passive Ability.Description: When Mew reaches level 5, the Move Reset icon can be used to reset Mew's moves and learn new moves. This ability goes on a 25s cooldown after it's used. Each time Mew knocks out or makes an assist on an enemy player, or scores a goal, the Move Reset cooldown is reduced (Knockout: 40%, Assist: 20%, Goal: 5%). Using Move Reset adds 5000 Unite Move energy to Mystical Mirage.

Mew.Attack: Each time Mew uses a move, they gain a boost counter. A maximum of 3 boost counters can be stored. After 3 counters are stored (they have to be consumed within 8s or they disappear), Mew's next basic attack becomes a boosted attack that consumes all counters and launches a ball of psychic energy at an enemy. During the lock-on animation Mew can use moves. The further the ball travels, the more damage it deals (4% more damage per threshold, stacking additively). This ball pierces through wild Pokémon, but will stop traveling upon contact with the first enemy player.

Move 1.Name: Electro Ball
Move 1.Description: Hurl an electric orb, dealing damage to enemies in the area-of-effect and leaving them paralyzed (40% slow) for 2s. This move deals more damage the lower the enemies' remaining HP is. Through Light Screen: Damage dealt and area-of-effect radius are increased.

Upgrade 1.Name: Solar Beam
Upgrade 1.Description: Blast a bundled beam of light, dealing damage 3 times to enemies in the area-of-effect. If this move hits an enemy, Mew gains an additional boost counter. Through Light Screen: Damage dealt and area-of-effect radius are increased.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Reduce this move's cooldown by 0.5s for each enemy hit.

Upgrade 2.Name: Surf
Upgrade 2.Description: Charge forward on a wave, shoving enemies for 0.5s and leaving them unable to act for 0.5s. Mew gains a shield for 3s and becomes immune to hindrances while using this move. At the end of this move, Mew can jump in a designated direction and becomes immune to hindrances for a short time. If this move hits an enemy, Mew gains an additional boost counter. Through Light Screen: Distance the wave travels is increased and Light Screen attaches to Mew.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Strengthens the shield effect of this move.

Move 2.Name: Coaching
Move 2.Description: Teleport to an ally, granting them a shield for 3s and increasing basic attack speed by 40% for 2s. If this move is used on an ally who hasn't been coached within 7s, the cooldown of this move is reduced by 90%. If this move is used on an ally who has been recently coached, this move goes on cooldown. The cooldown of Electro Ball, Solar Beam, and Surf is reduced by 1s each time this move is used.

Upgrade 1.Name: Light Screen
Upgrade 1.Description: Create a translucent wall in the designated location for 4s that prevents enemies from passing and shoves them for 0.5s if they make contact with the wall. If Mew's Electro Ball, Solar Beam, or Surf passes through the wall, the effects of those moves will be enhanced (such as increased damage, range, and area-of-effect). If this move is used again within 4s, the wall is pulled towards Mew and follows them as they move for an additional 4s. While the wall moves with Mew, enemy attacks that pass through it will deal 25% reduced damage but will not prevent enemies from passing and does not shove them anymore.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the size of the wall.

Upgrade 2.Name: Agility
Upgrade 2.Description: Move quickly in a designated direction, increasing Mew's movement speed by 5% for 2s. Holds 2 uses in reserve and cannot be used more than once every 2s.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the distance Mew moves in the designated direction.

Unite Move.Name: Mystical Mirage
Unite Move.Description: Mew becomes unstoppable and floats in the air for 1s, then becoming invincible and invisible for up to 6s until using an attack or move. A field is created around Mew for 5s This field travels with Mew. Mew and all allies within the area become stealthed for 4s. After the field expires, this move deals damage to enemies within the area-of-effect.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Pressure
Passive Ability.Description: When Mewtwo deals damage to enemy players with a basic attack, the Mega gauge increases up to 8 times. As the Mega gauge increases, Mewtwo's Attack, Defense, and Sp. Def are increased by 2%, up to 10 times. If Mewtwo is level 5 or higher, and the Mega gauge has increased at least 8 times, it Mega Evolves. The Mega Evolution lasts 10s and increases Mewtwo's Attack by an additional 10%, its Defense and Sp. Def by an additional 10%, its max HP by 10% and its movement speed by 5%, and has a fixed attack speed. Consumes up to 30 Aeos Energy upon Mega Evolving. Mega Evolution duration is extended by 1 second for every 5 energy consumed. Energy is consumed regardless if you have the next multiple of 5.

MewtwoX.Attack: When Mewtwo Mega Evolves, deal increased damage and becomes a boosted attack with every third attack.

Move 1.Name: Confusion
Move 1.Description: Deal damage to an enemy and leave them unable to act for 1s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Future Sight
Upgrade 1.Description: Mewtwo pulls the designated enemy toward itself dealing damage, leaving them unable to act for 0.75s and locking on to them. The locked-on enemy has their movement speed decreased by 25% for 3s and takes 20% increased damage from Mewtwo. After 3s, Mewtwo deals damage to the locked-on enemy a second time, and additional damage equal to 50% of any damage they received from Mewtwo while locked-on. Against Enemy Players: Maximum damage is capped at 2000.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: The locked-on enemy instead takes 30% increased damage.

Upgrade 2.Name: Psystrike
Upgrade 2.Description: Mewtwo becomes unstoppable and starts directing psychic waves at the designated enemy, each hit dealing damage and decreasing their movement speed by 10% for 1s, stacking up to 5 times. While Mewtwo is directing psychic waves, it takes 15% reduced damage. At the end of the move, Mewtwo sends a final hit, dealing damage to the designated enemy and nearby enemies then throws them for 1s. If Psystrike is intercepted by an enemy that isn't the intended target, there's no explosion and the enemy hit is shoved instead.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Movement speed reduction on enemies is increased to 15% for 1s, stacking up to 5 times.

Move 2.Name: Barrier
Move 2.Description: Mewtwo gains a shield for 3s. While the shield effect is active, its movement speed is increased by 20%.

Upgrade 1.Name: Recover
Upgrade 1.Description: Mewtwo gains a shield for 3s. While the shield effect is active, movement speed is increased by 30%, and Mewtwo recovers HP equal to 20% of all incoming damage received from enemies while the shield is active. When Mewtwo takes enough damage for the shield effect to be removed, all of the user's move cooldowns are reduced by 25% of their current cooldown, and the Mega gauge increases twice.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the amount of HP recovered to 30% of incoming damage received.

Upgrade 2.Name: Teleport
Upgrade 2.Description: Mewtwo teleports to the designated location. For 5s, movement speed is increased by 10%, Mewtwo deals 10% more damage, and the Mega gauge increases 50% faster.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Damage dealt is increased to 15%.

Unite Move.Name: Infinite Psyburn
Unite Move.Description: Mewtwo becomes unstoppable while revealing enemy players and channeling a powerful attack on the enemies' current position. After 1s, Mewtwo brings down a powerful psychic beam on their original position, dealing damage to enemies around each point of impact, leaving them unable to act for 1s and decreasing their Defense by 20% for 3s. Each Pokémon can only be hit by 1 psychic beam.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Pressure
Passive Ability.Description: When Mewtwo deals damage to enemy players with a basic attack, the Mega gauge increases up to 12 times. As the Mega gauge increases, Mewtwo's Sp. Atk is increased by 1.5%, and attack speed is increased by 6%, up to 10 times. If Mewtwo is level 5 or higher, and the Mega gauge has increased at least 12 times, Mewtwo Mega Evolves. The Mega Evolution lasts 10s and increases Sp.Atk by an additional 10%, attack speed by an additional 40%, max HP by 10%, and movement speed by 5%. Mewtwo's attack speed bonuses are multiplicative. Consumes up to 30 Aeos Energy upon Mega Evolving. Mega Evolution duration is extended by 1 second for every 5 energy consumed. Energy is consumed regardless if you have the next multiple of 5.

MewtwoY.Attack: When Mewtwo Mega Evolves, attacks have increased range and deal damage in an area-of-effect centered on the target. When an attack deals damage to an enemy, their movement speed is decreased.

Move 1.Name: Confusion
Move 1.Description: Deal damage to an enemy and leave them unable to act for 1s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Future Sight
Upgrade 1.Description: Mewtwo shoves the designated enemy, dealing damage, leaving them unable to act for 0.5s and locking onto them. The locked-on enemy has their movement speed decreased by 35% for 3s and takes 10% increased damage from Mewtwo. After 3s, Mewtwo deals damage to the locked-on enemy a second time, and additional damage equal to 50% of any damage they received from Mewtwo while locked-on. Additional damage is capped at 1500.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: The locked-on enemy instead takes 15% increased damage.

Upgrade 2.Name: Psystrike
Upgrade 2.Description: Mewtwo becomes unstoppable and starts directing psychic waves at the designated enemy, each hit dealing damage and decreasing their movement speed by 10% for 1s, stacking up to 5 times. Psystrike damage is increased based on distance from the target enemy; the farther the projectile travels, the more damage it deals. At the end of the move, Mewtwo sends a final hit, dealing damage to the designated enemy and nearby enemies then throws them for 1s. If Psystrike is intercepted by an enemy that isn't the intended target, there's no explosion and the enemy hit is shoved instead.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Movement speed reduction on enemies is increased to 15% for 1s, stacking up to 5 times.

Move 2.Name: Barrier
Move 2.Description: Mewtwo gains a shield for 3s. While the shield effect is active, its movement speed is increased by 20%.

Upgrade 1.Name: Recover
Upgrade 1.Description: Mewtwo gains a shield for 3s. While the shield effect is active, movement speed is increased by 10%, and Mewtwo recovers HP equal to 30% of the damage it deals with attacks. If at the end of the 3s the shield hasn't been destroyed, all of the user's move cooldowns are reduced by 25% of their current cooldown, and the Mega gauge increases once.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the amount of HP recovered to 40% of damage dealt with attacks.

Upgrade 2.Name: Teleport
Upgrade 2.Description: Mewtwo teleports to the designated location. For 2s after the first cast of Teleport, movement speed is increased by 20%, Mewtwo deals 10% more damage, and the Mega gauge increases 50% faster. During those 2s, Mewtwo can teleport again once.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Damage dealt is increased to 15%.

Unite Move.Name: Infinite Psyburn
Unite Move.Description: Mewtwo becomes unstoppable while revealing enemy players and channeling a powerful attack on the enemies' current position. After 1s, Mewtwo brings down a powerful psychic beam on their original position, dealing damage to enemies around each point of impact, leaving them unable to act for 0.6s and decreasing their Sp. Defense by 15% for 3s. Each Pokémon can only be hit by 1 psychic beam.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Disguise
Passive Ability.Description: Mimikyu starts the game in Disguised Form. While in Disguised Form, when Mimikyu would take damage from an enemy, Mimikyu instead takes 5% remaining HP as piercing damage, becomes Impervious for 0.5s (immune to damage but not hindrances) and changes to Busted Form. A revenge mark is applied on the enemy that broke the disguise. Mimikyu's movement speed increases by 10% when approaching revenge-marked enemies and deals 10% increased damage to them. After 50s in Busted Form, Mimikyu returns to Disguised Form. The time it takes to return to Disguised Form is reduced by 25s when Mimikyu knocks out an enemy player and is fully reset upon respawning.

Mimikyu.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack or when using a move, striking twice with an increased area of attack.

Move 1.Name: Astonish
Move 1.Description: Shout in a startling fashion, dealing damage to enemies hit.

Upgrade 1.Name: Play Rough
Upgrade 1.Description: Mimikyu dashes in a designated direction. If Mimikyu connects with an enemy, Mimikyu latches on, becoming invincible and follows the target, slowing them by 30% for 1s and dealing damage to them 5 times. Mimikyu will then leap off of the enemy in a designated direction. Hits after the first deal 70% reduced damage.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases Mimikyu's movement speed by 20% for 3s after the attack is finished.

Upgrade 2.Name: Shadow Claw
Upgrade 2.Description: Mimikyu slashes in front of themself with sharp claws, dealing damage to enemies hit. Each hit decreases enemy movement speed by 20% for 1.5s, stacking up to 3 times, and restores the user's HP. Whenever Mimikyu hits at least one enemy with a basic or boosted attack, this move's cooldown is reduced by 1s, and the number of hits when this move is used again increases. Up to 4 of these additional hits can be stored and are lost after 5s without auto attacking.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: At the end of the move, deal an additional hit of damage equal to 10% of missing HP. This damage is capped at 500 against wild Pokémon.

Move 2.Name: Scratch
Move 2.Description: Mimikyu charges in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies hit and decreasing their movement speed by 20% for 2s. For 5s after using this move, Scratch can be used a second time, making Mimikyu attack in front of themself, dealing damage to enemies hit and additional damage based on their missing HP. Additional damage is equal to 10% of the enemy's missing HP. Against Wild Pokemon: The total damage is capped at 500.

Upgrade 1.Name: Shadow Sneak
Upgrade 1.Description: Mimikyu moves backwards a short distance and extends their shadow, marking an enemy hit as a shadow target for 3s. If the shadow passes through tall grass or a wall, the shadow extends even further. If Mimikyu deals damage to an enemy who is marked as a shadow target, each hit dealt will deal additional damage equal to 4% of the target's missing HP. If this move is used again, Mimikyu moves to the enemy marked as a shadow target, fears them for 0.25s, deals damage to enemies in an area, and extends the duration of that enemy's shadow mark. If the marked target gets knocked out Shadow Sneak's cooldown is reset and Mimikyu recovers HP. Against Wild Pokemon: The % missing HP damage is capped at 150.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Reduces this move's cooldown by 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Trick Room
Upgrade 2.Description: Leap to a location and create a bizarre area around Mimikyu in a square for 6s. If a slow would be applied to Mimikyu within the area, Mimikyu instead receives a movement speed increase equal to the slow rate. While inside the Trick Room, Mimikyu receives 70% reduced damage from enemies outside of the Trick Room. This move can be used as often as desired while inside the Trick Room, teleporting Mimikyu a set distance with each use.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Reduces this move's cooldown by 1s.

Unite Move.Name: Play With Me...
Unite Move.Description: Mimikyu leaps at an enemy and traps them inside Mimikyu's rag, dealing damage over time and granting the user a shield. The trapped enemy is only affected by this Unite Move and effects applied by Mimikyu before using this Unite Move. If Mimikyu loses their shield, or if 2.8s passes, the user stops attacking and jumps in the designated direction. The maximum number of hits is 7, hitting every 0.4s. The Unite buffs occur after the move ends. This ability counters Unstoppable.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Hadron Engine
Passive Ability.Description: Create Electric Terrain around Miraidon for 10s when hitting an enemy player with a Move. If Miraidon has Aeos Energy, up to 40 energy (in multiples of 10) will be consumed when the Electric Terrain is created, increasing the size of the Electric Terrain. Miraidon and Pokémon cannot be put to sleep on Electric Terrain. Miraidon on the Electric Terrain deals 30% additional Move damage while allies will deal 10% additional Move damage. Electric Terrain also strengthens ally team goals' healing and shielding by 30% and weakens enemy team goals' healing and shielding by 30%. This ability goes on a 30s cooldown after it's triggered.

Miraidon.Attack: Miraidon does not have a boosted attack.

Move 1.Name: Thunder Shock
Move 1.Description: Fire a jolt of electricity in a line in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies hit.

Upgrade 1.Name: Charge Beam
Upgrade 1.Description: Charge power before firing an electric beam in a designated direction. If this move hits an enemy, Miraidon's Sp. Atk is increased by 10% for 6s and stores electric power, stacking twice. If electric power is stored twice within a short time, Charge Beam becomes Boosted. Boosted Charge Beam can be held for up to 10s and continuously fires an electric beam in a designated direction, dealing damage to all enemies in the area of effect and granting Miraidon Hindrance Resistance. Miraidon may move while firing the electric beam but may not change the original direction. A maximum of 2 uses can be kept in reserve. There is a 1s cooldown between uses.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Reduces the cooldown to charge by 0.5s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Electro Drift
Upgrade 2.Description: Race forward while spinning, dealing damage to enemies in the path. If this move hits an enemy, Miraidon stores electric power. If electric power is stored twice within a short time, Electro Drift becomes Boosted. Boosted Electro Drift can be held for up to 10s and homes in on a designated enemy with the spinning attack, dealing damage to any enemy hit. This move deals increased damage instead if the remaining HP of the targets hit are below 50%. During this move, Miraidon is Hindrance Resistant. A maximum of 2 uses can be kept in reserve. There is a 1s cooldown between uses.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Reduces the cooldown to charge by 4s.

Move 2.Name: Thunder Wave
Move 2.Description: Discharges electricity at a designated enemy, dealing damage and leaving them paralyzed, decreasing attack speed by 10% and movement speed by 30% for 2s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Thunder
Upgrade 1.Description: Summon a cloud in the skies dropping thunderbolts at set intervals. The summoned cloud moves slowly towards the nearest enemy. Thunderbolts deal damage and apply a 10% slow to enemies hit.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the slow effect to 20%.

Upgrade 2.Name: Parabolic Charge
Upgrade 2.Description: Floods the area around Miraidon with electricity, dealing damage and applying a 50% slow to enemies hit for 2s. If this move hits an enemy, Miraidon recovers HP and 1 stored use of either Charge Beam or Electro Drift. The more targets hit, the more HP Miraidon recovers.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Grants a shield when this move is used.

Unite Move.Name: Bright Future Meteor Storm
Unite Move.Description: The user gains hindrance resistance and calls down up to 5 meteorites in a row, each at a designated area, damaging opposing Pokémon hit by each meteorite. If a meteorite hits an opposing Pokémon, it increases the damage of subsequent meteorites that hit by an additional 20% (up to 80% additional increased damage for the final meteorite if all preceding meteorites hit). The final meteorite damages opposing Pokémon in a wider area of effect and throws them for 1s when it hits.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Filter
Passive Ability.Description: Upon casting a Move, Mr. Mime takes 10% less damage for 2s.

Mr.Mime.Attack: Gains a Boosted Attack every 5s, dealing increased damage and throwing enemies in the air for 0.5s.

Move 1.Name: Fake Out
Move 1.Description: Mr. Mime claps, damaging and knocking back enemies hit for 0.4s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Confusion
Upgrade 1.Description: Attacks straight in front of the user, dealing damage to enemies and shoving them. If an enemy shoved by this move hits an obstacle, it receives increased damage from this move and is left unable to act for a short time. If the enemy is currently guard-swapped, it is not shoved but receives increased damage from this move and is left unable to act for a short time. Normal damage will apply to targets that are unstoppable or unstunnable. (Example: Drednaw & Zapdos)
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increased damage.

Upgrade 2.Name: Psychic
Upgrade 2.Description: Centers one telekinetic blast each on the user, any guard-swapped enemies, and any Light Screen or Barrier walls created by the user, damaging all enemies caught in the blasts and lowering their Sp. Defense for a short time. If an enemy is hit by multiple overlapping blasts, that enemy is also left unable to act for a short time.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Enemies hit by the pulses are additionally slowed by 30%.

Move 2.Name: Light Screen
Move 2.Description: Mr. Mime creates a wall that prevents enemies from passing. If an enemy is near the location where the wall is created, they are shoved and left unable to act for 0.5s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Barrier
Upgrade 1.Description: Create a translucent wall in the designated location that prevents enemies from passing. A maximum of two uses can be kept in reserve for this move and cannot be used more than once every 2s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Stores 3 uses in reserve instead.

Upgrade 2.Name: Power Swap
Upgrade 2.Description: Swaps the user's Defense and Sp. Defense stats with those of another Pokémon for a short time when it hits. Swapping with an enemy deals damage over time and decreases their movement speed while increasing the user's movement speed for a short time. Swapping with an ally increases the movement speed of that ally and the user for a short time. If the linked target is an ally, this move increases their movement speed by 8%, increases the amount of damage they deal by 15%, and continually restores their HP. If the linked target is an enemy, this move decreases their movement speed by 8%, decreases the amount of damage they deal by 15% and deals damage over time to them. Power Swap can be cleansed.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the amount of damage dealt by allies to 20% and decreases the amount of damage dealt by enemies to 20%.

Unite Move.Name: Showtime
Unite Move.Description: Mr. Mime leaps forward and begins a performance; stunning enemies for 0.5s, dealing damage in a large area around him 4 times, and becomes unstoppable for the duration. The final hit deals double damage and stuns enemies for 1s.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Snow Warning
Passive Ability.Description: Causes snow to fall on an enemy, dealing damage to it and decreasing their movement speed by 30% for .75s. This ability has a 4s cooldown. Boosted attacks, Snow Warning, and all moves (except Aurora Veil) sling snow; hitting the same target with snow 4 times will freeze them for 1s.

Ninetales.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack. When this boosted attack hits, it deals damage to nearby enemies and decreases their movement speed for a short time.

Move 1.Name: Powder Snow
Move 1.Description: Ninetales attacks with a chilly gust of powdery snow; dealing damage to enemies hit and decreasing their movement speed by 50% for 1s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Avalanche
Upgrade 1.Description: Attack with a gush of chilly ice toward the designated area. The ice forms a wall that cannot be passed through on land. After a short time this wall melts and collapses, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Also decreases the movement speed of enemies by 50% for 1s when this move hits.

Upgrade 2.Name: Dazzling Gleam
Upgrade 2.Description: Attack with a powerful cone of blinding light, leaving enemies unable to act when this move hits.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increased damage and stun duration to 1s.

Move 2.Name: Icy Wind
Move 2.Description: Attacks with a gust of freezing air; damaging, and slowing Pokémon hit by 20% for 1s. Icy Wind shoves Pokémon hit in the direction of the wind for a short distance unless they are already at the maximum range of the move.

Upgrade 1.Name: Blizzard
Upgrade 1.Description: Summons a howling blizzard in two blasts in front of the user. The first blast deals damage to enemies in the area of effect and decreases their movement speed for a short time. The second blast deals damage to enemies in the area of effect and shoves them. If the second blast hits an obstacle, it also deals damage to enemies near the point of impact.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increased damage.

Upgrade 2.Name: Aurora Veil
Upgrade 2.Description: Create an aurora around the user, reducing damage received by the user and nearby allies in the area of effect. While the user is inside the aurora, its movement speed is increased and its basic attacks become boosted attacks.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Damage reduction increased to 40% and cooldown reduced by 2s.

Unite Move.Name: Snow Globe
Unite Move.Description: Attack with a chilly blast of snow and ice; dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect around Ninetales when it hits. Deals increased damage to enemies that are frozen. Ninetales is unstoppable during the cast.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Static
Passive Ability.Description: When damaged, paralyzes nearby opposing Pokémon (30s CD). The movement speed of opposing Pokémon paralyzed by this Ability is decreased by 30% for 2.5s and their basic attack speed is decreased by 10% for 2s.

Pikachu.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage and paralyzing the opposing Pokémon hit. The movement speed of the opposing Pokémon paralyzed by boosted attacks is decreased by 30% and their basic attack speed is decreased by 10% for 1s.

Move 1.Name: Thunder Shock
Move 1.Description: Releases electricity at the designated opposing Pokémon, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and paralyzing them when it hits. The movement speed of opposing Pokémon paralyzed by this move is decreased by 30% and their basic attack speed is decreased by 10% for 2s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Electro Ball
Upgrade 1.Description: Hurl an electric orb, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect and leaving them paralyzed for a short time. This move's damage increases the lower the enemies remaining HP is. The movement speed of opposing Pokémon paralyzed by this move is decreased by 50% and their basic attack speed is decreased by 10% for 2s. Against wild Pokémon: additional missing HP damage is capped at 1200.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the damage of this move.

Upgrade 2.Name: Thunder
Upgrade 2.Description: Drop wicked thunderbolts, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Deals damage over time more frequently, hitting opposing Pokémon in the area of effect up to 7 times over 2.5s.

Move 2.Name: Electroweb
Move 2.Description: Launches an electric net at the designated opposing Pokémon, damaging the target and immobilizing them for 1.5s when the net captures them.

Upgrade 1.Name: Volt Tackle
Upgrade 1.Description: Has the user electrify itself and charge ahead, throwing opposing Pokémon.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Reduces this move's cooldown by 2s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Thunderbolt
Upgrade 2.Description: Attack with a strong electric blast, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect and leaving them unable to act.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the damage of this move.

Unite Move.Name: Thunderstorm
Unite Move.Description: Becomes unstoppable and jumps into the air, then casts down bolts of lightning 4 times over 3s in a radius around Pikachu. The first cast targets all Pokémon on the opposing team in range with 1 bolt each; these bolts damage up to 1 target each. The following 3 casts target up to 2 random Pokémon from the opposing team in range; these following bolts deal damage to opposing Pokémon in a small area around them, but targets can only be damaged once for each of the following 3 casts.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 30% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Swift Swim
Passive Ability.Description: When damaged by a Pokémon from the opposing team; increases movement speed by 40% for 2s, decaying by 10% every 0.5s (minimum 25% increased movement speed) (10s CD). This Pokémon's headache gauge increases by 1% for every 0.5% max HP damage received by Psyduck or nearby ally Pokémon from Pokémon on the opposing team. This gauge fills at a rate of 30% per 1s (requiring a total of 3.33s to fully charge). When the headache gauge is full, a mysterious power is triggered, interrupting Psyduck from casting moves, cleansing status conditions on themself, becoming unstoppable and decreasing their movement speed by 30% for 1s; then shoving nearby opposing Pokémon away for 0.8s, and resetting this Pokémon's move cooldowns. The mysterious power stays active for 10s, boosting moves and giving them 20% cooldown reduction. When the mysterious power ends, Psyduck cannot use moves or attacks, or charge their headache gauge for 2.5s.

Psyduck.Attack: Attacks with a shot of water. Psyduck has no boosted attack.

Move 1.Name: Confusion
Move 1.Description: Releases a weak telekinetic force in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon and stunning them for 1s when it hits. While the mysterious power is active, deals increased damage.

Upgrade 1.Name: Surf
Upgrade 1.Description: Creates a wave in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon and decreasing their movement speed by 30% for 2.5s when it hits; if opposing Pokémon already have their movement speed decreased when this move hits, they are also shoved for 0.5s. Rides the wave for at least 0.4s and until this move is used again or for up to 5s, moving forward and increasing movement speed by 30%; the user can use basic attacks and moves while riding the wave. Ally Pokémon who touch the wave while Psyduck is riding it have their movement speed increased by 70% for 3s (decaying by 10% every 0.5s over 2s; minimum 30%). When this move is used again, stops in place and creates another wave in the designated direction. While the mysterious power is active, creates two waves in the designated direction each time this move is used.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Decreases the damage dealt by opposing Pokémon hit by this move by 25% for 2.5s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Bubble Beam
Upgrade 2.Description: Forcefully ejects a spray of bubbles in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and attaching a mark with 3 bubbles to those hit for 5s. When a teammate damages opposing Pokémon with bubbles attached to them with auto attacks, a bubble bursts, damaging the target. When all bubbles on a target burst from auto attack damage, they are stunned for 0.5s and their movement speed is decreased by 30% for 2s. While the mysterious power is active, strengthens the damage dealt when bubbles burst.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Decreases the movement speed of opposing Pokémon hit by the beam by 30% for 2s.

Move 2.Name: Tail Whip
Move 2.Description: Wags their tail at the designated opposing Pokémon, damaging them and decreasing their movement speed by 30% and their Sp. Def by 20% for 2s. While the mysterious power is active, strengthens the Sp. Def decrease to 30%.

Upgrade 1.Name: Disable
Upgrade 1.Description: Releases electricity at the designated opposing Pokémon, damaging the target and stunning them for 0.2s. Opposing Pokémon hit by the electricity from this use of the move have a mark applied to them for 5s which has a disabling effect tied to it; the disabling effect increases the cooldown of the last move used by a marked target by 2s, or the next move used if no move is on cooldown (once only). When the disabling effect occurs, the target's movement speed is also decreased by 30% for 2s. The electricity spreads to a nearby opposing Pokémon up to 4 times; the electricity can only spread to the same target once. While the mysterious power is active, the electricity can spread up to 6 times; the electricity can spread to the same target up to 2 times.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Strengthens the stun duration to 0.5s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Psychic
Upgrade 2.Description: Decreases movement speed by 10% and releases a strong telekinetic force in the designated area, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and stunning them for 1s when it hits. Continues to release a telekinetic force at the Pokémon from the opposing team closest to the center of the area of effect when this move hits, marking them for 2s. If this move is used again or after 2s and the user is in range of the marked target, pulls the target a set distance in the designated direction (pulling them toward the user's location if no direction is designated), stunning them for 0.85s during the pull. While the mysterious power is active, stuns the target marked by this move for 0.2s after being pulled.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Decreases the Sp. Def of opposing Pokémon hit by the area of effect by 25% for 2s.

Unite Move.Name: Full-Power Psy-ay-ay!
Unite Move.Description: Releases three mysterious psychic waves around themself, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and decreasing the damage dealt by them by 25% for 3s when hit.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Surge Surfer
Passive Ability.Description: Alolan Raichu can use basic attacks while moving but is slowed by 30% when using basic attacks, Electro Ball or Thunderbolt. After using a move or a boosted attack: dashes in the direction of movement.

Raichu.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage and paralyzing the opposing Pokémon hit. Paralysis from Pikachu's boosted attacks decreases opposing Pokémon movement speed by 30% and reduces auto attack speed by a flat 10% for 2s.

Move 1.Name: Thunder Shock
Move 1.Description: Releases electricity at the designated opposing Pokémon; damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and paralyzing those hit. Paralysis from this move decreases opposing Pokémon movement speed by 30% and reduces auto attack speed by a flat 10% for 2s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Stored Power
Upgrade 1.Description: Increases auto attack speed by 35% and empowers the next 6 auto attacks for 5s. Each empowered auto attack also launches a star-shaped electric blast at the target, dealing additional damage. This move goes on cooldown after all 6 electric blasts have been launched or after 5s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: The electric blasts also decrease the target's Sp. Def by 10% for 3s (up to 3 times; maximum 30%).

Upgrade 2.Name: Electro Ball
Upgrade 2.Description: Hurls an electric orb toward the designated location, where it remains for up to 30s if it doesn't hit an opposing Pokémon on the way. When an electric orb and an opposing Pokémon touch; the orb releases its electricity and damages nearby opposing Pokémon. A maximum of 2 uses can be kept in reserve, with a 0.5s cooldown between uses. A maximum of 3 orbs can be on the map at a given time.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Deals damage every 0.5s over 3.5s (8 times) to opposing Pokémon hit by this move.

Move 2.Name: Thunder Wave
Move 2.Description: Discharges a weak jolt of electricity in the designated direction; damaging nearby opposing Pokémon and paralyzing those hit. Paralysis from this move decreases opposing Pokémon movement speed by 30% and reduces auto attack speed by a flat 10% for 2s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Thunderbolt
Upgrade 1.Description: Channels for 0.5s then releases a strong electric blast in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect, and paralyzing them when it hits. Paralysis from this move decreases opposing Pokémon movement speed by 30% and reduces auto attack speed by a flat 10% for 1s. If this move hits an electric orb created by Electro Ball; the orb releases its electricity, dealing increased damage to nearby opposing Pokémon.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Immobilizes opposing Pokémon hit for 1s instead of paralyzing them.

Upgrade 2.Name: Psychic
Upgrade 2.Description: Releases a strong telekinetic force in the designated area, damage opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and applying a debuff which decreases their movement speed by 23% for 3s when it hits. If the user hits debuffed opposing Pokémon with an auto attack, it deals additional damage. If this move hits an electric orb created by Electro Ball; the orb is pulled to the center of this move's area of effect. This does not extend the duration the electric orb remains.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Creates a damage-over-time area of effect, damaging opposing Pokémon inside the area every 0.5s over 2s (up to 5 times).

Unite Move.Name: Thunderstorm Aerial
Unite Move.Description: Creates a star-shaped zone of electricity in the designated area for 4s, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect when created, then damaging opposing Pokémon over time (up to 5 times) and decreasing their movement speed by 60% while in the zone.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 35% Attack Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Pastel Veil
Passive Ability.Description: The Pokémon's psychic counter charges based on the distance they run (up to 10 times). When the counter is full, the Pokémon is granted a shield, becoming hindrance resistant while the shield remains. When the Pokémon reaches an additional movement speed threshold, the damage dealt by moves is increased by 5/20/35/50/60%. Fairy Wind's damage is instead increased by 5/43/115/135/150% per additional movement speed threshold. The increased damage based on movement speed is calculated before dealing damage with moves.

Rapidash.Attack: Shoots energy from their horn, damaging the opposing Pokémon hit.

Move 1.Name: Confusion
Move 1.Description: The user releases a telekinetic force around themself, increasing their movement speed by 33% per opposing Pokémon hit for 5.5s (up to 2 times; maximum 66%) before damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect when it hits.

Upgrade 1.Name: Dazzling Gleam
Upgrade 1.Description: The user emits a powerful flash around themself after a delay, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect when it hits. The user gains 1 stack of 11% increased movement speed per wild Pokémon hit by the outer edge of the flash, or 2 stacks per Pokémon from the opposing team hit for 5.5s (up to 9 stacks; maximum 99% increased movement speed) before damaging them. If the outer edge of the flash hits Pokémon from the opposing team, the cooldown of Tackle, Smart Strike, or Agility is reduced by 30% of its current cooldown, successively with each target hit. Against wild Pokémon: Dazzling Gleam damage is capped at 2500.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Strengthens the cooldown reduction of Smart Strike or Agility to 50% of its current cooldown successively per Pokémon from the opposing team hit by the outer edge.

Upgrade 2.Name: Fairy Wind
Upgrade 2.Description: The user jumps to the designated location then stirs up a fairy wind when they land, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect. This move can be used again, up to 2 times total. If it's used 2 times, the third attack deals increased damage and throws opposing Pokémon for 0.8s when it hits.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Decreases the movement speed of opposing Pokémon hit by 20% for 2s with each use.

Move 2.Name: Tackle
Move 2.Description: The user charges at the designated opposing Pokémon, damaging them and decreasing their movement speed by 20% for 2s when it hits.

Upgrade 1.Name: Smart Strike
Upgrade 1.Description: The user charges at the designated opposing Pokémon and stabs them with their sharp horn, dealing damage when it hits. The user then leaps in a chosen direction, shoving the target in the opposite direction and stunning them for 1s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Charges the user's psychic counter by 5 when this move hits.

Upgrade 2.Name: Agility
Upgrade 2.Description: The user's movement speed increases by 5% when this move is used, increasing by an additional 7.5% every 0.5s over 3s (maximum 80% increased movement speed). This move's duration increases by 1.5s if the user moves or hits opposing Pokémon with moves (up to 5 times for an additional 7.5s; maximum 10.5s duration).
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Also restores 2% of the user's missing HP every 0.5s while their movement speed is increased by this move.

Unite Move.Name: Triad Blitz
Unite Move.Description: The user becomes unstoppable and charges at the designated opposing Pokémon, shoving opposing Pokémon in the way and stunning them for 0.8s when hit. When the charge ends, a mysterious triangular space is created around the designated opposing Pokémon if the user hits them. That Pokémon cannot leave that space.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Prankster
Passive Ability.Description: When Sableye is outside the visual range of enemy players, Sableye enters stealth and gains 10% increased movement speed. When Sableye enters the visual range of enemy players, Sableye does not immediately become visible but instead remains in stealth for 1.8s. Sableye exits stealth when attacking.

Sableye.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing damage to enemies hit and decreasing their movement speed by 20% for 2s. If Sableye is in stealth when hitting an enemy with a boosted attack, Sableye will deal damage and apply a fear effect for 1s. Enemies affected by fear will be forced to move away from Sableye with 40% reduced movement speed. When Sableye enters stealth, they will ready a boosted attack immediately and hold it.

Move 1.Name: Thief
Move 1.Description: Dashes in the designated direction, dealing damage to any Pokémon hit and slowing 20% for 2s. If this move hits an enemy, Sableye received 5 energy and removes up to 5 energy from the enemies hit. If those enemies did not have any Aeos energy, they will be left unable to act for 0.5s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Knock Off
Upgrade 1.Description: Dashes in the designated direction and then back again while attacking around itself, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon hit by the attacks and leaving them unable to act for a short time. For a short time afterward, this move can be used again. If it is, the user attacks in front of itself with its claws, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon it hits and throwing them. When either the first or second stage of this move hits opposing Pokémon, those Pokémon will drop some of their collected Aeos energy, and for a short time, they’ll be unable to pick up Aeos energy. When either stage of this move hits opposing Pokémon that do not have Aeos energy, those Pokémon will be left unable to act—and for a longer duration. While using this move, the user receives reduced damage.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Aeos energy picked up within 5s of using this move recovers 9% Max HP (one time per activation) and increases movement speed by 40% for 2s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Shadow Sneak
Upgrade 2.Description: For a short time, increases the user’s movement speed and has it enter stealth. While this move is active, the user’s next boosted basic attack deals additional damage. While this move is active, if the user exits stealth and is not immobilized by a hindrance, it will be able to enter stealth again.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the duration of this move’s effects to 7.5s. While this move is active and Sableye is in stealth, Sableye will also restore 1% max HP every 0.5s.

Move 2.Name: Astonish
Move 2.Description: Sableye attacks in a cone in front of themself, dealing damage to enemies hit and decreasing their movement speed by 30% for 2s. If this move hits enemies from behind, this move deals increased damage and applies a greater decrease in movement speed to 60%.

Upgrade 1.Name: Feint Attack
Upgrade 1.Description: Has the user throw dummy Aeos energy to a designated location. While dummy Aeos energy remains at a location, that location and the area around it will be visible to the user. Dummy Aeos energy can remain at up to five locations at a time. If an opposing Pokémon picks up dummy Aeos energy, that energy explodes, dealing damage over time to that Pokémon and decreasing its movement speed for a short time. A maximum of three uses can be kept in reserve for this move. Note: Placing the dummy energy does not break stealth. Stealth is only broken when an enemy takes damage from the dummy energy.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: If an enemy is knocked out while affected by this move, they will drop more Aeos energy than they normally would.

Upgrade 2.Name: Confuse Ray
Upgrade 2.Description: Fires a sinister ray in the designated direction, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon it hits. If this move hits Pokémon from the opposing team, it also leaves them confused. While confused, Pokémon are left unable to act and start continuously attacking nearby Pokémon with basic attacks. Confused Pokémon will target nearby Pokémon in the following order of priority: first, their ally Pokémon; then, wild Pokémon; last, Pokémon on Sableye's team. While confused, outgoing damage is decreased for auto attacks and move 1 by 50%. If the confused target knocks out a Wild Pokémon, Sableye receives the KO.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Also increases movement speed by 30% and attack speed by 50% from enemies of the opposing team while this move has left them confused.

Unite Move.Name: Chaos Glower
Unite Move.Description: Sableye becomes unstoppable for 1.2s and shoots light from both eyes, dealing damage to enemies in a cone in front of themself. Enemy players hit by this move who are facing Sableye are left unable to act for 3s and start preparing to return to base. If they take damage before returning to base, the return effect is cancelled, and they are left unable to act for 1.5s. Enemies hit by this move who are not facing Sableye have their movement speed decreased by 50% for 2s.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Technician
Passive Ability.Description: After this Pokémon uses a move, the next auto attack will deal two consecutive auto attacks instead. The second of these deals decreased damage. Technician lasts 5s and has no internal cooldown.

Scizor.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, decreasing enemy movement speed by 30% for 2s when it hits and increasing Scizor's Defense by 40% for 6s. This Defense increase can stack additively up to 3 times and the duration refreshes when gaining another stack.

Move 1.Name: Fury Cutter
Move 1.Description: Slashes twice dealing damage with its scythes in a cone. The second slash deals more damage than the first.

Upgrade 1.Name: Bullet Punch
Upgrade 1.Description: Dash in the designated direction and strike enemies, reducing this move's cooldown by 40% of its current cooldown if the attack connects and recovering a portion of HP with each hit. If Bullet Punch is used again within 8s, the number of punches increases. The number of punches increases from 3 to a maximum of 5.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Also grants a shield for 3s if this move hits an enemy.

Move 2.Name: Quick Attack
Move 2.Description: Dashes in designated direction dealing damage to enemies hit along the way.

Upgrade 1.Name: Double Hit
Upgrade 1.Description: Jumps in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies during the jump and applying a mark to that enemy until they leave combat. After hitting an enemy, jump again. An enhanced auto attack is prepared on landing that has increased range and charges at the enemy being attacked. This enhanced attack is available for 5s. If a marked enemy is knocked out, all of the user's move cooldowns are reset. The mark may be cleansed.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Reduces cooldown by 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Swords Dance
Upgrade 2.Description: Dashes a short distance, increasing Attack by 20% for 5s. While Swords Dance's attack buff is active, after basic attacks or abilities make contact 8 times, the user launches an area-of-effect attack that pierces through enemies in a line.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Reduces the damage the user receives by 50% while dashing (0.3s).

Unite Move.Name: Red Illusion Dive
Unite Move.Description: Target an enemy and punch them, dealing an initial hit of damage, decreasing their movement speed by 40% for 3s. Then create 5 copies that dash away from Scizor. If a copy hits a non targetted enemy while dashing out, it deals damage, decreases that enemy's movement speed by 40% for 3s, then disappears. If untouched, the illusory copy will remain on the battlefield for 8 seconds. Enemies that come in contact with an illusary copy will detonate the copy, having damage dealt to them an slowing them for 40% for 3s. For 8s after activation, this move may be used again, dashing in a designated direction dealing damage to enemies hit. The enemies hit are also grabbed and carried while Scizor continues dashing. At the end of the dash, Scizor punches the ground dealing damage in an area-of-effect. If the grabbed enemy hits an illusory copy during the shove, they will be dealt damage and be left incapacitated for 2s.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Technician
Passive Ability.Description: After this Pokémon uses a move, the next auto attack will deal two consecutive auto attacks instead. The second of these deals decreased damage. Technician lasts 5s and has no internal cooldown.

Scyther.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, striking twice. The first attack is a normal basic attack and the second of these deals decreased damage, can critically hit, and increases Scyther's movement speed by 40% for 3s.

Move 1.Name: Fury Cutter
Move 1.Description: Slashes twice dealing damage with its scythes in a cone. The second slash deals more damage than the first.

Upgrade 1.Name: Dual Wingbeat
Upgrade 1.Description: Slashes in front with scythes, dealing damage in an X-shaped area-of-effect. If the second slash deals damage to an enemy in the center, restore the user's HP. If this move hits an enemy, it can be activated again within a set amount of time. If this move is used again, the user dashes in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies hit. The dash deals more damage the lower their HP is.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the damage dealt by this move.

Move 2.Name: Quick Attack
Move 2.Description: Dashes in designated direction dealing damage to enemies hit along the way.

Upgrade 1.Name: Double Hit
Upgrade 1.Description: Jumps in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies during the jump and applying a mark to that enemy until they leave combat. After hitting an enemy, jump again. An enhanced auto attack is prepared on landing that has increased range and charges at the enemy being attacked. This enhanced attack is available for 5s. If a marked enemy is knocked out, all of the user's move cooldowns are reset. The mark may be cleansed.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Reduces cooldown by 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Swords Dance
Upgrade 2.Description: Dashes a short distance, increasing Attack by 20% for 5s. While Swords Dance's attack buff is active, after basic attacks or abilities make contact 8 times, the user launches an area-of-effect attack that pierces through enemies in a line.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Reduces the damage the user receives by 50% while dashing (0.3s).

Unite Move.Name: Green Illusion Dive
Unite Move.Description: Target an enemy, slashing through them dealing an initial hit of damage and creating 5 copies a set distance away. Copies deal damage to enemies they make contact with and apply a mark to them for 5s. After 5s, the copies return to Scyther, dealing damage to enemies they make contact with and healing Scyther for each hit. This move may be used again within 5s of activating as a dash in a designated direction dealing damage to enemies hit. The copies then dash to the end location of the user's dash. If a copy makes contact with an enemy while returning to Scyther, the copy deals damage to that enemy and disappears. If a marked enemy is knocked out, all of Scyther's move cooldowns are reset. Subsequent copies hitting the same target deal 70% reduced damage.
Unite Move.Buffs: 80% Movement Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Oblivious
Passive Ability.Description: Slowbro stores up lost HP for a short time (blue HP). Slowbro's Oblivious health remains for 6s and then decreases by 3% max HP every second. When dealing damage to an enemy with Water Gun, Scald, Surf, or Slowbeam - decrease their Sp.Def by 4% for 5s, stacking up to 5 times.

Slowbro.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack. When this boosted attack hits, deal damage to nearby enemies and decrease their movement speed by 30% for 1s.

Move 1.Name: Water Gun
Move 1.Description: Slowbro fires a stream of water, damaging and slowing enemies hit by 35% for 1s. This move can be channeled to increase its range and damage. Slowbro's movement speed is reduced while channeling. Restore some of Slowbro's Oblivious health (blue HP) once, after hitting an enemy.

Upgrade 1.Name: Scald
Upgrade 1.Description: Deal damage to opposing Pokémon and create steam when it hits. Opposing Pokémon inside the steam's area are left burned and have their movement speed decreased.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the size of the steam cloud.

Upgrade 2.Name: Surf
Upgrade 2.Description: Charge forward on a wave, dealing damage in an area and knock opponents back. This is followed by two more waves that deal damage and decrease enemy movement speed.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: The second and third waves will now also throw enemies in the air for .75s, and the second wave will knock them back.

Move 2.Name: Slack Off
Move 2.Description: Slowbro begins channeling a nap and gains a heal over time, healing 2% max HP every 0.5s for 3s. While Slowbro remains channeling its nap, all self-healing is doubled (including Slack Off healing). Slowbro can be manually or forcibly woken up from their nap.

Upgrade 1.Name: Amnesia
Upgrade 1.Description: Nullify some damage before it takes effect. For a short time after using this move, become immune to hindrances and gain increased defense. Also increase the damage dealt by the next use of Scald or Surf.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Also increases Slowbro's Sp. Defense by 125.

Upgrade 2.Name: Telekinesis
Upgrade 2.Description: Make opposing Pokémon float with psychic power. If used again, pull the opposing Pokémon toward the user.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the range and speed of the beam.

Unite Move.Name: Slowbeam
Unite Move.Description: Stare at an enemy and attack continually, dealing damage every .5 seconds for 3s and applying 'Bound' to them. This ability counters Unstoppable. Grants a shield (10% max HP) and makes Slowbro unstoppable while using this move.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 40% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Gluttony
Passive Ability.Description: When facing nearby Berries, increases movement speed by 25%. Doubles the HP restored from eating Sitrus Berries. Restores an additional 1% max HP + 0 x (Lv. - 1) + 23 HP from eating Oran Berries (from Greedent Cheek Pouch).

Snorlax.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, belly flopping forward to deal increased damage to opposing Pokémon and decrease their movement speed by 20% for 1s when it hits.

Move 1.Name: Tackle
Move 1.Description: The user readies a boosted attack and dashes belly first forward, damaging opposing Pokémon and shoving the first opposing Pokémon hit for 1s. The boosted attack from this move remains readied until used.

Upgrade 1.Name: Heavy Slam
Upgrade 1.Description: Has the user slam its heavy body down, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect and throwing them.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the damage of this move.

Upgrade 2.Name: Flail
Upgrade 2.Description: Has the user flail about, increasing the user's basic attack damage the lower the user's HP is. While flailing about, auto attacks deal increased damage, with damage strengthening for every 20% max HP the user is missing. Basic attacks used while flailing about also decrease the movement speed of opposing Pokémon hit by 20% for 1s; boosted attacks decrease movement speed by 50% for 1s.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the damage dealt by auto attacks used while flailing about.

Move 2.Name: Rest
Move 2.Description: The user becomes unstoppable and falls asleep on the spot for 3s, restoring 8% max HP every 1s over 3s (maximum 24% max HP). While using this move, opposing Pokémon cannot pass through Snorlax. This move cannot be used within an opposing Miraidon's Electric Terrain.

Upgrade 1.Name: Block
Upgrade 1.Description: Has the user spread its arms wide to create a wall and grants it a shield. Prevents enemies from passing through the wall and shoves them if they run into it. The user can use this move again to drop the wall early, becoming vulnerable to hindrances and returning to normal movement speed.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the user's Defense and Sp. Def by 35% while holding up the wall. Shoves opposing Pokémon contacting the wall from the front not more than once every 0.5s (maximum 8 times).

Upgrade 2.Name: Yawn
Upgrade 2.Description: Has the user let loose a huge yawn that lulls enemies into a sleepy haze, putting enemies hit by this move to sleep. Targets that are hit after their deep sleep is halfway through wake up immediately.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Decreases the movement speed of opposing Pokémon waking up from a full deep sleep by 35% for 3s.

Unite Move.Name: Power Nap
Unite Move.Description: The user becomes unstoppable and slams onto their back fast asleep, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and throwing them for 0.6s; then continues to sleep for up to 4s afterward. The user starts snoring for the remainder of the Unite Move, restoring 10% max HP over time while fast asleep (up to 9 times; maximum 90%), damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect with a huge snore every 1.5s and decreasing their movement speed by 30% for 1s when hit. This Unite Move can be used again before the user snores a second time to flip over in the designated sideways direction and slam the ground, dealing an extra instance of snore damage in the area of effect and throwing opposing Pokémon hit for 1s. While the user is fast asleep, opposing Pokémon cannot pass through Snorlax.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 40% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Pressure
Passive Ability.Description: Damaging a Pokémon from the opposing team below 10% max HP and frozen by Suicune deals an additional 15% max HP as true damage to the target (sufficient damage reduction can prevent the target from being knocked out). Using a move grants a shield for 5s (up to 2 times); separately increases the crystal gauge by 1 for 5s (becoming full when increased 2 times). Flooded areas created by Whirlpool or Surf remain for 5s; opposing Pokémon in a flooded area are marked as drenched for 3s. Freezing a flooded area with a regular move (not Unite Move) also freezes opposing Pokémon in that flooded area for 2s. Freezing an opposing Pokémon marked as drenched removes the mark; targets frozen by a regular move or by a frozen area cannot be marked as drenched for 3s afterward. Deals bonus damage when freezing opposing Pokémon with a regular move or by being in a frozen area.

Suicune.Attack: When the crystal gauge is full, readies a boosted attack for 5s as the crystal gauge decays to 0; increasing the crystal gauge refills it to full. Boosted attacks shoot water forward, damaging opposing Pokémon every 0.25s over 1s (up to 4 times), dealing bonus damage to frozen opposing Pokémon with each hit.

Move 1.Name: Water Pulse
Move 1.Description: Fires a pulse of water in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon and shoving them for 0.5s when it hits. Marks targets as drenched for 3s when it hits.

Upgrade 1.Name: Whirlpool
Upgrade 1.Description: Generates a vortex of water at the designated area, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect every 1s over 4s (up to 4 times), pulling them toward the center with each hit. If used again within 4s, moves the vortex in the designated direction, flooding the area it passes through. Marks targets as drenched for 3s when hit.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Reduces this move's cooldown by 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Surf
Upgrade 2.Description: Prepares an area for a big wave to pass through, then creates the wave and sends it in the designated direction after 0.75s, damaging opposing Pokémon hit by the wave and shoving them. The prepared area becomes flooded after the wave passes through it. Marks targets hit by the wave as drenched for 3s. Hitting a pillar of ice created by Icy Wind with the wave shatters it, damaging opposing Pokémon hit.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the damage of this move.

Move 2.Name: Avalanche
Move 2.Description: Creates snow to fall at the designated area for 1.5s, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect (up to 3 times) and decreasing their movement speed by 30% for 2s when hit. After 1.5s, drops a clump of snow at the designated area, damaging opposing Pokémon again. The clump of snow freezes drenched targets for 2s when it hits; freezes flooded areas it drops on after 1s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Ice Beam
Upgrade 1.Description: Fires an icy-cold beam of energy in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon and decreasing their movement speed by 20% for 2s when it hits. This move freezes drenched targets for 2s when it hits; freezes flooded areas it hits after 1s. A maximum of 2 uses can be kept in reserve, with a 0.5s cooldown between uses.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Strengthens the movement speed decrease to 30%.

Upgrade 2.Name: Icy Wind
Upgrade 2.Description: Builds up a gust of freezing air at the designated area for 0.5s, decreasing the movement speed of opposing Pokémon in the area of effect by 20% for 2s; then forms a pillar of ice, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and decreasing their movement speed by 20% for 2s once fully formed. The pillar of ice shatters after 4s, damaging opposing Pokémon again. This move freezes drenched targets for 2s when the pillar of ice forms or when it shatters. Forming a pillar of ice on a flooded area freezes that area after 1s. A maximum of 2 uses can be kept in reserve, with a 0.5s cooldown between uses.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Reduces this move's cooldown by 1s.

Unite Move.Name: Endless Ice Spikes
Unite Move.Description: Cleanses the user of status condition; then creates ice spikes in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and freezing those hit for 2s. After 2s, the ice spikes explode, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect again. This Unite Move does not directly interact with drench marks, nor does it freeze flooded areas.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Pixilate
Passive Ability.Description: Every time Sylveon deals or receives damage, increase Sp. Atk and Sp. Defense by 2.5% for 1.5s, stacking up to 6 times.

Sylveon.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage.

Move 1.Name: Swift
Move 1.Description: Shoots 4 star-shaped rays at enemies, dealing damage to them.

Upgrade 1.Name: Mystical Fire
Upgrade 1.Description: Create four small flames while leaping in the designated direction. These flames shoot towards enemies one by one, dealing damage and decreasing their Sp. Attack by 15% for 1s, stacking up to 4 times. Each time a flame hits, reduce the cooldown of this move by 12% of the current cooldown. After the first flame hits, subsequent flames on the same target deal 25% damage. Wild Pokémon will only be prioritized if no enemy players are in range.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the number of flames by one.

Upgrade 2.Name: Hyper Voice
Upgrade 2.Description: Unleashes an attack of multiple sound waves that deal damage when they hit. The damage dealt increases the farther the target is from Sylveon. Every time a sound wave hits, enemy Sp. Defense is reduced by 50 and the next sound wave's damage increases.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Pokémon hit are slowed by 30%

Move 2.Name: Baby-Doll Eyes
Move 2.Description: Stare at an enemy with baby-doll eyes, dealing damage and decreasing their Attack by 15% for 1s and decreasing their movement speed by 60% for 1s for a short time when this move hits.

Upgrade 1.Name: Draining Kiss
Upgrade 1.Description: Blow a kiss at an enemy that goes back and forth between Sylveon and the target multiple times. When the kiss touches Sylveon, restore  HP. When it hits the enemy, deal damage and decrease their movement speed for a short time. If Sylveon and the enemy move too far away from each other, the kiss will disappear faster than normal.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increased healing.

Upgrade 2.Name: Calm Mind
Upgrade 2.Description: Sylveon quietly focuses their mind and calms their spirit, increasing movement speed, Sp. Attack by 40% and Sp. Defense by 10% for a short time.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: For up to 3s after using Calm Mind+ Sylveon can block one move (auto attacks will not be blocked), negating the first instance of damage and granting a shield for 3s. Hinderances and status effects will still be applied.

Unite Move.Name: Fairy Frolic
Unite Move.Description: Jump into the air, removing most statuses and becoming invincible. The moment Sylveon lands, lose invincibility and immediately gain Fairy Frolic buff, while dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect. Fairy Frolic buff: for 10s, 50% of the damage dealt by Sylveon is converted into HP. No HP is recovered if the damage is dealt to shields.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Gale Wings
Passive Ability.Description: While at 85% max HP or above, this Pokémon's movement speed is increased by 15%.

Talonflame.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, creating a fiery whirlwind around the user and damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect. This boosted attack remains readied until used. Basic and boosted attacks lunge at the target opposing Pokémon.

Move 1.Name: Peck
Move 1.Description: The user dashes at the designated opposing Pokémon then pecks three times, damaging opposing Pokémon hit.

Upgrade 1.Name: Flame Charge
Upgrade 1.Description: Fly in the designated direction while cloaked in flame, attacking enemies in the path. This also increases the movement speed for a short time.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the user's Defense penetration for 3s and reduces the movement speed of opposing Pokémon in the user's path by 30% for 5s if this move hits.

Upgrade 2.Name: Aerial Ace
Upgrade 2.Description: Fly at the designated enemy, dealing damage. Also makes the next basic attack a boosted attack.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the damage of this move.

Move 2.Name: Acrobatics
Move 2.Description: The user dashes toward the designated location then attacks the area around them three times, damaging nearby opposing Pokémon. The user can choose to dash in the direction of movement afterward.

Upgrade 1.Name: Fly
Upgrade 1.Description: Fly up into the sky. Using this move again will cause you to dive to the designated area and attack, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect. Your next basic attack becomes a boosted attack. This move's cooldown is reduced by 40% if it hits an enemy. If this move hits a Pokémon from the opposing team, the current cooldown of this move is reduced by 40%.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Throws opposing Pokémon hit for 0.4s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Brave Bird
Upgrade 2.Description: Dive to the designated location while cloaked in flame, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect. Also deals recoil damage to the user when it hits. Performing a boosted attack within a set amount of time after this move hits will reset the cooldown of Flame Charge or Aerial Ace. Opposing Pokémon hit by this move are marked for 4s. If the user hits a marked target with a boosted attack, the cooldown of Flame Charge or Aerial Ace is reset and the mark on the first target hit is removed.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Reduces damage received by 25% per opposing Pokémon hit for 5s (up to 3 times; maximum 75%).

Unite Move.Name: Flame Sweep
Unite Move.Description: The user performs an aerial somersault and sweeps forward, becoming unstoppable, receiving 50% reduced damage, damaging opposing Pokémon in their path and shoving them toward the end of the sweep, then damaging opposing Pokémon again. This Unite Move cannot go through walls.
Unite Move.Buffs: 80% Movement Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Mold Breaker
Passive Ability.Description: When damaging an opposing Pokémon with an active shield effect, 30% of the damage dealt to the shield is dealt as additional damage to the target's HP. This Pokémon's hammer strengthens every time they hit Pokémon from the opposing team with boosted attacks or moves, increasing this Pokémon's Attack by 0.5% per target hit (up to 60 times; maximum 30% Attack). After the hammer is strengthened 20, 40, and 60 times; Rock Smash, Gigaton Hammer, and Smack Down gain increased range.

Tinkaton.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack after 12s, swinging the user's hammer in a circle around them, dealing increased damage and restoring 20% of the user's missing HP when it hits. This boosted attack remains readied until used. The time until the next boosted attack is readied is reduced faster when hit by opposing Pokémon's auto attacks. The hammer's size and basic attack range increase upon evolving into Tinkatuff and into Tinkaton.

Move 1.Name: Rock Smash
Move 1.Description: The user swings down their hammer with rock-crushing force, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and stunning them for 0.15s when hit. The stronger the hammer, the larger this move's area of effect.

Upgrade 1.Name: Gigaton Hammer
Upgrade 1.Description: The user becomes unstoppable and decreases their movement speed by 50% as they charge power for up to 1.95s, becoming fully charged after 1s, before swinging down their hammer in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and throwing them when hit. This move deals more damage and the throw duration is strengthened the longer it is charged. The stronger the hammer, the larger this move's area of effect.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Reduces this move's cooldown by 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Smack Down
Upgrade 2.Description: The user charges power for up to 2.4s, becoming fully charged after 0.8s, then uses their hammer to send a rock flying to the designated area, damaging opposing Pokémon at the rock's point of impact and decreasing the movement speed of those hit by 50% for 3s (decaying by 10% every 0.5s). The longer this move is charged, the farther the rock can fly. This move deals increased damage at maximum charge. If this move is canceled, it goes on a 2s cooldown. The stronger the hammer, the larger this move's maximum range.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Reduces this move's cooldown by 1s.

Move 2.Name: Fairy Wind
Move 2.Description: The user stirs up a fairy wind in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon hit and decreasing their movement speed by 20% for 1s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Ice Hammer
Upgrade 1.Description: The user leaps in the designated direction and swings down their freezing hammer at the designated location, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect, decreasing the movement speed of those hit by 50%, their Attack by 30%, and their Sp. Atk by 15% for 2.5s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Strengthens the Attack decrease of opposing Pokémon hit to 50% and the Sp. Atk decrease to 30%.

Upgrade 2.Name: Thief
