Upgrade 2.Description: Increases the user's movement speed by 25% for 3s, strengthened to 50% for 5s when moving toward an opposing Pokémon affected by hindrances; and empowers the user's next basic attack for 5s, swinging their hammer in front of them and dealing boosted attack damage to opposing Pokémon hit. If this Thief empowered basic attack hits a Pokémon from the opposing team, the user gains a Thief buff for 5s, increasing their Defense and Sp. Def by 10% per target hit (up to 5 times; maximum 50%). While the user has the Thief buff, the movement speed increases remain in effect; the user readies boosted attacks after 2s, and the time until the next boosted attack is reduced significantly when hit by opposing Pokémon's auto attacks. Pokémon from the opposing team hit with Thief empowered basic attacks have a separate Thief debuff applied to them for 5s, decreasing their Defense and Sp. Def by 10%. The duration of the Thief debuff on targets hit refreshes when hit by subsequent Thief empowered attacks, and the duration of the Thief buff on the user is refreshed when a Pokémon from the opposing team is hit with the empowered attack.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Strengthens the Defense and Sp. Def decrease on targets hit by the empowered auto attack to 25%; strengthens the Defense and Sp. Def increases on the user to 25% per target hit (maximum 125%).

Unite Move.Name: Kiss Bliss Kaboom
Unite Move.Description: The user first blows cute kisses at the designated Pokémon from the opposing team and their nearby allies, damaging and stunning them for 0.7s when Kiss Bliss hits a target. The user can then use the Unite Move again, leaping up forward and slamming their hammer down at the designated location, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect of Kaboom.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Natural Cure
Passive Ability.Description: When Trevenant deals or receives damage while at or below 35% max HP, a continuous HP recovery effect is triggered every 0.5s for 4s. This effect also reduces the cooldowns of Trevenant's moves by 1s every 1s. When this HP recovery effect ends, there is a 100s cooldown. However, this cooldown is reduced by 1s each time one of Trevenant's moves damage an enemy. This cooldown reduction cannot be triggered more than once every 0.5s.

Trevenant.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage to enemies and heal for 5% max HP when this boosted attack hits.

Move 1.Name: Will-o-Wisp
Move 1.Description: Shoot 3 sinister flames in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies hit and leaving them burned for 3s. This burn reduces enemy Attack by 10% and Sp. Attack by 5% for 3s. The first wisp to hit a target deals full damage, and subsequent flame hits deal 50% damage.

Upgrade 1.Name: Wood Hammer
Upgrade 1.Description: Trevenant pulls back its arms and attacks, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect and pulls them in front of Trevenant, leaving them unable to act for 0.5s. If this attack deals damage to at least one enemy, a follow-up attack will be available for 5s. This follow-up attack slams down a giant wooden hammer in front of Trevenant, dealing damage to any enemy it hits, and leaving them unable to act. The lower Trevenant's HP, the longer the enemy will be left unable to act. Every time this move is used, it consumes 5% of Trevenant's current HP.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: If an enemy is hit by the second hammer, the damage they deal is reduced by 20% for 3s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Curse
Upgrade 2.Description: Trevenant creates a cursed zone in exchange for 2% max HP per second for 6s, dealing damage over time to enemies in the area of effect every 0.5s for 6s and decreasing their movement speed for 1s, refreshing with each tick. The lower Trevenant's HP is, the greater the decrease in movement speed. While using this move, Trevenant builds up Curse gauge every time it deals or receives damage. Curse will deal additional damage to enemies in the area of effect when the Curse releases at the end of 6s or by manually detonating the Curse. If the Curse gauge is at maximum when it’s released, the cooldowns of Branch Poke, Horn Leech, and Pain Split are reset.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increased radius.

Move 2.Name: Branch Poke
Move 2.Description: Trevenant jabs in the designated direction; dealing damage, decreasing their movement speed by 40% for 2s, and healing Trevenant for 9% max HP (over 3 ticks as 1 tick per second) when hitting an enemy.

Upgrade 1.Name: Horn Leech
Upgrade 1.Description: Charge forward, becoming unstoppable, dealing damage to enemies and shoving them while dashing in the designated direction for the duration of the dash. At the end of the charge, enemies that were shoved are dealt additional damage and then thrown for 0.75s. Colliding with an enemy while charging recovers Trevenant's HP 3 times, and the lower Trevenant's remaining HP the more HP that is recovered. After this move hits an enemy, Trevenant's next three auto attacks deal more damage and reduce this move’s cooldown by 0.5s when they hit.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: After using this move, Trevenant's movement speed is increased by 30% for 1.5s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Pain Split
Upgrade 2.Description: Creates a link between Trevenant and a designated enemy for 6s. While the link holds, a percentage of damage that Trevenant would take is mitigated and instead redirected to the linked enemy as True damage. The lower Trevenant's remaining HP, the greater the percentage of damage that is redirected. If Trevenant's percentage of remaining HP is lower than the linked enemy, this move continuously deals damage and recovers Trevenant's HP every 0.5s. If Trevenant and the linked enemy are too far apart, the link will disappear. Using this move increases Trevenant's movement speed by 35% for 2s decaying by 7.5% per half second.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Duration increased to 8.5s.

Unite Move.Name: Phantom Forest
Unite Move.Description: Briefly becomes unstoppable and creates a cursed forest, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect and marking them, throwing them, and decreasing their movement speed by 50% for 2s. Trevenant and allies deal increased basic (and boosted) attack damage to enemies that were marked by this move (0.5s cd for each attacker). The mark lasts for 6s. Trevenant is also granted a shield for 6s when this move hits an enemy with the shield being strengthened for each enemy hit, up to 5 times. While Trevenant is shielded by this shield, HP recovery effects applied to Trevenant are increased by 50%.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Queenly Majesty
Passive Ability.Description: When a hindrance is inflicted on Tsareena; decrease the duration of the effect. Using a boosted attack or move grants 1 stack of Queenly Majesty to Tsareena. After gaining 3 stacks, the Queenly Majesty buff is applied to Tsareena for a short time, which allows one of Tsareena's moves to be reused (these uses do not share the same cooldown as the base moves), dealing increased damage and applying an additional effect based on the move used.

Tsareena.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, lunging at an opposing Pokémon, damage nearby opposing Pokémon and lowering the Defense of those hit by 20% for 1s.

Move 1.Name: Razor Leaf
Move 1.Description: The user pelts sharp-edged leaves in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon hit up to 3 times. The critical-hit rate of this move is increased by 15%.

Upgrade 1.Name: Triple Axel
Upgrade 1.Description: Tsareena spin-kicks 3 times in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies. The damage dealt increases each time a kick hits, and basic attack speed is increased for a short time after this move ends by an amount based on the number of landed kicks. Queenly Majesty Effect: Restores HP each time a kick hits. Queenly Majesty Effect: Restores HP per opposing Pokémon hit with each kick.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increased damage.

Upgrade 2.Name: Stomp
Upgrade 2.Description: Tsareena jumps up high and attacks enemies their feet. When this move hits, deal damage to enemies and leave them unable to act for a short time. Queenly Majesty effect: Restores HP when this move hits. Queenly Majesty Effect: Restores HP per opposing Pokémon hit.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the damage of this move.

Move 2.Name: Rapid Spin
Move 2.Description: The user dashes forward and spins, damaging opposing Pokémon in their path and increasing the user's movement speed by 30% for 1.5s when it hits.

Upgrade 1.Name: Trop Kick
Upgrade 1.Description: Perform a flying kick in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies hit and decrease their Attack for a short time. Enemies that make contact with the flying kick's wake receive damage and have their movement speed decreased for a short time. Queenly Majesty effect: Grants Tsareena a shield when this move is used. Queenly Majesty Effect: Grants the user a shield for 3s when this move is used.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the damage of this move.

Upgrade 2.Name: Grassy Glide
Upgrade 2.Description: Tsareena slides in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies hit and decreases their movement speed for a short time. This is followed by an attack in the opposite direction, dealing damage and shoving enemies hit. Queenly Majesty effect: Grants Tsareena a shield when this move is used. Queenly Majesty Effect: Grants the user a shield for 3s when this move is used.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the damage of this move.

Unite Move.Name: Queen Ascendant
Unite Move.Description: Tsareena leaps toward an enemy player and kicks it high into the air before showering it with a series of kicks while airborne, dealing damage to them. The moment Tsareena lands on the ground, recover HP. While airborne, the enemy that is being kicked and Tsareena are not affected by other moves.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Shed Skin
Passive Ability.Description: When Pupitar receives damage equal to at least 10% max HP, all status conditions are nullified and Pupitar is granted a shield worth 10% Max HP. This Ability goes on cooldown after it’s triggered (40s cd).

Tyranitar.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage when it hits. After evolving to Pupitar basic and boosted attacks (and basic attacks during Tyrannical Rampage) have an additional 5% lifesteal that is also active when doing true damage.

Move 1.Name: Bite
Move 1.Description: Deals damage to enemies in front of the user. If the enemy HP is below 50%—or falls below that percentage as a result of this move—they become immobilized for 0.6s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Dark Pulse
Upgrade 1.Description: Exhale a mist of darkness in a horizontal sweeping motion, dealing damage to any enemy hit. If the remaining HP of an enemy hit by this move falls below 50%, they become immobilized for 0.6s. If this move hits the same enemy again within 8s, it deals additional damage. If this move deals damage while Tyranitar's piercing strength is activated by Ancient Power, the 8s duration of piercing damage is refreshed.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Reduces this move's cooldown by 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Stone Edge
Upgrade 2.Description: Deals damage to enemies in a 90 degree cone, dealing more damage the closer the enemies are to the user. This move can be used up to 3 times with the cone widening to 135 and 180 degrees.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increased damage.

Move 2.Name: Rock Polish
Move 2.Description: Charge ahead in the designated direction, dealing damage to any enemies hit. If this move hits any enemy, all damage is increased by 15% for 3s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Ancient Power
Upgrade 1.Description: Charge power before releasing a shock wave. The shock wave deals damage to nearby enemies and leaves them stunned for 1s. While charging power: Tyranitar becomes resistant to hindrances for 4s, movement speed is increased by 20% for 3s (stacking 3 times), and Tyranitar gains a shield (stacking 3 times and lasting up to 5s). If any enemies are hit by the shock wave, Tyranitar is granted piercing strength allowing damage dealt to ignore enemy Defense and shield effects for 8s. If this move hits an enemy, a second shock wave can be released in front of Tyranitar; dealing damage to enemies and decreasing their movement speed by 30% for 2s. If this second shock wave hits successfully, Tyranitar is granted another shield. The strength of this shield increases for each enemy hit, capping at 3 stacks.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Strengthens the effect of the shields granted by this move.

Upgrade 2.Name: Sand Tomb
Upgrade 2.Description: Leap in a designated direction; dealing damage to any enemies hit and leaving them unable to act for 1.5s. When Tyranitar lands, the shock from landing creates a cloud of dust at the point of impact for 6s; dealing damage-over-time every 0.5s and decreasing movement speed of enemies hit by 35% for 1s every second. If this move is used again while Tyranitar is in the cloud of dust, enemies in front of Tyranitar will be pulled closer to it. Furthermore, while the user is in the cloud of dust, they take 15% reduced damage and can ignore the Defense and shield effects of enemies.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the length of time the cloud of dust remains at the point of impact to 8s.

Unite Move.Name: Tyrannical Rampage
Unite Move.Description: Briefly becomes unstoppable and explodes with anger, then goes on a rampage for 10s, gaining 50% tenacity for the duration. While rampaging, changes the auto attack pattern, dealing increased damage.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Inner Focus
Passive Ability.Description: When Umbreon would be shoved, thrown or left unabled to act, that effect is negated. Umbreon becomes unstoppable for 1.2s afterwards and also its Defense and Sp. Def are increased by 30% for 3s. This effect goes on a 40s cooldown after being triggered and is reset after respawning.

Umbreon.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack every third attack, lunging at a Pokémon  and dealing damage. This boosted attack also heals the user's HP. The lower the user's remaining HP, the more HP is restored.

Move 1.Name: Swift
Move 1.Description: Shoot 1 large and 3 small star-shaped rays, dealing damage to Pokémon and applying a mark to them after the fourth star hits that lasts 4s. When near a marked Pokémon, Eevee receives a 15% movement speed increase. When Eevee deals damage to a marked Pokémon, its next basic attack becomes a boosted attack.

Upgrade 1.Name: Mean Look
Upgrade 1.Description: Pins an enemy Pokémon with a dark, arresting look, slowing them by 30% for 2s. After a 0.5s delay, the enemy is surrounded by a black zone they cannot leave for 3s. While inside the black zone, Umbreon’s basic attacks become boosted and deal increased damage. The black zone is removed if the target enemy is knocked out. Mean Look is cleansable if the cleanse is used when the laser connects and before the area appears on the ground.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the duration of the black zone to 3.5s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Foul Play
Upgrade 2.Description: Charges in a direction, dealing damage to Pokémon hit and slowing them by 15% for 2.5s. If the charge hits a Pokémon, this move can be used again within 6s and it will note the highest Attack stat of all enemies hit. If this move is used again, Umbreon sweeps in front of itself with its tail, dealing damage to Pokémon hit, slowing them by 30% for 2.5s and shoving them for 1s. If the highest enemy Attack was greater than Umbreon's Attack when the first stage hit, the second stage deals damage using the noted Attack. Otherwise it uses Umbreon's current Attack.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Umbreon's next basic attack after using this move becomes a boosted attack.

Move 2.Name: Fake Tears
Move 2.Description: Feigns crying, dealing damage to nearby Pokémon  and decreases their Defense and Sp. Def by 20% for 2s. Also grants a shield for 4s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Wish
Upgrade 1.Description: Wishes for an ally Pokémon or Umbreon. For 2s, that Pokémon receives 15% reduced damage, then afterward, the wish comes true and heals them. If the targeted Pokémon is knocked out before the wish comes true, a different ally Pokémon near them takes the wish instead.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the damage reduction to 25% and amount of healing when the wish comes true.

Upgrade 2.Name: Snarl
Upgrade 2.Description: Becomes hindrance resistant and begin snarling for 1.5s, dealing damage to enemy Pokémon in the area around Umbreon and decreasing the affected Pokémon's Attack and Sp. Atk stat by 3% for 1.5s and movement speed by 15% for 2s. Also grants the user a shield for 2s. Umbreon is slowed by 30% while snarling. The final shout leaves enemy Pokémon stunned for 0.7s and further decreases their Attack and Sp. Atk by 15% for 3s. The small shout Attack and Sp. Atk decreases can stack up to 6 times and stack with the big shout's Attack and Sp. Atk decreases.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the stun duration of the final shout to 1s.

Unite Move.Name: Moonlight Prance
Unite Move.Description: Umbreon briefly becomes unstoppable, leaping up and absorbing the shields of enemy Pokémon in the area around Umbreon, taking them for the user. Umbreon then lands, dealing damage to Pokémon in an area-of-effect, and stuns them for 1s. For 5s, enemy Pokémon in the area around Umbreon are slowed by 30%, and if an enemy Pokémon in that area is granted a shield, Umbreon absorbs 50% of the shield for themself. Additionally, after learning this move and while not in combat, Umbreon continually recovers 1% Max HP every second.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 10% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Unseen Fist
Passive Ability.Description: When Urshifu deals damage to an opposing Pokémon with an active shield effect, 30% of the damage dealt to the shield is dealt as additional damage to the target's HP.

Urshifu.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with increased range every third attack, lunging at an opposing Pokémon and dealing increased damage.

Move 1.Name: Rock Smash
Move 1.Description: The user receives 20% reduced damage as they charge power for up to 2s, increasing power levels until reaching maximum charge after 1s; then punches in the designated direction when released, damaging opposing Pokémon hit. If this move is canceled or not released after 2s, it goes on a 0.9s cooldown.

Upgrade 1.Name: Wicked Blow
Upgrade 1.Description: The user becomes unstoppable, receives 20% reduced damage and decreases their movement speed as they charge power for up to 2.5s, becoming charged after 1s; then strikes in the designated direction with a fierce blow when released, readying a boosted attack if it hits. When uncharged, the cooldown of this move is reduced by 50%; and the user strikes in a small line area of effect, damaging opposing Pokémon and decreasing their movement speed when it hits. When charged, the user strikes in a larger cone area of effect, dealing increased damage to opposing Pokémon and dealing additional missing HP damage to those hit. Opposing Pokémon in the center line area of effect receive a critical hit and are shoved. If this move is canceled or not released after 2.5s, it goes on a 2.1s cooldown.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Strengthens damage reduction while charging this move to 40%. If this move is charged when released, opposing Pokémon in the center line area of effect are also stunned with the shove.

Upgrade 2.Name: Surging Strikes
Upgrade 2.Description: The user dashes forward and strikes with a flowing motion, damaging opposing Pokémon hit. This move can be used up to two more times within 4s of the previous use. Opposing Pokémon hit by the third use receive a critical hit and are thrown. Each time this move is used, the user readies an enhanced boosted attack which restores the user's HP per hit.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Receives 30% reduced damage while using this move.

Move 2.Name: Headbutt
Move 2.Description: The user dashes forward with a headbutt, damaging opposing Pokémon and shoving them when it hits.

Upgrade 1.Name: Throat Chop
Upgrade 1.Description: Dash in the designated direction and strike with a flowing motion, dealing damage to enemies hit. This move can be used an additional two times and the third time it is used, any hits are always critical hits and the enemy is thrown. Urshifu's next basic attack after using this move becomes a boosted attack and if the boosted attack hits, Urshifu's HP is restored.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Reduces this move's cooldown by 2s when Wicked Blow hits.

Upgrade 2.Name: Liquidation
Upgrade 2.Description: Deal damage to and decrease the defense of enemies in the area around Urshifu by 30% for 2s. When this move hits, Urshifu is granted a shield whose strength is based on the number of enemies hit.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Reduces this move's cooldown by 1s.

Unite Move.Name: Ebon Fist
Unite Move.Description: The user becomes unstoppable and the cooldown of Wicked Blow is reset when this Unite Move is used. The user dashes at the designated Pokémon from the opposing team, stunning them, then chooses whether to designate a direction to move or not. If no direction is chosen, the user pushes them slightly and delivers an uppercut, damaging the target, throwing them and stunning them when they land.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Overgrow
Passive Ability.Description: When HP is 30% or less; increase all damage dealt by 20%.

Venusaur.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, becoming a vine whip that strikes twice, pulls enemies between both vines, and stuns them for 0.4s, then applies a 20% slow for 1.5s.

Move 1.Name: Seed Bomb
Move 1.Description: Venusaur hurls a large seed to the designated location, damaging all enemies in the radius.

Upgrade 1.Name: Sludge Bomb
Upgrade 1.Description: Hurl unsanitary sludge to the designated area, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect, leaving them poisoned and decreasing their movement speed and Sp. Defense for a short time
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increased radius.

Upgrade 2.Name: Giga Drain
Upgrade 2.Description: Drain HP from enemies in the area of effect, dealing damage to them and restoring HP when this hits. Also reduces damage received for a short time. This move's healing is not increased by Venusaur's passive.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increased healing.

Move 2.Name: Razor Leaf
Move 2.Description: Venusaur launches a barrage of sharp-edged leaves in the designated direction, damaging enemies 10 times over 0.75s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Solar Beam
Upgrade 1.Description: Blast a bundled beam of light, dealing damage to enemies in a line. Against Wild Pokémon: Each tick is capped at 450 damage and the total damage is capped at 2250.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Reduced cast time to 0.6s and base cooldown is further reduced by 2s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Petal Dance
Upgrade 2.Description: Scatter petals around the user, increasing movement speed for a short time and dealing damage over time to enemies in the area of effect.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increased radius.

Unite Move.Name: Verdant Anger
Unite Move.Description: Venusaur becomes unstoppable to hurl a massive seed to the designated location, damaging all enemies in the radius and slowing them by 35% for 1s. The seed then splits apart into 4 smaller seeds, each damaging all enemies in their radius.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Cute Charm
Passive Ability.Description: When hit by an enemy attack at close range, make that enemy infatuated for a short time (10s CD). Infatuated enemies become enthralled and approach Wigglytuff against their will.

Wigglytuff.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing damage to enemies and stunning them for 0.5s when it hits.

Move 1.Name: Pound
Move 1.Description: Wigglytuff slaps the area in front of them twice (.3s apart), damaging enemies in a cone and slowing them by 40% for 0.5s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Double Slap
Upgrade 1.Description: Perform a combo attack in front, dealing damage to enemies and decreasing their movement speed for a short time when the attack hits.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Slaps 4-6 times instead.

Upgrade 2.Name: Dazzling Gleam
Upgrade 2.Description: Emit a powerful flash in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect twice.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Slows enemies hit by the first flash by 40% for 1s.

Move 2.Name: Defense Curl
Move 2.Description: Wigglytuff gains a 25% max HP shield for 0.5s and rolls forward a short distance, throwing enemies hit in the air for 0.5s. Hitting an obstacle while rolling will change the direction Wigglytuff is moving and reset the cooldown of Pound, Double Slap, or Dazzling Gleam.

Upgrade 1.Name: Rollout
Upgrade 1.Description: Perform a quick roll, granting the user a shield. Also deals damage to enemies hit by the roll and throws them. Hitting an obstacle while rolling will change the direction the user is moving and reset the cooldown of Pound, Double Slap, or Dazzling Gleam.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the amount of time enemies are thrown in the air to 0.7s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Sing
Upgrade 2.Description: Wigglytuff begins singing, slowing enemies around them by 15% for 2s per "Note" and increasing Wigglytuff's movement speed by 30% for 2.5s. Enemies that stay inside the song's effect will be put to sleep (when reaching 4 Notes) for 1.5s, and have their Defense and Special Defense reduced by 35% for 1.5s.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the amount of time enemies are asleep to 1.75s and the duration of Defense and Sp. Defense reduction to 1.75s.

Unite Move.Name: Starlight Recital
Unite Move.Description: Begin performing a recital and become unstoppable for 3s, granting Wigglytuff and nearby allies a shield for 3.5s as well as removing all status conditions from Wigglytuff and the affected allies and granting them immunity to hindrances for as long as the shield is active. When the shield expires, allies are healed for 50% of the remaining shield value.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Intrepid Sword
Passive Ability.Description: If the goal scoring button is held down, Zacian charges its sword  with Aeos energy. For a short time, its basic attacks become boosted attacks. In addition, during this time, Zacian can use a boosted version of one of its moves once. The longer the goal scoring button is held down, the more Aeos energy is charged into the sword, lengthening the duration of the boost effect on basic attacks and moves. This Ability goes on an 8s cooldown after it’s triggered. Minimum 5 energy is required to charge with a maximum of 10 (except for Unite Move). Duration for buff window is 3s for 5 energy, 6s for 8 energy, 10s for 10 energy. Charging occurs at a rate of 1 energy per 0.1s.

Zacian.Attack: When basic attacks are performed consecutively within 2s, additional effects are applied depending on the stage of the consecutive attack. If a Move is used, the time to perform the next consecutive attack is extended. Boosted attacks have an increased area of effect and deal additional damage proportional to the opposing Pokémon’s HP.

Move 1.Name: Slash
Move 1.Description: Slashes target Pokémon and deals a small amount of damage to nearby Pokémon. When this move is boosted with Aeos energy, its area of effect is increased, deals increased damage and also slows of Pokémon hit by 60% for 0.5s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Metal Claw
Upgrade 1.Description: Releases a shock wave in the designated direction, dealing damage to Pokémon, decreasing their movement speed by 30% for 3s. As the shock wave moves forward, projectiles from non-allied Pokémon it hits are negated. After releasing the shock wave,  Zacian charges in that direction and deals damage to Pokémon. If the charge hits an enemy, Zacian's attack speed is increased by 100% for 4s or 6 attacks, whichever comes first. When this move is boosted with Aeos energy, the shock wave's size and travel distance are increased and the intensity of the slow is increased to 45% for 3s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Reduces this move's cooldown by 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Sacred Sword
Upgrade 2.Description: Has the user slash around itself as if drawing a circle with the tip of its sword, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and slowing them by 20% for 3s. During this slash, Zacian briefly becomes unstoppable and reduces damage taken by 30%. After 1.5s the user then unleashes a slashing attack inside the circle, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon it hits and leaving them unable to act for 0.35s. After a flurry attack hits an opposing Pokémon, the user’s Attack is increased by 20% for 3s, and damage dealt by the user’s moves and basic attacks ignores 10% of the opposing Pokémon’s Defense. When this move is boosted with Aeos energy, its area of effect is increased, and the time until the slashing attack is unleashed is reduced to 1s.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Reduce the time until the flurry of slashes is unleashed to 1.2s for the base Sacred Sword+ and 0.45s for Boosted Sacred Sword+

Move 2.Name: Quick Attack
Move 2.Description: Zacian charges in the designated direction, stopping at the first Pokémon it hits and dealing damage. When this move is boosted with Aeos energy, it also leaves opposing Pokémon unable to act for 1s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Agility
Upgrade 1.Description: Dashes in the designated direction and increases the user’s movement speed by 30% decaying every 1s by 10% down to a minimum of 7.5% for 3s. Dealing or taking any damage extends this duration by 1 second per attack up to 6 seconds and bypasses the movement speed decay. When this move is boosted with Aeos energy, the user is granted a shield.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Further increases movement speed gain to 40% on use.

Upgrade 2.Name: Play Rough
Upgrade 2.Description: Leaps in the designated direction stopping at the first Pokémon hit. The Pokémon hit is dealt damage and is stunned for 0.25s. Zacian lands near that Pokémon it hits and deals damage to nearby Pokémon stunning them as well. If Play Rough connects, Zacian receives 25% reduced damage from the enemies hit for 3s after landing. When this move is boosted with Aeos energy, Zacian leaps further and through all Pokémon hit along the leap’s path. Pokémon hit will receive damage and be left stunned for the same amount as the base stun duration.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the stun duration to 0.75s.

Unite Move.Name: Sovereign Sword
Unite Move.Description: Has the user ready its giant sword, charge the sword with Aeos energy, and then slash in front of itself. The user becomes Unstoppable, applying a 10% self slow while the Unite Move button is held down and the user is in its ready stance. The longer the user is in this stance, the more Aeos energy is charged into the sword, and the more damage this move deals. If a set amount of Aeos energy or more is charged into the sword, the Unite Move becomes boosted, and the slash’s area of effect increases. This boosted Unite Move deals increased damage to opposing Pokémon it hits who have been buffed by their own Unite Move.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Volt Absorb
Passive Ability.Description: Gains 8% of damage received as bonus Attack for 4s (maximum 200 bonus Attack from 2,500 damage received).

Zeraora.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage and paralyzing opposing Pokémon hit, and restoring 10% missing HP per target hit. The movement speed of paralyzed targets is decreased by 15% for 2.5s and their auto attack speed is decreased by 25% for 1s.

Move 1.Name: Agility
Move 1.Description: Quickly dashes forward, and increases auto attack speed by 45% for 3s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Volt Switch
Upgrade 1.Description: Perform a high-speed dash, dealing damage to enemies hit and increase basic attack speed for a short time. Using this move again within a set period of time will allow the user to immediately dash back to the original position. This move can be used again within 3s to dash back to the starting location, dealing increased damage to opposing Pokémon in their path; and refreshing the auto attack speed buff duration.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the damage of both dashes. Strengthens the auto attack speed increase to 60% for 3s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Spark
Upgrade 2.Description: Leap at an enemy dealing damage to them. If using your basic attack before reaching the targeted enemy, instead leap at the closest enemy and deal damage to it. This move can be used 3 times before going on cooldown. This move can be used again within 4s of the last use, repeating the effects of the first use (up to 3 total uses).
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Restores 15% missing HP if leaping to an opposing Pokémon with an auto attack before reaching them with the dash.

Move 2.Name: Slash
Move 2.Description: Pounces toward the designated opposing Pokémon's location and attacks with 3 sharp claw swipes, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and throwing those hit by the last swipe for 0.5s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Discharge
Upgrade 1.Description: Release an electrical discharge, dealing damage to nearby enemies and grant the user a shield when it hits. If this move hits enemies that are paralyzed, it pulls them in toward the user once the move ends, dealing damage to them once again and leaving them unable to act. Pulls opposing Pokémon paralyzed by the user hit by the final discharge in toward Zeraora's position over 1s, stunning them for 1s during the pull; and dealing extra damage to them.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Decreases the movement speed of opposing Pokémon by 25% for 1s when hit.

Upgrade 2.Name: Wild Charge
Upgrade 2.Description: Charge in the designated direction. If this move hits an enemy, unleash a combo attack that also deals a set amount of damage to itself. If the user hit an enemy with Volt Switch, Spark, or a boosted attack before using this move, the number of attacks in the combo is increased. Hitting an opposing Pokémon with boosted attacks, Volt Switch, or Spark applies 1 stack of a Wild Charge buff for 5s (up to 3 stacks); each stack of the buff adds 1 additional attack to the next use of Wild Charge (for up to 6 total hits). Zeraora is untargetable while attacking; for 1.2s at 0 stacks, 1.5s at 1 stack, 1.8s at 2 stacks and 2s at 3 stacks from this buff.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Deals 50% reduced damage to other nearby opposing Pokémon with each attack.

Unite Move.Name: Plasma Gale
Unite Move.Description: Becomes unstoppable for 0.5s and launches a bolt of lightning toward the designated target; damaging opposing Pokémon in its path toward the target and throwing them for 0.5s. Once the bolt reaches the target; damages opposing Pokémon in an area of effect and throws them once again.
Unite Move.Buffs: 30% Movement Speed, 20% Attack Speed, 15% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Illusion
Passive Ability.Description: Zoroark takes the form of the nearest enemy. Zoroark returns to their original form when taking damage, using an auto attack or move, when attempting to score, or when recalling to base. Applying the illusion applies Unstoppable for 20 frames (1/3s). This ability has a 15s cooldown.

Zoroark.Attack: Becomes a boosted with every third attack, dealing increased damage.

Move 1.Name: Slash
Move 1.Description: Dashes in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies hit.

Upgrade 1.Name: Shadow Claw
Upgrade 1.Description: Dash in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies hit and leaving them unable to act for a short time. If this move hits an enemy near the end point of the dash, they will be thrown instead of being left unable to act.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the length of time enemies are thrown to 0.6s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Cut
Upgrade 2.Description: Dashes in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies, and restoring the Zoroark's HP.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Increases the amount of HP this move restores.

Move 2.Name: Fury Swipes
Move 2.Description: Dashes in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies. If this move hits an enemy, for a short time, this move can be used again.

Upgrade 1.Name: Night Slash
Upgrade 1.Description: For a short time, change the user’s normal movement to dash attacks. After performing a dash attack, the user’s next auto attack changes to a special auto attack. During this move’s effect duration, whenever Zoroark hits an enemy with other moves or special auto attacks, this move’s effect duration increases and the user is able to use Night Slash again. This move’s effect duration ends if the user moves when it’s unable to use Night Slash. During this move’s effect duration, if Zoroark hits enemies with a total of six moves and/or special auto attacks, Zoroark will jump into the air and then while landing, slash a set area-of-effect, dealing damage to enemies. Zoroark recovers HP if they hit enemies with this slashing attack. While jumping, the user is able to use Shadow Claw or Cut to move a set distance.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Descprition: Reduces this move's cooldown by 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Feint Attack
Upgrade 2.Description: Dashes in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies and reducing all of the user’s move cooldowns. If this move hits an enemy, for a short time, the location where the dash started is marked, and the user is able to use this move again; returning to the marked location and dealing damage to enemies. A new mark is left where the dash started. As long as there is a mark, if the user uses another move, the mark will move to where the move was used. If the user hits enemies four times with either Feint Attack or other moves without interrupting the chain of marking, the next use of Feint Attack changes. If this changed form of Feint Attack is used, Zoroark leaps at the designated enemy and deals damage to them before landing in the designated direction.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Descprition: Reduces this move's cooldown by 1s.

Unite Move.Name: Nightfall Daze
Unite Move.Description: Release dark shockwaves, dealing damage to enemies hit. Three shockwaves are released, and each one has an increasingly larger area-of-effect. Zoroark is unstoppable during this move.
Unite Move.Buffs: 80% Movement Speed, 20% Max HP Shield
